title: Driver/ Tech
description:
Reporting directly to the Field Operations Supervisor or Service Supervisor, the Driver/ Tech or Propane Specialist III is responsible for the safe and timely tank set-up and delivery of products to our customers. The Propane Specialist III will install/repair tanks and propane distribution gas lines from the tanks (exterior only), convert dryers and stoves for propane use, deliver, load, and unload propane into the bulk truck and end-use containers while providing exceptional customer service. Propane Specialist III will also be accountable for upholding the highest standards for safety in the delivery and handling of propane and for conducting regular vehicle inspections and maintenance.
  
  

**Major Activities:**  

* Transfer, collect, load, and deliver propane products to and from containers (bulk trucks, tanks, and cylinders) for customers. Initiate and conduct the asset verification process. Collect customer signatures/stamps and payments for deposit if necessary. Offer customer brochures with basic price lists and a contact number. Maintain a clean and organized vehicle.
* Leverage technology where available to Monitor and track the transfer of propane inventory, tank levels, and container sizing; accurately record and print delivery tickets for customers for product delivered; accurately complete and submit daily driver reports where necessary.
* Maintain equipment to the highest safety standards, reporting any mechanical issues to the Fleet Manager/Dispatcher. Conduct and, if applicable, document pre- and post-vehicle inspections, site inspections, and visual tank inspections.
* Collaborate frequently with the Dispatcher for routing and scheduling information. Notify the Dispatcher immediately of any product, customer, routing, scheduling, or safety issues to obtain their guidance and instruction on how to resolve the issue or situation.
* Provide Propane tank installations in a timely manner, ensuring compliance with all state/local codes and safety policies. Identify and correct any leaks from the tank to the equipment connection. Respond to customer emergencies as needed. Complete tank inspections and repairs at customer locations. Perform tank maintenance on spare tanks in preparation for installation.


**The ideal Propane Specialist will have:**  

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Minimum of one (1) year job related (Propane) experience.


**Required Licenses or Professional Certification:** some of the certificates will be trained once hired.
  
* CDL Class A or B with Tanker & Hazmat
* Clean drivers abstract.
* Up-to-date DOT medical certification
* Knowledge of underground and above ground vapor and liquid gas piping
* Willingness to rotate “on call” status during evenings and weekends as needed.


**Benefits include:**  

* Medical, dental, and vision insurance at premium rates with a Single plan at low or no cost
* Retirement planning and profit sharing
* Employer-paid short/long-term disability
* Employer-funded Health Savings Account
* Employer Sponsored - Employee Assistance Program
* Tuition Reimbursement - Access to in-house learning portal
* Propane and oil employee discount
* Much more!

title: Cocinero Descripcion de Trabajo
description:
SA Hospitality Group es italiano de corazón, la visión de Gherardo Guarducci y Dimitri Pauli, quienes han traducido las sensibilidades del viejo mundo para atraer a la clientela moderna de la ciudad de Nueva York. Desde 2003, SA Hospitality Group se ha expandido a un grupo selecto de barrios icónicos de Nueva York con sus tres marcas: Sant Ambroeus, Casa Lever, Felice con 24 restaurantes en Manhattan, Southampton, NY, East Hampton, NY, Aspen, CO, Milán, Italia y Palm Beach, FL.
  
  

**Propósito de la Posición:** esta persona es responsable de preparar la comida y del plato siguiendo las especificaciones del menú y las instrucciones del chef.
  
  

**Responsabilidades Esenciales:**  

* Pese, mida y mezcle los ingredientes de acuerdo con las recetas o el criterio personal, utilizando varios utensilios y equipos de cocina.
* Inspeccionar las áreas de preparación y servicio de alimentos para garantizar el cumplimiento de prácticas sanitarias y seguras de preparación de alimentos.
* Voltee o revuelva los alimentos para asegurar una cocción uniforme.
* Sazone y cocine los alimentos de acuerdo con las recetas o su juicio y la experiencia personal.
* Observe y pruebe los alimentos para determinar si se han cocinado lo suficiente, utilizando métodos como probarlos, olerlos o perforarlos con utensilios.
* Divida, organice y decore la comida y sirva la comida a los camareros o clientes.
* Sustituir o ayudar a otros cocineros durante emergencias o períodos pico.
* Hornear, asar, asar y cocinar al vapor carnes, pescados, verduras y otros alimentos.
* Lavar, pelar, cortar y sembrar frutas y verduras para prepararlas para el consumo.
* Estimar el consumo de alimentos esperado; luego requiera o compre suministros o obtenga alimentos del almacenamiento.
* Corte y recorte carnes como res, ternera, jamón, cerdo y cordero para servicio frío o caliente, o para sándwiches.
* Hornee panes, panecillos, tortas y pasteles cuando se le solicite.
* Mantenga siempre un comportamiento profesional con todo el personal.
* Siga los procedimientos de apertura y cierre.


**Requisitos Esenciales Minimos:**  

* La habilidad de trabajar como parte de un equipo
* Conocimiento básico de preparación de comida, experiencia en limpieza es bienvenida
* Habilidad de manejar el tiempo y capaz de trabajar bajo presión y manejar altos volúmenes de producción
* Habilidades de escuchar y aprender activamente
* Habilidad para comunicarse y comprender instrucciones en ingles para garantizar la seguridad en el lugar de trabajo. Capacidad para comprender, responder y interactiar con compañeros de trabajo, gerentes y invitados en ingles.
* Habilidades de comprensión de lectura y hablado
* Disciplina para seguir direcciones y estándares establecidos
* Habilidad de levantar hasta 30 lbs

title: Associate Producer, CNN Audio
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***

**Who We Are…**

When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the *storytellers* bringing our characters to life, the *creators* bringing them to your living rooms and the *dreamers* creating what’s next…


From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.


We are the now and the next. The power behind the people building the future. We are born from the spirit of innovation. We are created from the idea that people around the world want more, need more, deserve more. We are the home of the global digital revolution. We are CNN.


To see what it’s like to work at CNN, follow @WBDLife on Instagram and X!

**Your New Role…**

  

The Associate Producer (AP) supports the production of content for CNN’s audio department. The AP will work across all of CNN Audio’s podcasts. The AP will assist with the editorial and technical production of CNN Audio’s podcasts, including daily news briefings, weekly shows, and limited series. The AP will produce and fact-check content to align with CNN’s editorial standards. The AP will develop their skills scoring and engineering audio, gain an understanding of how to create a podcast from “soup to nuts”, and get to work with some of CNN’s household names.


This role reports to a CNN Audio Senior Producer.

**Your Role Accountabilities…**

* Take direction from the audio unit’s Producers and Senior Producers to develop and produce podcast episodes as assigned for various shows.
* Work closely with producers and hosts to develop ideas for episodes, including topics and guests.
* Edit podcast episodes and news briefs in Descript.
* Pre-interview guests and handle all booking logistics.
* Prepare editorial research and materials for interviews.
* Manage remote and in-person recordings.
* Collaborate with hosts and producers on episode outlines and draft scripts.
* Fact-check scripts and ensure all episodes meet the content, quality, journalistic and legal standards of CNN.
* Support social promotion, including by identifying memorable audio bites and drafting social media language for episodes you produce.
* Pitch ideas for future episodes and shows.

**Qualifications & Experience…**

* 2+ years of editorial experience, with a strong audio background. Bonus points if familiar with Descript, but experience using Pro Tools or Audition is sufficient.
* Strong writing, editing, and organizational skills.
* Ability to work with agility in rapidly changing environment.
* Passion for news, politics, history, and popular culture.
* Strong collaboration and communication skills; a true team player.
* Ability to thrive under pressure with diverse staff and talent.
* Flexibility with operating in a 24/7 news environment.

**How We Get Things Done…**


This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

**Championing Inclusion at WBD**


Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.
If you’re a qualified candidate and you require adjustments or accommodations to search for a job opening or apply for a position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.
In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. Actual salaries will vary based on several factors, including but not limited to external market data, internal equity, location, skill set, experience, and/or performance. Base pay is just one component of Warner Bros. Discovery’s total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $49,009.00 - $91,017.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and sick time and vacation.

title: Assistant Director, Nursing
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


Elmhurst Hospital Center (EHC) is the major tertiary care provider in the borough of Queens. The hospital is comprised of 545 beds and is a Level I Trauma Center, an Emergency Heart Care Station and a 911 Receiving Hospital. It is the premiere health care organization for key areas such as Surgery, Cardiology, Women's Health, Pediatrics, Rehabilitation Medicine, Renal and Mental Health Services.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Work Shifts**
---------------

  


7:00 A.M – 8:30 P.M


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


Under general supervision of the Associate Director of Nursing, assists with the planning, organizing, directing, coordinating and evaluating of nursing service and education programs of the hospital, diagnostic and treatment center, or a major unit within the Department of Nursing. Performs related work.


**Duties & Responsibilities**
-----------------------------

  


1. Assists in developing policies, objectives and standards of nursing service and education.


2. Assists in the preparation of personnel, supply and equipment budgets.


3. Assists in the development of administrative procedures and programs of patient care.


4. May have responsibility for planning, organizing, directing, coordinating and evaluating the nursing service in a major clinical division, or a home health agency in a hospital, participating in selection, placement and follow-up of patients transferred to homes.


5. Assists with the planning, organization and conduct of a nursing education program.


6. May assume responsibility for planning, directing, coordinating and evaluating nursing service on the evening and night tours.


7. Directs activities of Supervisor of Nurses.


8. Prepares and makes periodic and daily reports on administrative matters relating to staff and patient management.


9. Participates in the direction and implementation of a quality assurance program for nursing.


10. Attends and chairs regular staff meetings with nursing personnel.


11. Assesses nursing services by making rounds, conducting chart review and evaluating patient care


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. Licensed and currently registered to practice as a professional nurse in New York State, plus (2) or (3), below.


2. Master’s Degree in Nursing Administration, Education, Clinical Specialty or equivalent field and five years of satisfactory nursing experience, of which three years shall have been in a supervisory or teaching capacity; or a Baccalaureate Degree in Nursing and six years of satisfactory nursing experience, four years of which shall have been in a supervisory or teaching capacity.


3. A satisfactory equivalent of education and experience. However, all candidates must be licensed and currently registered to practice as a Professional Nurse in New York State.


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online at employment.nychhc.org.

* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans

title: Director of Clinical Services
description:
Springpoint is certified as a Great Place to Work as well as earning the distinction of being recognized as a Certified Age Friendly Employer and is a well-respected senior living provider serving the Mid-Atlantic region for more than 100 years. It consists of Springpoint Senior Living and its nine full-service Life Plan Communities and 19 affordable housing communities. It also includes Springpoint at Home, providing home care services, and Springpoint Choice, a membership-based program offering security for members.
  
  

Monroe Village is seeking an experienced Director of Clinical Services to join our team!
  
Monroe Village is a Springpoint Senior Living Community located in Monroe Township, NJ. We are in search of an experienced Director of Clinical Services to join our team. At Springpoint, the Director of Clinical Services is responsible for carrying out the resident care policies established by this facility for the day-to-day operations of the Assisted Living and Clinic Departments.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Assume responsibility and accountability for the direct delivery of Assisted Living nursing services.
* Direct the daily operations of the Clinic, including emergency response in Independent Living, oversight of the practitioners providing service in the Clinic, and coordinating Personal Care Services for IL residents.
* Collaborate with the Director of Human Resources to oversee the employee health program, including new hire screenings, annual testing, management of employee injuries in the workplace, and management of employee medical records.
* Oversee the community’s Infection Prevention Program.
* Conduct an assessment/health assessment on all new residents prior to or upon admission.
* Periodically monitor and evaluate each resident’s physical and mental status for significant changes as per regulations and established policies and procedures.
* Ensure that all residents have annual evaluations or physicals with physician certification as required per regulations and established policies and procedures.
* Respond to all emergencies while onsite at the community; be available to receive communication 24 hours/day in the event of an emergency.
* Ensure completion of a resident general service/health services plan based on the resident’s assessed needs.
* Review and ensure completion of monthly wellness checks on all residents.
* Monthly audits of MARs/TARs.
* Review all incident reports and coordinate care as needed.
* Conduct documentation audits as appropriate.
* Serve as co-chair of the Resident Review Committee.
* Conduct staff education and in-services on an annual and as-needed basis.
* Conduct department meetings monthly and as needed with individual staff.


**Experience and Education:**  

* High school diploma or equivalent required
* Valid New Jersey RN license
* CPR certification
* 2 years’ experience in assisted living, medical office, or long-term care setting
* Must have at least 2 years supervisory experience


**Comprehensive Benefits Package Including:**  

* Medical/Dental/Vision/RX Plans
* 401(k) with Company Match
* PTO and Holidays
* Flexible Spending Accounts
* Supplemental Life Insurance
* Employee Bonus Referral Program
* Employee Assistance Program
* Wellness Program
* Tuition Reimbursement


Springpoint is an equal opportunity employer. No individual shall be discriminated against based upon race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, creed, national origin, citizenship, political or union affiliation, disability, marital or familial status, Veteran status, or any other legally protected status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact Human Resources.

title: Philanthropy Manager
description:
**\\*\\*\\*Only candidates with education and experience(s) that closely relates to the two qualifications listed below will be considered for an interview.\\*\\*\\***
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Do you want to work in a friendly, professional and supportive organization? If so, COME JOIN OUR TEAM!**
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**4 WEEKS Paid-Time Off!, Birthday Holiday PLUS MORE!**
-------------------------------------------------------

  

Assisting the Development Director in fundraising efforts for the Community Hope Foundation and Community Hope, Inc. Responsible to develop and manage donor campaigns for the Foundation to include major donors and planned giving activities. Increase initiatives to raise awareness of the Community Hope Foundation and its overall purpose ad strategic goals. This individual will have cross assistance to the Community Hope Development Team which will contribute to the overall viability and sustainability of the organization.
 

* Develop and implement a comprehensive fundraising plan to meet the Foundation’s annual revenue goals in collaboration with the Board of Directors, Development Director and Chief Executive Officer (CEO).
* Identify, cultivate and solicitation of major donor prospects for significant contributions to the Community Hope Foundation in a capital campaign and major gifts fundraising approach.
* Plan and execute special events that engage donors and raise funds for the organization.
* Work closely with the Foundation Board and the Community Hope Development Team to manage prospect assignments, record contacts, and prepare board members, CEO, Development Director and Community Hope senior leaders with training, materials and strategies necessary to be successful.
* Monitor and analyze fundraising data to evaluate performance and adjust strategies as needed. Provide reports of events, fundraising campaigns and activities to the Development Director and Foundation as needed.
* Maintain donor database and donor files ensuring all the information is correct and updated utilizing fundraising software. Enter data for gifts and keep uniform records and information for all donors and produce acknowledgement letters for donor gifts.
* Oversees implementation of stewardship and recognition for all major donors.
* Coordinates and maintains positive relationships with other Development team members in Annual Giving and Planned Giving to maximize donor relationships and philanthropic giving to the Foundation and Community Hope.
* Functions as a resource in the coordination of Community Hope events.


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor’s degree in business, non-profit management, marketing or related field. Relevant experience may substitute for the degree requirement on a year-for-year basis.
* Five (5) years of professional level fundraising experience in a non-profit setting or for-profit trust management services with a proven track record of success in major gifts, corporate and foundation giving, and special events.Experience with fundraising software using Raiser Edge or other compatible fundraising programs.

title: Supervising Dental Assistant
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


Lincoln Medical and Mental Health Center is one of New York City’s premier acute care hospitals. Located in Downtown Bronx, Lincoln is a teaching hospital renowned for its Centers of Excellence, and a recognized industry leader in the implementation of state-of-the art medical technology and best practices. Our team of highly trained and caring medical professionals is dedicated to providing the highest quality health care that is safe, compassionate, culturally competent and patient-centered. Comprehensive services are offered in three major primary care areas: Medicine, Pediatrics, and Women’s Health in addition to more than eighty (80) specialty services. At Lincoln, the safety and comfort of our patients is our number one priority.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


Visit us at www.nyc.gov/html/hhc/lincoln.


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


**PURPOSE OF POSITION:**


Under general supervision of Director of the Dental Services or his or her appropriate designee, plans, coordinates, reviews, guides, trains and supervises the activities of a large group of Dental Assistants engaged in the activity of providing dental patient care services; Performs related work.

**DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:**


1. Plans, coordinates, supervises and reviews the work of Dental Assistants assigned to the work unit.


2.Coordinates, prepares and maintains work and shift schedules for the Dental Assistants.


3. Reviews work methods and procedures utilized by Dental Assistants and Performs Dental Assistant duties to assure optimal operation of the section.


4. Participates in the development and evaluation of training programs and instructs personnel in appropriate methods and techniques.


5. Assists in the interviewing, selection and orientation of Dental Assistants and provides on-the-job training as necessary.


6. Orders and maintains inventory control and establishes adequate levels of expendable and non-expendable supplies and equipment. Distributes necessary supplies to each Dental Assistant within assigned areas.


7. Establishes preventative maintenance schedules for all equipment and instruments in patient care areas and arranges for necessary repairs.


8. Contributes towards adequate and effective continuity of patient care by providing for sustained and efficient patient flow and productive utilization of Dental Assistant personnel.


9. Handles and troubleshoots patient complaints and grievances when necessary and instructed by Chief and Administrator of the unit


10. Maintains open communication and collaboration with multidisciplinary team in the practice


11. Performs related duties and special projects as necessary or as assigned by the Administrative and Medical Directors of the Dental Services.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. Graduation from a Senior High School or possession of a High School Equivalency Diploma; and  

2. Minimum of three years experience as a Dental Assistant with a least one year of supervisory experience with possession of a good degree of chairside skills and ability to transfer such skills through demonstration and verbal instructions; and  

3. Knowledge of concepts and applications of team dentistry; or  

4. A satisfactory combination of education, training and experience. However, all candidates must possess a minimum of a High School Diploma or equivalency.


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button or forward your resume, noting the above Job ID #, to:  

  

Lincoln Medical & Mental Health Center  

Human Resources Department  

234 Eugenio Maria De Hostos Blvd, (East 149th Street),

title: SSVF Case Manager
description:
**Do you want to work in a friendly, professional and supportive organization? Do you have a desire to serve those who bravely served our country? If so, COME JOIN OUR TEAM!**
===============================================================================================================================================================================

**~****S****upportive** **S****ervices for** **V****eteran** **F****amilies Program~**
======================================================================================

  

**4 WEEKS Paid-Time Off!, Birthday Holiday, PLUS MORE!**
========================================================

  

**Catchment Areas:**

  

* Passaic & Sussex
* Bergen & Hudson

  

A full-time mobile position providing case management services and eligibility screening to veterans in the Supportive Services for Veteran Families Program.

  

* Provides case management services including intake, assessment, housing stabilization, budgeting, financial entitlements/benefits, case conferences, referrals for adjunctive services, family meetings, advocacy, and liaison with other community and governmental agencies, landlords, real estate agents, and real estate brokers.
* Provides linkage and referral for mental health, substance abuse, legal, and other service needs.
* Provides eligibility screening to applicants and collects and maintains accurate and detailed records.
* Meets with participants in community settings such as shelters, jails, hospitals, and private residences.
* Documents service delivery accurately and timely while ensuring veteran confidentiality.
* Enters intake, contact, housing stability plans, temporary financial assistance, and other information in the electronic health record in a timely and accurate manner.
* Transports veterans in agency vehicles in a safe, cautious, and responsible manner.
* Conducts housing inspections to ensure safe and adequate housing for all participants.
* Attends and organizes outreach events in the community including outreach in encampments, under bridges, outdoors, in shelters, stand-downs, soup kitchens, houses of worship, or other places where the homeless congregate.
* Functions as a team member by covering shifts, communicating all relevant information to other team members, and covering co-workers’ duties as needed.

**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor’s Degree in Social Work, Psychology, or a related field.
* 1 year of case management experience, preferably in working with veterans or the homeless.
* Must possess a valid driver’s license, with a good driving record.
* Must reside locally to the assigned service **catchment area.**
* Bilingual (English/Spanish) preferred but not required.

*VEVRAA Federal Contractor. Request Priority Protected Veteran Referral. EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled Contact.*


**~We encourage people of all backgrounds and identities to apply including Native American, people of color, women, LGBTQ+, people of all abilities, veterans and veteran spouses.~**
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

title: Esthetics Instructor (Substitute Instructor with potential for part or full-time position)
description:
**Esthetics Instructor – Inspire, Motivate, and Cultivate new talent coming into the spa industry!**
Are you an experienced skincare specialist or Esthetic Instructor passionate about sharing your skincare experience and expertise with new talent coming into our industry?**About The Position:**
We’re looking for experienced skincare specialists and Licensed Esthetic Instructors to inspire and educate our students as a substitute teacher, Tuesday-Thursday 6-10 pm and/or Monday-Friday/9 am-3:30 pm. Instructors will have the opportunity to teach in the classroom and oversee our spa clinic.**What we’re looking for:*** NY State Esthetics or Cosmetology License (Must Have)
* Minimum two years experience working in skincare with strong knowledge in waxing and makeup as well as facials
* NY State Esthetics Instructor License (Preferred, but not necessary)
* Leadership and role model capabilities and ability to hold others accountable
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, professional spa environment
* Strong work ethic

**Why should you apply?*** Complimentary continuing education
* A company culture focused on serving, educating, creativity, and fun!

title: TEMP. Part-time Executive Assistant / Office Manager
description:
**Temp. Part-time Position**
============================

**Duration Approx. 3-4 month**
==============================

**24 hrs./week**
================

  

  

Provides high level executive support and manages all day-to-day aspects of the corporate office environment. Assisting with day to day office support operations and provides administrative support services to program and professional staff.


* Prepares and/or composes documents including, but not limited to, correspondence, reports, contracts, forms, financial documents, agency referral documentation and other administrative documents.
* Processes invoices and reimbursements as assigned.
* Interfaces with internal and external stakeholders requiring ability to keep highly confidential matters.
* Assists in meeting planning and making related arrangements for consumers, staff and Board functions.
* Monitors office supplies and coordinates purchasing of office and program supplies.
* Oversees maintenance of office areas and office equipment.
* Monitors and maintains agency database.
* Supervises administrative support staff to ensure efficiency of day-to-day office operations.
* Assumes additional responsibilities as assigned by CEO and VP of Development.

**Qualifications:**


* High School Diploma and minimum of 4 years related experience.
* Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office and Internet.

*VEVRAA Federal Contractor. Request Priority Protected Veteran Referral. EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled Contact.*

  

**~We encourage people of all backgrounds and identities to apply including Native American, people of color, women, LGBTQ+, people of all abilities, veterans and veteran spouses.~**

title: Marketing Community Liaison
company: Excel at Woodbury for Rehabilitation & Nursing
description:
**Excel at Woodbury for Nursing and Rehabilitation has an opportunity for a Marketing Community Liaison**


This is a Part-time position

**We offer excellent benefits!**

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

**Responsibilities Include:**

* Fostering relationships with physicians and discharge planners at hospitals to ensure knowledge of facility capabilities and programs.
* Conducting pre-admission assessments of the clinical status of a resident referral.
* Fostering relationships in the community and local businesses.

* You must be flexible, self-driven, accountable for results, and autonomous yet supportive in team efforts.
* Prefer someone with at least 1 year of long-term care clinical liaison experience

**Schedule:** Monday to Friday

**Job Type:** Part-time

**Pay:** Starting at $32/hr

title: Powder Fill Line Runner 3rd Shift
description:
The purpose of the Powder Fill associate is to participate in any manufacturing duties that may apply to the Powder Fill line.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Assist the line lead and set up mechanic to set up the equipment/machines for proper operation, including installation and disassembly of equipment and parts required.
* Prepare, weigh and package raw materials (powder).
* Follow SOP And GMP procedures.
* Set up/preparation/cleaning components manufacturing operations. (Some lifting required.)
* (Overtime) will be required to work by the company based on the department’s schedule.
* Must assume any position required within the department for coverage.
* Cleaning and sanitization of the production areas, including filling room sanitization between runs.
* Must be able to work until all cleaning activities are complete.
* Must be flexible in adapting to a work schedule that could change as a result in business direction.
* Additional duties as assigned


**Qualifications:**  

* Ability to write simple correspondence in English
* Prior powder fill experience a plus
* 1+ years’ experience as Lead
* Experience with Training
* Must comply with GMP requirements; specific functions and documents will be discussed in GMP and on the job training
* Must be able to lift 50lbs
* Must be able to stand for 8 hours
* Physical ability to repetitively lift, stand, climb, bend, etc. within a manufacturing environment.


We are drug free workplace, regulated by the FDA, required to follow Federal Guidelines; therefore in order to start as well as maintain employment, you must be able to successfully clear drug screening processes, which include testing for all illegal substances per Federal Guidelines.
  
Benefits
  
We know talent when we see it. For the right candidates, this is a great place to come to work every day. If it sounds like we're talking about you, we really hope to hear from you.
  
Piping Rock Health Products LLC is an equal opportunity employer.
  
We are drug free workplace, regulated by the FDA, required to follow Federal Guidelines; therefore in order to start as well as maintain employment, you must be able to successfully clear drug screening processes, which include testing for all illegal substances per Federal Guidelines.

title: Sampling 1st Shift
description:
Under the direction of the Manager/Supervisor/Lead Person, the sampling associate is responsible for the sampling of all incoming ingredients/bulks into the warehouse. Also responsible for adhering to the Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMPs) that are in effect assuring the quality and quantity of products sampled.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Perform major clean on room and equipment
* Takes samples from raw materials and bulks received following SOP’s and GMP practices.
* Maintain the sampling room in clean working condition to maintain product integrity.
* Gather samples based on the established sampling method.
* Prepares samples for submission to the laboratory
* Keep sampling records
* Reseals opened ingredients/bulks to keep material integrity
* Organizes and maintains materials and other components that are needed for sampling in staging area
* Ability to document and maintain accurate records in logbooks
* Ability to work independently as well as a part of a team
* Personal responsibilities for following safety rules, SOPs, and cGMPs
* Other duties as assigned


**Qualifications:**  

* Must comply with GMP requirements; specific functions and documents will be discussed in GMP and on the job training
* Must be able to lift 40LBS
* Ability to write simple correspondence in English
* Basic math skills required
* Physical ability to repetitively lift, stand, climb, bend, etc. withing warehouse environment
* Attention to details and a good sense of organization.
* Must be able to lift 50lbs
* Must be able to stand for 8 hours
* Must be able to work in a physically challenging environment


We are drug free workplace, regulated by the FDA, required to follow Federal Guidelines; therefore in order to start as well as maintain employment, you must be able to successfully clear drug screening processes, which include testing for all illegal substances per Federal Guidelines.
  
  

Benefits
  
PipingRock proudly offers comprehensive medical, dental, vision plans to all full-time associates. In addition, voluntary life insurance, flexible spending plans, and short-term disability plans may be optionally added. All full-time associates also receive group term life insurance and long term disability coverage. Associates are eligible to participate in a 401(k) savings plan with a generous company match.
  
  

Piping Rock Health Products LLC is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Customer Service Associate- Full Time
description:
The Customer Service Associate will provide comprehensive customer service to existing and prospective customers. In the Customer Service Department, the Customer Service Associate’s main function will be to answer and interact with customers over the phone by taking orders, identifying potential problems, assisting in any customer related issues to secure orders, and assist customers through refunds and replacement orders when issues arise. Other tasks may include reviewing and managing sale order queues, preparing mailings, handling customer inquiries, and other customer service related activities. The ideal candidate will have exceptional people skills, a friendly phone-demeanor and a passionate and positive personality.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Professionally handle incoming requests via phone from customers regarding orders, sales, products, problems, and billing
* Promptly and thoroughly handle all issues and customer inquiries
* Providing quality customer service to take care of our customers
* Using web-based systems to process orders, complaints, and requests
* Maintaining customer records by updating account information in the database
* Retrieving messages and complete customer call backs
* Various other customer service duties assigned by management


**Requirements:**  

* Prior customer service or phone skills a plus
* Must be able to navigate websites
* General computer skills a must
* Ability to learn and use different software platforms
* Outstanding phone etiquette
* Flexible schedule a plus
* Bi-lingual (English/Spanish) Bilingual strongly preferred.
* Aptitude to follow processes and procedures accurately


**Starting Rate:** $22.00/hr
  
  

**Schedule:** Mon, Wed, Thur, Fri 9-5:30 & Sat 10-6 (OFF Sun and Tue)
  
  

**Required Training hours:** M-F 10am-4pm for the first 2 weeks.
  
  

**We proudly offer:** Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K with Company Match, Pet insurance and more! We reward the hard work of our team members with fun and exciting company events, Picnic, BBQ Packages, Holiday Celebrations, and associate referral bonuses!
  
  

Piping Rock Health Products, founded in 2011, winning Long Island’s Top Workplaces Award four years in a row, is supported by a group of vitamin visionaries with over 40 years of industry experience and a carefully curated team of talented associates. Piping Rock is a global vitamin and supplement manufacturer with an unwavering commitment to creating quality wellness products. Being deemed an essential business from the start of the COVID-19 pandemic, Piping Rock has kept its doors open, production moving, and associates safe. We believe that family always comes first, and that the dedication of our associates is the key ingredient to our success.
  
  

We are drug free workplace, regulated by the FDA, required to follow Federal Guidelines; therefore in order to start as well as maintain employment, you must be able to successfully clear drug screening processes, which include testing for all illegal substances per Federal Guidelines.
  
  

Piping Rock Health Products, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Peer Counselor - Level 2
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


NYC Health + Hospitals/Bellevue is America’s oldest public hospital, established in 1736. Affiliated with the NYU School of Medicine, the 844-bed hospital is a major referral center for highly complex cases, with its 6,000 employees including highly skilled, interdisciplinary clinical staff. It sees more than 110,000 emergency room visits and 500,000 outpatient visits annually. Bellevue is an academic medical institution of international renown. We have served as an incubator for major innovations in public health, medical science, and medical education. Bellevue is a Level I Trauma Center delivering around-the-clock care in adult, pediatric, psychiatric and pediatric psychiatric emergencies as well as in the nationally-designated categories of cardiology, neurology, toxicology, and neonatology. In addition to providing comprehensive inpatient and outpatient state-of-the-art care Bellevue is a city-wide medical specialty referral source. Bellevue’s clinical centers of excellence include: Emergency Medicine and Trauma Care; Cardiovascular Services; Designated Regional Perinatal Center and Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (ICU); Comprehensive Children’s Psychiatric Emergency Program; and Cancer Services.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


Assignment Level I  

Examples of Typical Tasks:  

1. Assists the consumer with activities of daily living (e.g., setting-up household, public transportation, budgeting, shopping, socializing, parenting and other skills relevant to an individual’s rehabilitation goals). May make home visits.  

2. Leads or co-leads groups including, but not limited to, dual diagnoses issues, relapse and recovery and socialization.  

3. Assists the consumer in identifying their own individual warning signs of relapse and identifying and developing individual coping strategies.  

4. Provides supportive peer counseling with respect to mental health, substance abuse, rehabilitation strategies, breast-feeding education and other self-help opportunities.  

5. Participates in an interdisciplinary treatment and human services team in determining and implementing a comprehensive plan of care.  

6. Clarifies issues for the consumer and assists with the process of referral for treatment, rehabilitation, housing and supportive services. Follows-up to determine whether services were provided and used.  

7. Assists the consumer in completing applications and paper work for public entitlements and may accompany consumer on visits to agency offices and treatment programs.  

8. Acts as a liaison with community and governmental agencies.  

9. Facilitates the establishment of peer support networks, natural and social support systems.  

10. Maintains current, complete and appropriate documentation in the consumer record, prepares required forms, and may be required to use computer systems in carrying out these functions. Documents in Electronic Health Record (EHR) and writes progress notes for review.  

Assignment II  

In addition to performing the duties of Assignment Level I at a more difficult and responsible level, performs the following tasks:  

Examples of Typical Tasks:  

1. Acts as preceptor to Peer Counselors in Assignment Level I.  

2. Provides education training on recipient issues to mental health and other human services providers.  

3. Advocates for the needs of people with psychiatric disabilities within the mental health system and within service delivery systems.  

4. Participates in utilization review and quality improvement activities.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


Assignment Level I  

For Assignments in Comprehensive Emergency Psychiatric Programs (CPEPs):  

1. Certification, which must be maintained for the assignment’s duration, as a  

a. Peer Specialist (NYCPS) or Peer Specialist-Provisional (NYCPS-P) issued by the New York Peer Specialist Certification Board (NYPSCB); or  

b. Recovery Peer Advocate (CRPA) or Recovery Peer Advocate-Provisional (CRPA-P) issued by the New York Certification Board (ASAP-NYCB); or  

c. Credentialed Family Peer Advocate (FPA-C), Credentialed Family Peer Advocate Provisional (FPA-P), Credentialed Youth Peer Advocate (YPA-C), or Credentialed Youth Peer Advocate Provisional (YPA-P) issued by Families Together in New York State; and  

2. Satisfactory and documented completion of a formalized Peer Advocate/Counselor/Specialist Training Program or one (1) year of full-time satisfactory experience working with consumers of CPEP services as a peer counselor/specialist, peer advocate or in related human services.  

For Substance Use Assignments:  

1. Certification, which must be maintained for the assignment’s duration, as a Recovery Peer Advocate (CRPA) or Recovery Peer Advocate-Provisional (CRPA-P) issued by the New York Certification Board (ASAP-NYCB); and  

2. Satisfactory and documented completion of a formalized Peer Advocate/Counselor/Specialist Training Program or one (1) year of full-time satisfactory experience working with consumers of substance use disorder services as a peer counselor/specialist, peer advocate or in related human services.  

For All Other Mental Health Assignments:  

3. Certification, which must be maintained for the assignment’s duration, as a Peer Specialist (NYCPS) or Peer Specialist-Provisional (NYCPS-P) issued by the New York Peer Specialist Certification Board (NYPSCB); and  

4. Satisfactory and documented completion of a formalized Peer Advocate/Counselor/Specialist Training Program or one (1) year of full-time satisfactory experience working with consumers of mental health services as a peer counselor/specialist, peer advocate or in related human services.


Qualification Requirements (Continued):  

For All Other Assignments (Including Breastfeeding Education Assignments):  

1. Satisfactory and documented completion of a formalized Peer Advocate/Counselor/Specialist Training Program or one (1) year of full-time satisfactory experience working with consumers of peer services as a peer counselor/specialist, peer advocate or in related human services; and  

2. A High school diploma or its educational equivalent.  

Assignment Level II  

In addition to meeting the qualification requirements of Peer Counselor Level I, assignment to Level II requires:  

1. One (1) additional year of experience, as described in Assignment Level I above.


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs
company_description: We always put patients first! NYCHHC is committed to excellence in health care and the safety of people in the City of New York.

title: Software Development (Strategic) - Digital Marketing Coordinator (REMOTE)
description:
**General Description:**  

Phillips & Cohen Associates, Ltd., the global innovator in compassionate death care services with notable operations in the United States, United Kingdom, Canada, Spain, Germany, & Australia, is expanding its suite of end-of-life planning and aftercare services. As a result of this growth, the newly established Global Marketing Department now includes The Estate Registry, and its associated products. The Global Marketing Department is seeking a full-time remote Digital Marketing Coordinator, reporting to the Marketing Manager of Phillips & Cohen Associates, to operate the company’s Marketing Coordination and social media efforts; assisting with product expansion in the UK market. Product support includes Phillips & Cohen and all associated subsidiary companies.
  
  

Target markets will include direct consumers, financial creditors, estate & probate law firms, funeral homes, wealth advisories, tech firms, and other verticals identified through business planning. The Digital Marketing Coordinator will create and execute a strong social media presence through creative digital marketing strategies which inform, advertise, and attract public interest to the organization.
  
  

**Primary Responsibilities:**  

* Execute a results-driven social media strategy.
* Develop and curate engaging content for social media platforms.
* Assist in creating and editing written, video, and photo content.
* Maintain a unified brand voice across different social media channels.
* Collaborate with the marketing team to create and manage social media calendars for all brands.
* Monitor social media channels via our social media platform, Sprout Social, for engagement activity. Monitor platforms and competitors to share industry trends.
* Interact with users and respond to social media messages, inquiries, and comments.
* Review analytics and create reports on key metrics for all brands.
* Assist in developing and managing social media marketing and influencer marketing strategy.
* In conjunction with the appointed production resources, coordinate/liaise the production of all digital marketing content on various social media platforms, including, but not limited to, LinkedIn, X, Instagram, Facebook, and Reddit.
* Act as the first-line approver of any new social media marketing collateral created by any third-party production partner, ensuring adherence to brand standards, accuracy, and details, including the layout and visual components.
* Develop materials for specific audiences or demographics.
* Create and copy-edit various articles and thought leadership.
* Maintain strict confidentiality of sensitive information.
* Provide feedback on new trends, potential competitive threats, and potential product enhancements to provide increased value to clients.
* As required, maintain accurate and quality sales and partnership records and activity reports.
* Participate in the annual budgeting process.
* As required, attend events and produce live social media content.
* Other relevant duties, as assigned
* Flexibility to support UK/Australia colleagues as needed.


**Desired Qualifications & Skills:**  

* A college degree is preferred but not required.
* 2+ years’ experience in social media marketing, communications, and/or public relations is preferred.
* Advanced computer and digital literacy. Experience with a social media scheduling tool is preferred.
* Detail-oriented with excellent proofreading abilities.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Knowledge of social media management, content management, creative writing, and advertising concepts.
* Strong critical thinking, problem-solving, and research proficiencies.
* Ability to comprehend and interpret competitor strategies and consumer behavior.
* Ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines.
* Ability to develop strategies to resolve operational challenges.
* A creative mind with strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Experience in digital marketing and basic graphic design skills.
* Interpersonal and collaboration skills.
* Project management experience.
* Knowledge of common marketing tools and software.
* This is a full-time remote position. General hours of operation may be 8am-4pm or 9am-5pm Monday through Friday\\*
* Key attributes: Relationship Management, Emotional Intelligence, Energetic, Confidence, Initiative-taker, Strategic, Self-Aware, Maturity, Creativity, Project Management, Independent, Attention to Detail, Reporting, Self-Disciplined, Target Focused, Sales, Accountability, Autonomy, Prospecting, Partnerships, Wills & Estates, Probate, Death-planning, FinTech, LegalTech, Wealth Management, Succession Planning, Beneficiary service


About Phillips & Cohen Associates, Ltd.
  
PCA provides Equal Employment Opportunity for all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status, genetic information and any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws and reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of our jobs.
  
  

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

title: Manager Needed for Rooftop Bar/Lounge
description:
We are looking for talented Managers to join our team! MUST have high volume experience and be able to work late nights. Looking to hire at all our NYC locations: Mr. Purple, The Crown and The Campbell Bar.

Requirements:  
At least 3 years of high-volume experience

Must be willing and able to:

* Complete required training and certifications for the respective positions
* Assist General Manager with all financial aspects of the location.
* Master financial procedures
* Master computer register system.
* Authorize comps and voids for all service personnel.
* Ensure adequate evening prep and stock levels based on business levels.
* Maintain quality standards including consistency and presentation
* Ensure proper storage according to standing operating procedure.
* Comprehend and adhere to sanitation guidelines as prescribed by standing state and city codes.
* Perform a shift “walk through” in order to assess staffing, maintenance, cleanliness, zoning and any special needs.
* Complete opening sanitation checklist, assign sanitation projects to hourly staff and follow up with employees to ensure completion.
* Follow up with employees and co-workers to ensure completion of assigned projects.
* Assign employee work stations.
* Identify and communicate inventory and equipment needs to ordering manager
* Track high cost items according to standing operating procedure.
* Inventory and order appropriate supplies i.e. liquor, wine, beer, side bar, paper goods, cleaning supplies, general supplies, etc.
* Perform and extend an end of the month and/or weekly inventories.
* Create atmosphere including lighting, music, and temperature levels.
* Follow hiring, communication and terminating procedures.
* Uphold applicable policies and requirements of employment laws.
* Write agenda for and conduct periodic management meetings.
* Review and amend agenda for shift service meetings
* Master all job functions of both front and back of house employees.
* Make bank deposits based off a corporate approved schedule.
* Address guest complaints and problems effectively and courteously on an as needed basis.
* Master use of equipment and utensils related to the operation of the location.
* Work a variable and flexible schedule which may include nights, weekends and holidays.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Shift:

* Night shift

Experience:

* Bar/Lounge Management: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Medical Assistant
description:
**Job Description:**

**The employee will perform a combination of the following duties under direction of a physician; screen all patients for medical histories, recording vital signs, EKG. Recording X-Ray and or Sonogram in patient medical record charts. Prepare patient for examination and May or occasionally assist the physician as necessary during the examination. The Medical Assistant is responsible to maintaining Check-In/Sign in Sheet; confirm patient demographic and insurance information; to include verification of insurance; document appropriate information on the physician encounter form and or system electronic medical record; scheduling of patients for follow up as necessary; Collect and prepare laboratory specimens, phlebotomy. Ensure the appropriate disposal of contaminated supplies; prepare instruments for sterilization; responsible for stocking examination rooms; order supplies as necessary. Maintain communication with the various health agencies; immunization reporting; communicable diseases etc. to ensure patient information is updated.**

**1.** **Interview patient. Assist in the examination and treatment of patient**

**2.** **Operate equipment and perform EKG as indicated**

**3.** **Prepare patient medical record (chart) and or EMR with appropriate intake sheet**

**4.** **Gathers information, complaints, takes vital signs, performs various tests as ordered**

**5.** **Logging in patient medical record and or EMR Laboratory and Radiology results**

**6.** **Ability to perform directives as requested by the various physicians**

**7.** **Completing various forms for Medical; Physical; Disability; and Schools**

**8.** **Track inventory for supplies, vaccines etc.**

**9.** **Track temperature in refrigerator/freezer; complete appropriate forms**

**10.** **Setting up examination rooms for various primary and specialty care physicians**

**11.** **Moving equipment when or where necessary**

**12.** **Distribute appropriate educational material to patient as directed**

**13.** **Assisting in the authorization of prescription refills as directed by the physician**

**14.** **Recall or Rescheduling of patients as instructed**

**15.** **Trained in the area of Medical Assisting with certification from a Vocational/Technical or career program**

**16.** **Skills in establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with staff**

**17.** **Securing and ensuring Confidentiality of sensitive information**

**18.** **Able to communicate effectively and maintain patient records, files, reports and other correspondence**

**19.** **Registration, including insurance verification copay collection referral processing, authorization for radiology exam.**

**20.** **Intake of patients medical history prior to provider examination, complete time out form, point of care testing including nasal and throat swabs, CIR updating and STD reporting.**

**Requirements/Qualifications:**

**1.** **High School Diploma or equivalent and a minimum of 1 year job-related experience**

**2.** **Certification and Training from a Vocational/Technical or Career Program preferred**

**3.** **Medical Assistant Certificate**

**4.** **Customer and service excellence skills. Basic computer skills. Ability to read, write and speak English.**

**5.** **Bilingual English/Spanish preferred.**

title: Leasing Manager
description:
Paths is a full-scale, vertically integrated affordable housing developer, builder, and operator. Since 2004, the Paths team created and preserved high-quality affordable housing across the U.S. that enhances communities and helps residents build better lives. With over 12,000 units across 10 states under management and more than 400 employees. Paths manages a suite of capabilities spanning the entire property life-cycle, including: development, construction, property management, maintenance, and security.
  
  

**Summary/Objective:**  

The Leasing Manager's primary duties are to support the VP of Leasing with our affordable housing properties' leasing and occupancy responsibilities. In addition, the Leasing Manager will be responsible for overseeing the turnover of vacancies, securing lease agreements, managing the waitlist, and assisting with marketing the property to achieve leasing and occupancy goals. Therefore, the ideal Leasing Manager must have excellent accountability, communication, organization, negotiation, and supervisory skills.
  
  

**Classification:** Non-exempt (eligible for overtime)
  
**Essential function/Responsibilities:** duties include but are not limited to the following
  
  

**Marketing/Leasing:**  

* Work with Property Managers to manage multiple site vacancies on a day-to-day basis.
* Maintain awareness of local market conditions, competitors, and trends through active market surveys and physically shopping the property's competition.
* Assist in creating and implementing a plan for marketing the property and improving resident satisfaction.
* Meet individual and/or property monthly leasing and occupancy goals.
* Inspect models, move-ins, and "market ready" vacancies while on-site with property managers and/or leasing agents to ensure move-in ready condition.
* Maintain a professional and friendly atmosphere in the leasing office and other areas where prospects and residents meet.
* Prepare and qualify applications for approval based on properties' rental criteria and program requirements.
* Build rapport with prospects and establish good relationships with people quickly.


**Administrative:**  

* Assist with notifying prospective residents of application status.
* Assist with establishing move-in appointment for approved applications.
* Assist with completing all lease paperwork and collection of deposit/rent.
* Attend company meetings when requested.
* Prepare and complete move-in files and maintain/update files as necessary.
* Answer incoming phone calls and handle each call accordingly.
* Perform any additional duties assigned by AVP of Leasing.
* Display excellent communication skills and actively listen to prospects.
* Elicit trust from prospects by maintaining a warm, open and outgoing demeanor.
* Present self in a professional manner and maintain a positive attitude while at work.
* Interact with the prospect in a sensitive and approachable manner.
* Display an empathetic and caring attitude while helping prospects through the approval process.


**Requirements:**  

* Bachelor's degree required
* Minimum of 4-8 years' experience in the field of leasing
* Previous supervisory experience of office staff
* Minimum 3 - 4 years experience in marketing
* Proficiency with MS office suite - Outlook, Word, and Excel
* Yardi software knowledge a must
* Strong organizational, verbal, and written communication skills necessary
* Must be able to work both independently and in a group setting
* Must be able to multi-task and thrive in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment
* Conducts all business in accordance with company policies and procedures, Fair Housing laws, Americans with Disabilities Act, Fair Credit Reporting Act, and all other laws pertaining to Affordable Housing.
* Travel required 100% within the five boroughs


**Salary Range:** $90,000 - 100,000 annually
  
  

**Benefits:**  

* We pay 100% of medical benefits, for employee only.
* Dental, vision and additional benefit selections plan options also available.
* 401 (K) available plus company match
* Paid Time Off & Holidays
* Commuter Benefits
* STD, LTD, life insurance, dependent coverage


RRSG

title: Registered Nurse - Oncology
description:
We are seeking a Registered Nurse to join our Infusion Oncology team! This is a wonderful opportunity to expand into a high-end outpatient specialty field that continues to grow and evolve. We are looking for an RN who can demonstrate empathy and kindness and who wants to make a difference in the lives of patients. This is an incredibly rewarding specialty where the RN plays an important role contributing to the improvement of outcomes as well as patients’ quality of life. Experienced and new grad nurses should apply who will receive personalized training from a certified oncology nurse. We offer flexible working schedules and assistance with working towards their oncology certification. Duties for the RN will include being responsible for administering antibiotics, biologic infusions, immunotherapy and chemotherapy. The Registered Nurse will provide nursing care to patients and their families following the nursing process, established standards and practices. They will assist physicians and other team members in coordinating patient care and function as a resource for support staff (LPNs an. Medical Assistants).

**Essential Functions and Job Responsibilities:**

· Accessing the patient for bloods/chemo via central and peripheral lines

· Administration of antibiotics, biologic medications and/or chemotherapy/immunotherapy

· Provide initial and ongoing patient education prior to each procedure and drug administration

· Offer emotional support and reassurance to patients throughout treatment

· Provide monitoring and continued assessment throughout the infusion treatment and report any adverse reactions to physician

· Schedules patient according to their treatment regimen

· Strong triage skills for patient needs throughout their infusion as well as for patient phone calls

· Other duties as assigned

**Required Qualifications:**

* Minimum education: Associate Degree; Bachelor’s Degree is preferred
* Current NYS licensure as a Registered Nurse
* Infusion experience is a plus but we will provide training to an experienced RN or new grad nurse.
* ONS Chemotherapy Immunotherapy Certification or will assist candidate to obtain certification within 6-9 months after hire.
* Med Surg/Hospital experience preferred but not required
* ·Strong computer skills, EMR experience is a plus
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment

***The provided compensation range is based on industry standards and salary determinations will be made based on numerous factors including but not limited to years of experience and location of position.***

Job Types: Full-time, Per diem

Pay: $45.00 - $60.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid sick time
* Paid time off
* Pet insurance
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Oncology

Physical Setting:

* Outpatient

Supplemental Pay:

* Overtime pay

Experience:

* Nursing: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* BLS Certification (Preferred)
* NYS RN License (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* Purchase, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Car Electronics Installer
description:
As a Car Electronics Installer, you’ll lend your technical talents to installing new technology into customers’ vehicles. In this role, you’ll follow established procedures for recommending, troubleshooting and installing mobile electronics specific to each vehicle. You’ll also share automotive technology advice, best practices and recommendations with clients and other employees. Internally, this role is known as an Autotech Agent.  

  

**What you’ll do*** Install standard mobile electronic solutions including T-harness remote starts, speakers, dash cameras, backup cameras, amplifiers and in-dash units
* Verify vehicle make and model and communicate any compatibility concerns prior to installation
* Use provided guides to identify compatible mobile electronic products and complete installation projects
* Provide a high level of customer service
* Acquire and maintain required certifications

**Basic qualifications*** Current, valid driver’s license
* Have and maintain a driving record that meets Best Buy’s safety standards (e.g. minimal number of violations/accidents)

**Preferred qualifications*** Prior experience installing car electronics
* Prior retail experience

**What’s in it for you**  

  

We’re committed to helping our people thrive at work and at home. We offer generous benefits that address your total well-being and provide support as you need it, especially key moments in your life.  

  

Our benefits include:* Competitive pay
* Generous employee discount
* Financial savings and retirement resources
* Support for your physical and mental well-being

**About us**  

  

As part of the Best Buy team, you’ll help us fulfill our purpose to enrich lives through technology. We bring that to life every day by humanizing and personalizing tech solutions for every stage of life — in our stores, online and in customers’ homes.  

  

Our culture is built on deeply supporting and valuing our amazing employees who make it all possible. We’re committed to being a great place to work, where you can unlock unique career possibilities. Above all, we aim to provide a place where you can bring your full, authentic self to work now and into the future. Tomorrow works here.™  

Best Buy is an equal opportunity employer.  

  

**Application deadline:** Minimum of 5 days from the posting date. You can find that date above the job title at the top of the page.

title: Busser
description: The busser **works at a restaurant and contributes to a pleasant dining experience by cleaning and setting tables, restocking plates, or (at times) serving food.** You will receive hourly pay plus tips.

title: Hostess/Host
description: **Welcome guests in a warm and friendly manner**. Ascertains their dining/lodging needs. Seats guests and manage the seating chart. Monitors restaurant activity to determine seating and dining flow. Responds to guest inquiries and requests in a timely, friendly, and efficient manner.

title: Server/ Bartender
description:
A server's responsibility is **attending to diners before, during, and after their meals by helping them place, receive, and pay for their orders**. They also ensure the timely delivery of food and beverages by checking on their tables periodically throughout the service time.


Bartenders **work directly with customers by mixing and serving drink orders**. Their responsibilities include verifying age requirements, knowing alcohol pairing and tastes, knowing how to make traditional drinks, processing payments, managing inventory and cleaning bar supplies.


You will be paid an hourly rate plus your tips.

title: Associate Executive Director
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


NYC Health + Hospitals/Metropolitan is the community hospital of choice for residents of East Harlem, northern Manhattan, and neighboring communities. The hospital provides culturally-sensitive care in a welcoming and hospitable setting, emphasizing primary care medicine and utilizing the latest advances in medical science. Metropolitan delivers high quality health services with compassion, dignity, and respect to all, without exception. Since its founding in 1875, the hospital has been affiliated with New York Medical College, representing the oldest partnership between a hospital and a private medical school in the United States. Metropolitan is a part of the NYC Health + Hospitals, the largest municipal hospital and health care system in the country.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Work Shifts**
---------------

  


**9:00 A.M – 5:00 P.M**

  

**Job Description**
-------------------

  


**POSITION JUSTIFICATION**


This position is a backfill for the AED Ambulatory Care, who resigned. Under direction of the Chief Executive Officer, this position exercises wide latitude of independent judgment and initiative in operations and expansion of the community imprint.

**JOB SUMMARY**


Under the general direction of the COO, the AED of Ambulatory Care Services is responsible for managing the day-to-day operation of the Ambulatory Care Division’s various programs and determine objectives consistent with established goals, including management of division staff, contractors, subcontractors, facilities, and other resources of the department.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**


Develop, establish and implement the philosophy, objectives, policies and standards of administrative services.  

Collaborate with all levels of the organization, and departments as necessary, to coordinate development and execution of a Performance Improvement Plan ("Pl Plan") and to ensure it is conceived and implemented in accordance with the Breakthrough Business System and is aligned with HHC and hospital strategic goals for the patient experience, clinical safety, quality, financial performance and market share.  

Coordinate functions of Administrative Services with other disciplines and other departmental staff.  

Direct development and execution of performance improvement projects for Ambulatory Care Services so that they aligned with the goals of the Quality Management Department and the Pl Plan.


Review and, when necessary, direct revision of administrative procedures and systems to address new business needs, public policy changes, and / or regulatory requirements identified by the hospital or HHC.  

Ensure that staff competencies meet the hospital's business standards through a system of continuing performance evaluation.


Direct the preparation of budgets for personnel, supplies and equipment for all divisions within inpatient operations.  

Maintain cost awareness in the administration of personnel, supplies and equipment expenditures for all divisions within inpatient operations. Oversee the utilization of appropriate progressive disciplinary action for administrative staff performance issues using Just Culture principles.  

Collaborate with the hospital's Regulatory Affairs and Quality Management Department to ensure that Administrative Services adhere to all accreditation standards and government regulations.  

Conduct regular staff meetings with Personnel assigned to each of the Divisions with Inpatient Services.  

Attend departmental and hospital-wide meetings as required and ensures dissemination of pertinent information to appropriate staff.  

Provide the Leadership with necessary monitoring reports.  

Plan, develop and, when appropriate, conduct training programs to maintain proficiency of administrative staff in the execution of new or revised processes and/ or systems.  

In collaboration with the hospital's Human Resources Department, participate in recruitment and retention processes for administrative staff of the Ambulatory Care Divisions.  

Meet all hospital compliance standards and requirements of professional conduct including, but not limited to: (a) annual physical; (b) competency assessments; (c) annual mandatory trainings, (d) fire and safety training; and other requirements as specified.  

Develop personal industry knowledge and professional skills and capabilities by attending training sessions and other educational conferences and/ or seminars relevant to area of specialty.  

Develop and / or update policies and procedures and participate in development and updating of relevant hospital-wide policies and procedures, ensuring that administrative staff follow them.  

Represent the Leadership at meetings when necessary and, in his or her temporary absence, assume his or her duties as directed.  

Represents hospital in system wide initiatives and projects when necessary.  

Monitors continuous data analysis for all services and provides reports to the specific teams.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. A Master’s Degree with a specialization in Hospital Administration, Health Care Administration, Administrative Medicine or in Public Health when conferred for a program in Hospital Administration from an accredited college or university; and,  

  

2. Six years of high-level responsible experience in Hospital Administration, Business Administration, Public Administration or an equivalent field, or as an Assistant to a Hospital Administrator in a position of direct responsibility for operations of a major part or all of a hospital, including substantial exposure in meeting community health needs; or,  

  

3. An equivalent combination of training, education and experience in related fields and educational disciplines; and,  

  

4. Thorough knowledge of the fundamentals of hospital organization, administration and standards, regulations and laws applicable to hospital operations, knowledge of business and human resources administration principles, management functions, management processes and functions of hospital departments, and ability to direct and supervise personnel.


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

  


**Vacancy Control Board Number**
--------------------------------

  


MET-07052024-0026
