title: CES Bilingual Case Manager (Full-Time)
description:
**or over 75 years, Catholic Family and Community Services, has provided at little or no cost, a full spectrum of services to individuals who are oppressed, families who are in crisis and communities who are disenfranchised.**


**Located throughout the New Jersey Counties of Passaic, Morris and Sussex, we provide professionally based social services, including Behavioral Health Programs, Veterans Services, Children’s Programs, Senior and Aging Services and much more.**  

  

CES Bilingual Case Manager


Hours: Monday - Friday 8:30am - 4:30pm


Location: Paterson, NJ


General Summary:


The program is a collaborative partner under the Passaic County Continuum of Care committed to addressing the needs of homeless or potentially homeless families in Passaic County. The case manager functions as a conduit to process assistance applications and ensure financial assistance provided. The case manager is responsible for the coordination, development and planning goals to promote self-sufficiency.


Duties and Responsibilities:


Case managers maybe assigned walk-in duties for CES programs, in addition to caseload.


Meet face to face with clients. Determine client needs based on interview, develop a budget, develop Housing Stabilization Plan, provide housing stabilization services intended to meet basic essential needs; including advocacy and referral; Assessing eligibility for entitlements/financial assistance.


Work with clients to identify long-term solutions to recurring problems.


Develop and maintain accurate case management plan, case files and monthly statistical reports. Enter all client information into HMIS within 48-72 of contact.


Provide follow up- services as needed. Including housing inspection checklist providing financial assistance.


Work independent with accuracy and complete adherence to policy and procedure.


Qualifications:


College degree or equivalent work experience. Prior work experience in human services preferred.


Minimum 1-year direct case experience.


Bilingual: Spanish speaking required.


Proficient in Microsoft Office (Work, Excel, PowerPoint).


Ability to serve as a liaison between consumer and third parties.


Good writing and speaking skills.


Benefits:


For full time positions, we offer medical, vision, dental, life and supplemental life insurance. Accidental and Critical Illness Insurance, 403B with employer match and Paid Time off (PTO)


**Catholic Charities is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) – we will discontinue the use of any recruitment resources which engages in direct or indirect discriminatory practices.**

title: Director Gruenert Center Special Needs - 40 Hrs
description:
**Department for Persons with Disabilities (DPD)**


**Are you passionate about making a difference in others' lives? Then come join the DPD team!**

**Department for Persons with Disabilities (DPD) is one of the largest Catholic Charities Agencies providing care for adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities in the United States. We are looking for dedicated, caring and compassionate people to work in our Group Homes.**


REPORTS TO: Executive Director


SUPERVISES: Program Staff, Service Recipients, Plan Coordinator and Volunteers


HOURS: This is an exempt full time position, generally requiring 40 hours, 8:45AM-4:45PM however flexibility is required to meet the needs of the program.


QUALIFICATIONS:


High School diploma or equivalent required, B.A. in Special Education or related field preferred and minimum two years supervisory experience required and one year of experience working with people with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Must have a driver's license, which is valid in the State of New Jersey and points on license not to exceed 5 points. Required to drive agency vehicles to transport service recipients on a regular basis. Demonstrated ability to establish and maintain effective communication and interpersonal relationships with members of the interdisciplinary team, service recipients, families, visitors and staff.?Knowledge of and proficiency with computer programs is required.


* Characteristics: Must possess good organizational skills and be able to complete work independently. Must demonstrate the ability to assume leadership and ensure positive patient outcomes within a person-centered program. Ability to use good judgment and to handle a crisis effectively, be creative, flexible, sensitive to the cultural differences present in people living or working in the program, pleasant and non-abrasive, willing to learn. Should have good health and energy.



WORK LOCATIONS: Gruenert Center and community. May be redeployed to DPD’s residential programs in inclement weather or during Center closures, as needed.


PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: This program requires significant physical assistance to be provided to all service recipients. Employee is responsible for the care of high acuity individuals including non-ambulatory individuals. Must be able to assist with mobility, wheelchair use including pushing manual wheelchairs, transferring individuals in and out of wheelchairs, and securing wheelchairs in vehicles. Lifts and transfers are done using provided equipment but require employee to reposition individuals into slings where individuals cannot participate in transfer, repositioning or bearing any weight. Assist with toileting of incontinent individuals including use of lifts and slings for transfer in bathrooms as well as changing incontinence briefs when soiled for both ambulatory and non-ambulatory individuals. Must be able to walk, speak the language of the service recipients, lift and push wheelchairs, give physical assistance to people as needed. Assist in all activities of daily living (ADL’s) including but not limited to bathing/showering (if needed), grooming/personal hygiene needs, oral hygiene, dressing, meal preparation/supervision and providing individual assistance to residents in accordance with prescribed diets. Complete laundry for service recipients based on their support needs while at the Center. Must be able to safely evacuate all service recipients within prescribed evacuation timeframe. Must be able to meet the physical requirements of CPR.


MENTAL AND EMOTIONAL REQUIREMENTS: Must be able to remain calm even in a crisis. Must be patient and supportive and treat each person living in the home with dignity. Work with indiviuals with behavior support plans and assure all plan provisions are carried out and documented as per agency behaviorist. Must be able to manage multiple priorities in an effective manner. Must be aware of the impact that modeling has on staff and on persons who have an intellectual or developmental disability.


TRAINING REQUIREMENTS: To complete the orientation process and to fulfill all required training within the specified time period. These include, but are not limited to all state mandated trainings via the College of Direct Support, as well as agency specific/Catholic Charities/Diocese of Paterson trainings, as directed to do so by the supervisor or Human Resources staff. Must renew certifications as required. Must meet the annual continuing education training requirements. Program Directors are encouraged to participate in additional trainings that are available, including but not limited to: Supervisory Trainings offered by Catholic Charities and the College of Direct Support Frontline and Supervisory Management courses and other trainings as assigned.


JOB SUMMARY: The primary responsibility of the Director of Special Needs is to oversee the provision of care to the service recipients of Gruenert Center Special Needs to ensure that they receive the highest quality of care and to educate staff to understand individual needs to work effectively with each person. He/She will insure effective implementation of the program to attain optimal levels of functioning and/or support of the client. Assure compliance with all standards as defined in the Division of Delopmental Disabilities Spports Program Policies and Procedures Manual. In addition to the standards set forth in this manual, the Director must support and implement individual behavior plans, as applicable, and comply with relevant licensing and/or certification standards. He/She will cooperate with agency's?administration and/or Division and Department staff in any inquiry, inspection or investigation.


PLACE IN ORGANIZATION: This is a Department Head position. This position carries authority over employees working in the Center and service recipients. as specified in support plans.


PROFESSIONAL RELATIONSHIPS: This position requires working cooperatively with the Administration, Directors and Associate Directors, all staff, volunteers, family members, representatives of outside agencies, and medical professionals and must always represent the agency in a positive, professional manner.


PERFORMANCE AND QUALITY IMPROVEMENT (PQI): To be an active participant in the Agency PQI process and to foster effective communication on all levels of the Agency. New and creative ideas will be communicated to the Executive Director or Associate Executive Directors at any time and formally during the agency planning process. Written suggestions for changing the job description may be submitted at any time, and will be reviewed by the administration.


JOB TASKS:


1. To provide training and supervision to staff and Volunteers.


* To orientate all new staff according to agency procedures.


* To supervise staff in all aspects of their job responsibilities and provide feedback to improve job performance.


* To maintain job performance notes and to complete annual written staff evaluations.


* To address issues that affect staff morale.


* To supervise volunteers and to communicate any issue regarding a volunteer to the Director of Pastoral Care.


* To monitor the completion and accuracy of documentation according to policy, in a timely fashion, including but not limited to: ISP documentation and notes review/approval, Behavior Plan Charts, Medication Administration record and assuring an adequate supply of medication at all times, Incident Reports, Daily Activities Log, Staff Log, Financial Vouchers, Nutritional Charting (when applicable), Annual Update, and Fire Drill Reports.


* To terminate staff according to agency policy of progressive discipline, in accordance



with guidance and polices from Catholic Charities Human Resources Team.


* Ensure full compliance with all laws, Medicaid standards and other regulatory



requirements.


2. To ensure highest possible quality of services.


To participate in the development of the ISP based on the preferences and needs of each individual and to maximize their participation in the process.


Ensure that day habilitation activities follow these general guidelines:


Be Age-Appropriate;


Offer Variety & Choice;


Emphasize Community Experiences; and


Focus on Small Groups and Individual Interactions and Experiences.


To promote personal dignity, provide assistance and/or supervision in all aspects of daily living including but not limited to: mobility, wheelchair use, use of slings and lifts for transfers, personal hygiene, bathing/showering (as needed), toileting/changing incontinence briefs, oral hygiene, grooming, clothing/dressing, meal preparation & assistance with meals in accordance with prescribed diets, cleaning, laundry (if needed), community participation, and leisure activities both in the Center and in the community.


Ensure behavior support plans are followed as written by all staff and ensure related documentation is completed as required in a timely fashion.


To promote personal relationships both within and outside the Center.


To encourage and support individuals to advocate on their own behalf.


To ensure each individual maintains optimum health by immediately responding to any signs of ill health and monitoring any known health issues.


mmunication any medical needs and follow-up documentation.


To ensure that medications are administered as prescribed and to assure that medication is appropriate through effective communication with the physician.


To drive residents to activities and community resources, using program vehicles in a safe and legal manner, and to follow agency Vehicle Procedures.


To assist residents with establishing a budget and managing their money.


3. Facility Management Responsibilities.


Communicate and follow-up on facility needs according to agency procedure, including but not limited to: electrical, plumbing, appliances, vehicles, furniture, painting, floring, heat, air conditioning, snow removal, exterior of building, roof/leaks.


To maintain the appearance of the Center according to agency standards.


To manage care, maintenance and service of agency vehicles.


4. To communicate effectively with Administration, co-workers, service recipients and outside contacts.


* To maintain ongoing communication with Executive Director and Associate Executive Director regarding all positive events as well as problems which arise in the day to day management of the Center.


* Schedule and hold regular staff meetings, communicating all policy issues promptly, and ensuring that minutes are taken.


* To read and respond to all logs, email, other directives and communications promptly.


* To maintain ongoing communication with staff and residents, to review all programming, questions and concerns. To deal effectively with these situations as they arise.


* To maintain ongoing communication with DPD residential programs, external provider agencies, support coordination agencies, DDD representatives, families and other individual parties.


* To attend meetings as required: Agency meetings, IDT meetings and ISP meetings.



5. To complete administrative tasks in a timely and accurate manner.


* To review incident reports, fee for service documentation/notes, daily logs/activities, behavior plan charts, ISP documentation and other checklists.


* To coordinate weekly staff schedule.


* To plan and/or evaluate the scheduled activities to ensure appropriateness of activity, adequate staff, adequate funds, benefit to the individuals.


* To review payroll and submit on schedule.


* To complete and/or review of monthly reports. Complete quarterly and annual reviews in fee for service software according to established timeframes.


* To complete Program Funds reports according to agency procedures and timelines. To monitor and safeguard program funds/petty cash by following the Program Funds procedures.


* To operate the program effectively within the program’s budget.


* To report incidents according to Agency and DDD procedures.


* To complete monthly PQI reports and actively participate in Agency PQI process.



Director is expected to become proficient in all administrative duties of the program and all online and server-based software applications.


To review all referrals of new service recipients and participate in intake process with the DPD intake team.


6. To interview, hire and complete orientation with applicants and new hires.


To interview applicants in a timely fashion when forwarded by Catholic Charities Human Resources Team. Determine appropriateness of applicant for position. Offer position. Update applicant tracking system with candidate disposition upon completion of each related task.


To arrange for applicants to visit the program and meet the residents and to hear about the open positions.


To complete hiring and orientation process.


7. Perform any and all duties designated by the administration.


The Director must be familiar with and comply with all agency policies and procedures and those of Catholic Charities, Diocese of Paterson.


The Director must have a physical exam prior to employment and obtain a mantoux test or free from TB contagion clearance. Must meet fingerprint requirements, checks of criminal background, the central registry, the child abuse registry, and drug test requirements.


This job requires a person that will be extremely dependable. The Director must be prompt and must have transportation arranged so s/he will be able to get to the job in all weather conditions.


**Great Benefits:** For full time positions, (30+ per week) we offer:


* We provide PAID training
* Medical/vision and dental
* Life insurance (agency-paid), supplemental life insurance (employee-paid)
* Flexible spending accounts
* Accidental/Critical Illness Insurance
* 403B (with company-matching)
* Generous paid time off


**Job Requirements:**


* Be motivated to work as part of a team that acts in the best interest of our residents at all times
* Experience with ID/DD population is a plus
* This career requires HS diploma or equivalent
* A valid (non-provisional) driver’s license
* The ability to meet the physical requirements of CPR/First Aid and our emergency evacuation procedures.


**Full Time-Shift: 40 hours per week, (Monday - Friday 8:45am - 4:45pm)**

All offers of employment are contingent on the successful completion/passing of our criminal background/references/DMV check, fingerprinting, pre-employment physical and drug test, etc.


All staff must attend a monthly Staff Meeting – date/time to be determined and announced in advance


Meeting waivers are provided for conflicts due to secondary employment and/or school (appropriate documentation required).

title: Full Time Nanny needed in New Rochelle, NY
description:
Start: September 2024

Age(s) of Child(ren): 8 year old

Schedule: Monday - Friday 6am- 8am & 1pm-6/7pm

Compensation: $1200-$1350 per week

Description:

**FULL TIME NANNY NEEDED IN NEW ROCHELLE,NY**

A single parent is seeking a nurturing nanny to care for his almost 8-year-old son. They are looking for someone with a heartfelt commitment to working with school-aged children, who can provide guidance, assist with homework, and plan engaging activities. The ideal candidate will help transport the child to various activities and manage daily routines with care and attention. The family offers the flexibility of either a live-in or live-out arrangement, with general working hours from 6 AM to 8 AM and 1 PM to 6/7 PM. The father, a dedicated doctor, is on call once a week for the night shift, so if the candidate is live-out, they would be needed for one overnight stay per week.

**IDEAL NANNIES**

The ideal nanny candidate would embody a blend of professionalism, warmth, and reliability. They would have a sincere passion for childcare, consistently demonstrating patience, creativity, and enthusiasm in their interactions with children. With a minimum of 5 years of professional experience, they would be well-versed in developmental milestones, capable of planning and facilitating activities that promote learning and growth.

Possessing a valid First Aid/CPR certification, the candidate would prioritize safety and be prepared to handle emergencies efficiently. Their references would reflect a history of dependable, compassionate care, and their background check would be clear of any discrepancies. They would be a non-smoker with reliable transportation and a clean driving record, indicative of their dependability. Flexibility is crucial, and the ideal candidate would adapt seamlessly to our changing schedules, showing availability for occasional weekends and a long-term commitment to our family.

**POSITION REQUIREMENTS**

* Experience: Minimum of 5 years of professional childcare experience.
* Certification: Valid First Aid/CPR certification for infants and children.
* References: Excellent references from previous employers.
* Background Check: Clear background check.
* Communication: Strong communication skills in English.
* Driver’s License: Valid driver's license and clean driving record (for driving positions).
* Age Group Experience: Experience with school age children
* Activity Planning: Ability to plan and engage in developmentally appropriate activities.
* Housekeeping: Willingness to perform light housekeeping related to the children.
* Transportation: Reliable transportation.
* Flexibility: Flexibility with hours and availability for occasional weekends.
* Commitment: Ability to commit long term.

**COMPENSATION/BENEFITS**

* Competitive Pay: $1200-$1350 per week
* Benefits: PTO, Sick Days, Federal Holidays

If you meet the qualifications and are excited about this opportunity, please log in and review your candidate profile. Make sure your profile is complete and up to date with your current position.

---

*Modern Maison is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applicants from all backgrounds to apply.*

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: $30.00 - $35.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* What is your email address?
* You understand to move your application forward you must complete the full candidate application at www.modernmaisonagency.com/candidates

Experience:

* Nannying: 5 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Preferred)
* CPR Certification (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* New Rochelle, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Branch Small Business Banker- Stamford Ridgeway Shopping Ctr
description:
**Why Wells Fargo:**  

  

Are you looking for more? Find it here. At Wells Fargo, we believe that a meaningful career is much more than just a job. It's about finding all of the elements that help you thrive, in one place. #LivingTheWellLife means you're supported in life, not just work. It means having a competitive salary, a robust benefits package, and programs to support your work-life balance and well-being. It means being rewarded for investing in your community, celebrated for being your authentic self, and empowered to grow. And we're recognized for it! Wells Fargo ranked in the top three on the 2024 LinkedIn Top Companies List of best workplaces "to grow your career" in the U.S.  

  

**About this role:**  

  

Wells Fargo is seeking a Branch Small Business Banker (SAFE) in Consumer and Small Business Banking, as part of Branch Banking. Learn more about the career areas and business divisions at wellsfargojobs.com .  

  

**In this role you will:*** Act as the primary relationship manager for a portfolio of small business customers with annual gross sales between $100k and $1MM in an assigned territory using customer relationship management tools and systems and coordinate efforts with partners across the bank
* Work proactively to build and grow relationships with new customers and engage with existing customers by asking questions to learn about their financial needs, understanding their goals, and sharing how Wells Fargo can help them through proactive outreach, phone or in-person visits, plan and execute appointments
* Participate in community organizations and build relationships with centers of influence
* Create relationships with branch employees by making introductions to appropriate partners to help meet customers' broader financial needs, complete service requests, and resolve customer concerns by following resolution protocol
* Engage with customers in all phases of the business life cycle while following policies and leveraging product knowledge, conduct needs based conversations identifying credit, deposit and servicing processing needs of customers, explain, and demonstrate self-service mobile options to customers
* Serve as a leader in managing risk; understand and manage risks in the business, adhere to policies, procedures & controls and ensure compliance with applicable laws, rules & regulations
* This SAFE position has customer contact and job duties which may include the offering/negotiating of terms and/or taking an application for a dwelling secured transaction. As such, this position requires compliance with the S.A.F.E. Mortgage Licensing Act of 2008 and all related regulations. Ongoing employment is contingent upon meeting all such requirements, including acceptable background investigation results. Individuals in a SAFE position also must meet the Loan Originator requirements under Regulation Z (LO) outlined in the job expectations below

**Required Qualifications:*** 2+ years of branch small business banking experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education

**Desired Qualifications:*** 1+ year of experience managing a dedicated book of small business customers across assigned territory
* Knowledge and understanding of book of business
* Experience using strong business acumen to provide financial services consultation to small business customers
* Extensive knowledge and understanding of bank lending programs, credit policies, and specialty products
* Customer service focus with experience handling complex transactions across multiple systems
* Experience building and maintaining effective relationships with customers and internal partners
* Proficient with proactively sourcing, acquiring, building, and maintaining relationships with customers and colleagues
* Knowledge and understanding of retail compliance controls, risk management, and loss prevention
* Ability to educate and connect customer to technology and share the value of mobile banking options
* Ability to interact with integrity and professionalism with customers and employees
* High motivation with ability to successfully meet team objectives while maintaining individual performance
* Experience mentoring and peer-coaching others
* Ability to manage expectations and conduct follow-ups with customers and Wells Fargo partners
* Relevant military experience including working with military protocol and instructions, enlisted evaluations, officer/leadership reporting
* Relevant military experience including working in personnel benefits management, processing military personnel orders or transitions, wartime readiness operations, human resources or military recruiting

**Job Expectations:*** This position requires SAFE registration at the time of employment. Wells Fargo will initiate the SAFE registration process immediately after your employment start date. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) website (http://fedregistry.nationwidelicensingsystem.org ) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position
* Individuals in Loan Originator (LO) positions must meet the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau qualification requirements and comply with related Wells Fargo policies. The LO qualification requirements include meeting applicable financial responsibility, character, general financial fitness and criminal background standards
* A current credit report will be used to assess your financial responsibility and credit fitness, however, a credit score is not included as part of the evaluation. Successful candidates must also meet ongoing regulatory requirements including additional screening, if necessary
* This position is not eligible for Visa sponsorship

**Pay Range**

$26.83 - $40.19

title: Water Park Team Lead
description:
American Dream, developed by Triple Five Group, is an unparalleled mix of world class entertainment, retail, and dining, comprising more than 3 million square feet just minutes away from New York City in East Rutherford, New Jersey. American Dream is home to leading
  
attractions, including DreamWorks Water Park, Nickelodeon Universe Theme Park, LEGOLAND Discovery Center, SEA LIFE Aquarium, Big SNOW Ski Hill, Dream Wheel – a 300-foot observation wheel overlook the NYC skyline, as well as attractions debuting soon such as The Game Room Powered by Hasbro and Skip Barber Racing Go-Kart Academy. American Dream’s immersive luxury shopping and dining experience – The Avenue – features Saks Fifth Avenue, Hermès, Saint Laurent, Dolce & Gabbana, Carpaccio, a fine-dining Italian restaurant, and much more. The retail collection is further expanded with flagship locations for Aritzia, H&M, PRIMARK, Uniqlo, Sephora and Zara; as well as the Toys'R'Us global flagship, the only standalone location in the U.S, and the world’s first and only “candy department store,” IT’SUGAR.
  
For more information on American Dream, visit www.americandream.com or find us on Instagram @americandream and TikTok @americandream\\_official.
  
  

**Key Objective(s):****The main purpose of the Aquatics Team Lead is:**  

* To assist Aquatics Supervisors in the daily operations of the DreamWorks Water Park including the supervision of Water Park staff and providing guests with exceptional customer service.


**Primary RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

* Maintain a safe work environment for both team members and guests through effective training, policies and procedures and analysis of incident reports.
* Conduct effective and regular conversations with the aquatics staff to ensure individual development and goals are being met through company performance management tools.
* Working in position while helping supervise and coordinating Lifeguards and facility staff to ensure that all staff are at their appropriate workstations.
* Responding to major and minor first aid situations and monitor the first aid facility staff.
* Occasionally performing administrative duties such as interviewing, new employee onboarding, accident investigations, and implement staff training programs and procedures.
* Responding to guest concerns and special requests, while utilizing exceptional customer service and conflict resolution skills. Involving additional supervisory staff as required.
* Presenting a professional appearance and attitude and enforce safety rules and regulations.
* Being actively involved in creating and maintaining a safe environment for all staff and guests.
* Perform duties of “Head Guard” several shifts per week, assisting park supervisors in all aspects of park operation
* Other supervisory duties as required.


**Desired Qualifications:**  

* Must be at least 18 years of age, personable, have good attendance and availability.
* Outgoing and personable, with a commitment to excellence in public relations. Must be people oriented and have excellent communication skills that include speaking, writing, reading, and understanding of the English language.
* Must be an outstanding leader with a commitment to teaching and mentoring peers and subordinates.
* E&A Instructor license preferred (or willing to obtain)
* Previous supervisory skills an asset
* Experience working successfully with a variety of employees, including mentoring employees new to the workforce.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills complemented by team building and motivational abilities.
* Safety-minded and can stay calm in emergency situations.


**Physical Job Requirements:**  

* This is a full-time position that requires flexible availability Monday through Sunday including days, evenings, weekends, and holidays.
* Ability to work in a hot and humid environment and near water and chlorine. Potential hazards include water, chlorine, and cleaning chemicals.
* Must be able to pass a basic security clearance.
* Complete all E&A Special Facilities prerequisite skills
* Perform repetitive motion- Occasionally- 30% of time
* Stand and move- Frequently 80% of time
* Reach at, above or below shoulder level- Occasionally 40% of time.
* Kneel and bend- Frequently 75% of time
* Stoop/squat- Frequently 75% of time
* Lift/carry between 10-76 lbs. - Occasionally 20% of time
* Able to work at heights between 35-200.


American Dream is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment or discrimination. All employment decisions are to be made without regard to race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, religion, marital status, pregnancy, national origin/ancestry, citizenship, physical/mental disability, military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.
company_description: American Dream, a 3 MIL sq ft entertainment, retail and restaurant complex taken on by the Triple Five Group, is set to open in Spring 2019!

title: Personal Banker Southampton NY
description:
**Why Wells Fargo:**  

  

Are you looking for more? Find it here. At Wells Fargo, we believe that a meaningful career is much more than just a job. It's about finding all of the elements that help you thrive, in one place. #LivingTheWellLife means you're supported in life, not just work. It means having a competitive salary, a robust benefits package, and programs to support your work-life balance and well-being. It means being rewarded for investing in your community, celebrated for being your authentic self, and empowered to grow. And we're recognized for it! Wells Fargo ranked in the top three on the 2024 LinkedIn Top Companies List of best workplaces "to grow your career" in the U.S.  

  

**About this role:**  

  

Wells Fargo is seeking an Associate Personal Banker (SAFE) for our National Branch Network as part of the Consumer, Small & Business Banking division. Learn more about the career areas and business divisions at wellsfargojobs.com.  

  

**In this role you will:*** Participate in delivery of exceptional customer experience by building relationships through proactive outreach as well as proposing appropriate products, services, and digital solutions to help customers succeed financially
* Assist customers with basic requests related to opening new accounts, completing service requests, and submitting credit applications
* Receive direction from managers and exercise judgement within defined policies and procedures
* Develop understanding of bank products and services to connect to customers' needs
* Interact with customers to demonstrate care and build relationships
* Provide appropriate options for bank products and services to customer
* Refer customers' financial needs to other bankers and partners as needed
* This SAFE position has customer contact and job duties which may include the offering/negotiating of terms and/or taking an application for a dwelling secured transaction. As such, this position requires compliance with the S.A.F.E. Mortgage Licensing Act of 2008 and all related regulations. Ongoing employment is contingent upon meeting all such requirements, including acceptable background investigation results. Individuals in a SAFE position also must meet the Loan Originator requirements under Regulation Z (LO) outlined in the job expectations below

**Required Qualifications:*** 6+ months of interacting with customers experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education

**Desired Qualifications:*** Customer service focus with experience handling complex transactions across multiple systems
* Experience proactively engaging with customers through outreach via phone or email
* Ability to educate and connect customer to technology and share the value of mobile banking options
* Ability to help customers succeed financially by offering introductions to additional team members as appropriate
* Experience working with others on a team to meet customer needs
* Experience fostering and developing strong customer relationships
* Ability to build strong relationships with internal partners
* Ability to follow policies, procedures, and regulations
* Ability to identify potential fraud/risky accounts and take appropriate action to prevent loss
* Ability to interact with integrity and professionalism with customers and team members
* Relevant military experience including working with military protocol and instructions, enlisted evaluations, officer/leadership reporting
* Relevant military experience including working in personnel benefits management, processing military personnel orders or transitions, wartime readiness operations, human resources or military recruiting
* Proficient with proactively sourcing, acquiring, building, and maintaining relationships with customers and colleagues
* Support customers and employees in resolving or escalating concerns or complaints

**Job Expectations:*** Ability to work a schedule that may include most Saturdays
* Maintains cash drawer, cash handling and balancing and spends time completing service-related tasks as needed
* This position requires SAFE registration at the time of employment. Wells Fargo will initiate the SAFE registration process immediately after your employment start date. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) website (http://fedregistry.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. Individuals in Loan Originator (LO) positions must meet the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau qualification requirements and comply with related Wells Fargo policies. The LO qualification requirements include meeting applicable financial responsibility, character, general financial fitness and criminal background standards. A current credit report will be used to assess your financial responsibility and credit fitness, however, a credit score is not included as part of the evaluation. Successful candidates must also meet ongoing regulatory requirements including additional screening, if necessary
* This position is not eligible for Visa sponsorship

**Posting Location(s):*** 25 Nugent Street- Southampton, NY

**Pay Range**  

  

Reflected is the base pay range offered for this position. Pay may vary depending on factors including but not limited to achievements, skills, experience, or work location. The range listed is just one component of the compensation package offered to candidates.  

$22.00 - $30.19  

**Benefits**  

  

Wells Fargo provides all eligible full- and part-time employees with a comprehensive set of benefits designed to protect their physical and financial health and to help them make the most of their financial future. Visit Benefits - Wells Fargo Careers for an overview of the following benefit plans and programs offered to employees.* 401(k) Plan

* Parental Leave
* Critical Caregiving Leave
* Discounts and Savings
* Health Benefits
* Commuter Benefits
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Scholarships for dependent children
* Adoption Reimbursement

**Posting End Date:**  

13 Aug 2024  

* **Job posting may come down early due to volume of applicants.**

  

**We Value Diversity**  

  

At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.

They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.

title: Server/FOH
description:
**About Us:** We are a neighborhood family-owned, fast-casual Mediterranean eatery, juice bar, and coffee house located in the heart of Little Falls, New Jersey. Our mission is to provide our community with delicious food and exceptional service in a warm, welcoming atmosphere. We take pride in our friendly team and are committed to creating a positive experience for both our guests and staff.

**Position Overview:** We are seeking enthusiastic and dedicated servers & FOH team members to join our team. You will play a key role in ensuring our guests have an enjoyable dining experience. You will also be responsible for delivering outstanding customer service, running food and drinks, maintaining cleanliness, learning our menu, taking orders through a POS system, and assisting with inventory stocking.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Customer Service:** Greet guests with a warm and friendly demeanor, assist with menu selections, and provide exceptional service throughout their visit.
* **Running Food and Drinks:** Ensure timely and accurate delivery of food and beverages to guests, maintaining a high standard of presentation and service.
* **Learning the Menu:** Gain a thorough understanding of our Mediterranean menu, juice bar offerings, and coffee selections to assist guests with their orders and provide knowledgeable recommendations.
* **Taking Orders:** Accurately take orders through our POS system, ensuring all modifications and special requests are communicated to the kitchen and barista staff.
* **Cleaning:** Maintain the cleanliness of the dining area, restrooms, and other public spaces. Clean and sanitize tables, chairs, and high-touch surfaces regularly. Assist with cleaning and maintenance of kitchen equipment and machinery as needed.
* **Stocking Inventory:** Monitor inventory levels and restock supplies as necessary, including napkins, utensils, condiments, and beverages.
* **Team Collaboration:** Work closely with kitchen staff and other team members to ensure smooth operations and a positive dining experience for guests.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience in a customer service or restaurant role is preferred but not required.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Attention to detail and a commitment to cleanliness and safety.
* Positive attitude and a team player mindset.
* Availability to work flexible hours, including evenings, weekends, and holidays.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive hourly wage plus tips.
* Paid time off.
* Opportunities for growth and advancement within the company.
* Employee discounts on meals.
* Supportive and friendly work environment.
* Paid training provided for all new team members.

**How to Apply:** If you are passionate about providing excellent customer service and want to be part of a dynamic team, we would love to hear from you! Please submit your resume when applying.

Join us and become a valued member of our family-owned restaurant, where your contributions make a difference every day!

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $15.50 - $18.50 per hour

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Food provided
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Paid training

Shift:

* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Morning shift

Experience:

* Restaurant experience: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Little Falls, NJ 07424 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Little Falls, NJ 07424: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Luxury Retail Sales Manager
description:
Valentina Kova was founded in 2012 as a luxury womenswear brand specializing in wovens, knitwear, and fine jewelry. Valentina Kova designs are future classics that are chic, fashion-forward, and eminently wearable by women of all ages. The New York based brand currently has a location on Worth Avenue as well as Nantucket.

We are seeking a highly skilled New York-based Sales Manager to oversee sales operations at our NYC showroom. The ideal candidate will also be responsible for managing our Nantucket store during the summer season, with housing provided on the island. Please note that the Nantucket store operates year-round, with a seasonal closure from January to March.

Responsibilities:

* Oversee the sales operations specifically at our New York showroom. This includes managing and merchandising inventory, ensuring the showroom is visually appealing, and meeting or exceeding sales targets.
* Build and maintain customer relationships and loyalty through personal interaction and outreach.
* Maintain an active, accurate, neat, and organized client database under the company’s CRM system, contacting clients regularly and providing appropriate follow-up on all sales or requests.
* Appropriately enter all-important guest and product information into the POS system in a timely manner.
* Provide exceptional customer service experience by greeting, listening, and assisting customers in exceeding their needs, demonstrating an excellent knowledge of the brand.
* Responsible for hiring and planning the seasonal schedule to ensure optimal staffing and coverage in Nantucket.
* Manage and motivate staff to create a well-balanced and productive work environment in Nantucket.
* Monitor and control store payroll and expenses, ensuring timely submission of accurate timesheets and maintaining appropriate associate coverage for selling floor.
* Ensure that merchandise is received and processed in a timely manner and that all back of house areas are organized and maintained to support selling activity.
* Ensure store presentation standards are achieved and maintained.
* Work closely with and provide appropriate feedback to the New York Team regarding merchandise and clientele needs.
* Properly track store KPIs, review, and submit associated individual sales records.
* Demonstrate clear and proper etiquette when communicating with internal employees and external clients via phone and e-mail.
* Handle and resolve internal Nantucket HR requests, client issues, and employee requests in a professional and efficient manner.
* Ensure accurate inventory management and perform regular stock takes in both locations
* Plan and execute in-store events, promotions, and marketing initiatives to drive sales and increase brand awareness in Nantucket.
* Follow all company policies and procedures.
* Perform other duties and assignments as required.

Qualifications:

* Minimum of 5 years sales experience in a luxury retail environment
* Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, and the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously
* Accuracy and attention to detail needed
* Team-player mentality
* Strong organization and follow-up skills are essential
* Flexibility to work a retail schedule is a must, weekends and holidays
* Must have a book of clientele

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $95,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Flexible schedule

Shift:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Luxury Sales: 5 years (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10013 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10013: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Medical Billing Account Receivable Specialist
description:
**Job description**

M&D Capital, a highly successful and fast growing medical billing company based in Queens, New York is looking for responsible, organized and knowledgeable **Accounts Receivable Specialist.** M&D Capital provides revenue cycle management and billing services to numerous highly respected medical providers in the Tri-State area and is swiftly expanding to service providers nationwide.

M&D Capital maintains an exciting and energetic culture with opportunity for personal and professional growth and advancement. We work closely with all our staff in order to enhance their skills and grow the scope of their responsibilities, through training and support from every member of our company up to and including those at the executive level. If you meet the qualifications below, we invite you to join our team.

**Accounts Receivable Specialist**

***Roles & Responsibilities:***

Responsible for all aspects of insurance follow up and collections, including making telephone calls, accessing payer websites.

Identify root cause issues for denials; categorize denial

Effectively resolve complex issues, including payment research, payment recoups

Effectively communicate issues to management, including payer, system or escalated account issues as well as develop solutions.

title: Core Processor TSYS Build Analyst
description:
**Job Title:** Core Processor TSYS Build Analyst

**Company:** InterAction24

**Location:** Whippany, NJ

**About Us:** InterAction24 is a leader in staff augmentation, dedicated to providing top-tier talent and solutions to our clients. We specialize in connecting skilled professionals with exciting opportunities in dynamic industries. Join us and be part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and excellence.

**Job Overview:** We are seeking a talented and motivated Core Processor Build Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for setting up card processing rules at TSYS and providing consultation to both internal and external teams. You will collaborate with various departments across the company, including business development, marketing, fraud, risk, compliance, operations, and technology, to deliver on portfolio initiatives, conversions, and co-brand deals.

**Key Accountabilities:**

* **Technical Translation:** Support business and operational teams in translating business strategies into technical processor requirements for internal applications and TSYS technical builds.
* **Product Development:** Maintain new product and feature development, including pricing, account fees, transaction fees, and promotional programs, as well as new plastic, insert, card carrier, or CMA builds.
* **Project Coordination:** Coordinate and execute solutions across business, technology, operations, and external vendors/partners to ensure timely and high-quality delivery.
* **Regulatory Compliance:** Ensure knowledge of and adherence to regulatory requirements, Enterprise Wide Risk Management Framework, and internal Barclays Policies and Policy Standards.

**Essential Skills/Basic Qualifications:**

* 5+ years of experience in credit card banking.
* 5+ years of experience in TSYS (TS2) Build and Design or equivalent industry experience.
* Proven experience working with agile methodologies in large, complex organizations.
* Strong oral and written communication skills.

**Desirable Skills/Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience with SQL/SAS.
* Ability to build strong working relationships with key stakeholders.
* Proficiency in MS Project, Excel, Visio, Access, PowerPoint, and Teams.
* Familiarity with collaboration tools such as Confluence, SharePoint, and Jira.
* Ability to work effectively in a variable working environment.

**Why Join Us?**

* Be part of an innovative and forward-thinking team.
* Work on exciting projects with cross-functional teams.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* Competitive compensation and benefits package.

If you are a detail-oriented professional with a passion for driving technical solutions and delivering exceptional results, we would love to hear from you!

title: Healthcare Economics Analyst
description:
Summary:
* Develop data-driven analysis for decision making on how EmblemHealth purchases, manages, and influences the cost of care for current and prospective members.
* Extract, analyze, and interpret data to produce insights related to cost drivers, opportunities to impact costs, and impact of health cost containment initiatives.
* Provide consultative support to aligned business areas to demonstrate analytics rooted in data.


Responsibilities:
* Design and/or execute analytics and reporting to measure or estimate financial impact of health plan business problems and potential or actual solutions.
* Support all functions within Healthcare Economics including monitoring of specific corporate and health cost containment initiatives.
* Research and analyze financial data to draw conclusions and provide consultation to internal and external partners for use in administering specific programs and processes related to medical expense and utilization.
* Present analytical findings to internal business partners.
* Analyze business problems related to financial experience of the health plan, particularly related to how care is purchased, managed, or other factors influencing cost of care.
* Perform additional duties as assigned.


Requirements:
* BA/BS required in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Healthcare or other related discipline
* 3 – 5+ years’ relevant, professional work experience required
* Experience working in a healthcare setting (within a provider health system or health insurance company) preferred
* Experience working with healthcare data including but not limited to claims, testing results and pharmacy data preferred
* High level of proficiency with MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.), with an emphasis on Excel required
* Strong communication skills (verbal, written, presentation, interpersonal) required
* Experience preparing/presenting dashboards and data using a data visualization tool such as Tableau preferred
* Ability to query, summarize, and manipulate data using SQL or SAS required
Additional Information


* Requisition ID: 1000002031
* Hiring Range: $52,000-$92,000

title: Practice Manager
description:
**Position Summary**

The Practice Manager will report to the Senior Director, Practice Operations and Strategy

**Responsibilities**

Responsibilities include but not limited to:

* Responsible for the day-day operations of the site related to patient care, quality assurance, policy and procedure, compliance, human resources, marketing outreach, referring physicians concerns, revenue cycle and operations.
* Implements strategic workflow to improve patient satisfaction and revenue cycle.
* Responsible for budget and daily volume benchmarks.
* Manages staff time and disciplinary actions.
* Takes measures to correct and/or resolve situations and ensures that appropriate personnel are involved.
* Orders and maintains supplies for the site, including POs and reimbursements.
* Communicates with vendors regarding orders and deliveries. Reviews and approves all invoices for processing.
* Troubleshoots and tracks Departmental productivity and HR Policy and Procedure.
* In the absence of the Senior Director, directs the activities of the staff with authority to discipline and make decisions.
* Works with the radiologists on a daily basis as needed to facilitate workflow and patient care.
* Addresses patient concerns and implements Departmental goals to meet and exceed target patient satisfaction scores.
* Work with other key management leaders in overseeing scheduling as it relates to Radiology PACS system, EPIC and patient flow, including other CU referring physicians and Practice Administrator.
* Trains and ensure appropriate coverage for staff vacations for the front desk. Acts as the liaison between all other radiology facilities within the Columbia/NYP network.
* Works with the Senior Director on departmental projects including but not limited to install/upgrade of equipment, IT upgrades, strategic initiatives to promote increase in practice volume and implementation of new programs/projects.
* Generates monthly key performance metrics for management's review and identifies areas of concern and proposed solutions.
* Performs other related duties as necessary.

The position will require approximately 10% local travel for meetings across multiple sites.

**Minimum Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent in education and experience, plus four (4) years of relevant experience, which should include healthcare workflow operations and front end management.

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Must have strong strategic planning and implementation skills; ability to communicate effectively; superior communications, written and interpersonal skills. Knowledge of current technology including EPIC, preferred.
* Candidate must be a strategic thinker with strong proven leadership capabilities; and have a track record of partnership development (business to business and client to client). Self-motivated and ability to effectively prioritize and implement multiple priorities in a cross functional team required.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Psychiatric Registered Nurse Practitioner
description:
**Job Summary:**

**Wellness In Inwood is seeking a dedicated and compassionate Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner to join the Team. A successful Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner will work closely with patients to provide comprehensive psychiatric care, including evaluating, diagnosing, and treating mental health disorders. The Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner will collaborate with other healthcare professionals to ensure the best possible patient outcomes and may also be involved in educating patients and their families about mental health conditions and treatment options.**

Wellness In Inwood, a private for-profit organization, combines expertise in criminal justice and behavioral health services to improve outcomes for New York residents involved in the criminal justice system, and those with substance use disorders. Wellness In Inwood is located in Inwood on Post Ave between 207th street and 10th Ave.

**Salary:** The salary for this role is per diem.

**Shift Hours:** This position is part time

**Location Address:** 148 Post Ave New York, NY 10034. Our office is easily accessible by public transportation.

**Workplace Flexibility:**

* This position is On-site: This role is 100% in-office/in person.

**What you will be doing:**

* Serve as clinical lead of the team working with a peer specialist and professional staff.
* Provide psychiatric care to individuals in need. This includes rapid assessment and intervention for those with immediate needs.
* Provide crisis intervention services to individuals with active, immediate needs to enable improved bridging to ongoing continuing supportive treatment services.
* Conduct psychiatric assessments to determine appropriateness for a specific level of behavioral health care.
* Serve as the on-site clinical expert for the program by offering assessment recommendations to court and collateral stakeholders.
* Prescribe medications indicated by assessment to assist with improving psychiatric stability, teach clients about side effects, and monitor response to prescribed medications.
* Promote and deliver integrated treatment including Medication Assisted Treatment (MAT) to consumers with co-occurring substance use disorders which includes completing buprenorphine training and obtain the waiver to prescribe.

**Other Duties:**

* Assist clients, family members, and significant others with concern and empathy
* Work in collaboration with clients, family, and other collaterals to support bridging to treatment supports and ongoing continuity of care
* Work collaboratively with a Peer Specialist and other members of the court team to improve participant stability while in the court and ensure best outcomes for ongoing program enrollment
* Ensure services are person/family-centered, recovery-oriented, and trauma-informed
* Promote the importance of primary care with all designated participants to ensure a holistic approach to participant health
* Utilize best and evidence-based approaches to treatment consistent with Wellness In Inwood’s organizational culture; health/mental health integration, rehabilitation and recovery, and understanding incarceration on treatment engagement
* Provide culturally competent services that are individualized to client needs and reflect the integration of race, ethnicity, culture, primary language, immigration status, developmental status, criminal justice status, sexuality, age, and gender
* Other duties as assigned via program, senior, or executive leadership

**What we are looking for:**

* A Nurse Practitioner degree with specialized training or experience in Psychiatry. A current license to practice as a nurse practitioner in the State of New York. Must be board certified
* Currently possess a Data2000 waiver or complete training within 6 months of hire and become eligible to provide MAT services.
* A current DEA registration for the prescribing of controlled substances. ANCC certification or pending application is required. NYS OPRA status approved or application pending and a Health Commerce Account in place by the onset of employment.
* BLS/ALS Certified or gain within 3 months of hire
* Extensive experience working with people with mental illness, serious mental illness and knowledgeable about risk assessment and risk management
* Experience with working with individuals involved in the criminal legal system

Pay: $77.40 - $95.13 per hour

Medical Specialty:

* Addiction Medicine
* Psychiatry

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

License/Certification:

* Certified Nurse Practitioner (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10034 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10034: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Commercial Refrigeration Technician
description:
Exciting opportunity for a Full Time Commercial HVAC Technician at Coastal Refrigeration Corp! As a problem solver in the HVAC industry, you'll tackle complex challenges onsite for our valued commercial clients. Join our team of professionals dedicated to delivering top-notch service while honing your technical skills.


The pay for this position is competitive in the industry, reflecting your expertise and commitment to excellence. Embrace a customer-centric culture that values your contribution and offers room for growth. Bring your refrigeration expertise to Coastal Refrigeration Corp and be a part of a dynamic team driving success in the HVAC industry.


You will be offered great benefits such as Medical, Competitive Salary, Paid Time Off, and IRA. Apply now and take the next step in your career with us!

### **COASTAL REFRIGERATION CORP.: WHO WE ARE**


Join a professional team that is friendly and supportive. We are looking for enthusiastic and prideful people to join our team. Must have a team player mentality as we have created a secure and comfortable culture within. We are a solid and secure company with over 20 years in business. We are growing and we have openings for immediate hire. We set ourselves apart by placing our employees first by offering company sponsored benefits (employee only) after 90 days, PTO, tool allowances, IRA Match and regular training/in-services.

### **DAY TO DAY AS A COMMERCIAL HVAC TECHNICIAN**


As a new Commercial HVAC Technician at Coastal Refrigeration Corp, you'll start by shadowing experienced technicians to learn the ropes. Expect to assist with installations, maintenance, and repairs of commercial refrigeration systems. You'll troubleshoot issues, diagnose problems, and provide efficient solutions under the guidance of seasoned professionals. Daily tasks include inspecting equipment, testing components, and ensuring optimal performance for our clients. This hands-on role will immerse you in the world of HVAC, honing your skills and expanding your knowledge in commercial refrigeration systems.


Join our team and embark on a rewarding journey in the dynamic field of HVAC at Coastal Refrigeration Corp.

### **REQUIREMENTS FOR THIS COMMERCIAL HVAC TECHNICIAN JOB**


Successful candidates for the Commercial HVAC Technician position at Coastal Refrigeration Corp possess strong problem-solving abilities to troubleshoot and resolve complex refrigeration issues. Customer-centricity is key, as you'll interact with clients regularly to address their needs and provide top-notch service. Attention to detail is crucial for conducting thorough inspections and ensuring precise repairs. Technical acumen in HVAC systems and refrigeration equipment is essential to excel in this role. Effective communication skills are needed to collaborate with team members and convey technical information to clients.


Adaptability and a willingness to learn are also important traits for staying current with industry trends and advancing your expertise in commercial HVAC systems at Coastal Refrigeration Corp.

### **READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?**


So, what do you think? If you can meet these requirements and perform this job as described above, we would be happy to have you as part of our team!

title: Groundskeeper/Maintenance Technician
description:
Veris Residential, Inc. is a forward-thinking, environmentally and socially conscious real estate investment trust (REIT) that primarily owns, operates, acquires and develops holistically inspired, Class A multifamily properties that meet the sustainability-conscious lifestyle needs of today’s residents while seeking to positively impact the communities it serves and the planet at large. The company is guided by an experienced management team and Board of Directors and is underpinned by leading corporate governance principles, a best-in-class and sustainable approach to operations, and an inclusive culture based on equality and meritocratic empowerment.  



We have an immediate need for a well-organized, enthusiastic individual to join our prestigious, award winning property management team as a **Groundskeeper/Maintenance Technician** at our luxury apartment community in **BLVD 401/425, Jersey City, NJ.**  



The skills/responsibilities essential to the success of this position include, but are not limited to:  

* Maintain Management Office, models, interior public and common areas of the community in a neat, clean, and attractive condition.
* Maintain all grounds, including sidewalks, public walkways, and stairways, building exteriors, garden areas and dog runs in a neat, clean, and attractive condition.
* Assist in the effort to make vacant apartments rent-ready in a timely manner.
* Compact and remove trash and debris from community.
Ability to use general maintenance tools, supplies and equipment such as, but not limited to, hand tools, pressure washers, blowers, paint equipment, pool equipment, snow and ice removal equipment, etc.  
* 

Requirements:


* Position requires ability to work any of the seven days of the week, 52 weeks of the year.
* Position requires the ability to serve on-call, as scheduled or as necessary.
* basic computer skills, specifically knowledge of Microsoft Office products
* good verbal and written communication skills
* strong customer service orientation
Other licenses and certifications as required by state or local laws  
* 

Compensation: $45,760  



Veris Residential Inc. has a proven record of success along with competitive compensation and an excellent benefits package which includes medical, dental, vision, FSA/DDC, company paid life insurance, supplemental insurance programs and 401(k).


**Great Place to Work Certified Jan 2024 – Jan 2025**

title: Case Manager - Prelitigation
company: Brandon J. Broderick, Attorney At Law
description:
**About Brandon J. Broderick**



Brandon J. Broderick is a prestigious and forward-thinking law firm committed to delivering exceptional legal services. With a blend of tradition and innovation, we are dedicated to staying at the forefront of legal practice and technology.



Come join a team, in a fast-paced environment, where the culture values Transparency, Accountability, Empowerment, Teamwork, Passion, Giving Back, Diversity, and Inclusion. At Brandon J Broderick, you will be provided with **training, mentorship, a career path** along with **perks** such as **Summer Fridays, competitive benefits, a robust holiday schedule, and work-life balance**! We care deeply about or employees and our clients. Our commitment to these values ensures a supportive and inclusive environment where every team member can thrive and contribute to our collective success.



Tired of your outrageous case load? Come join a team where we value work-life balance and have the technology to support you!


We are looking for a full-time, experienced Personal Injury Case Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will have the ability to manage all **pre-litigation** case manager duties and handle a caseload personal injury cases from intake until litigation.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Ability to manage all **Pre-litigation** Case Manager duties for Personal Injury Cases - NJ and/or NY
* Caseload of 100 personal injury cases from intake until the case goes to litigation
* 30 days calls with clients regarding medical care, providers, notating and updating about their current treatment status - Provide excellent customer service
* Capable of independently reviewing cases, conducting investigations to gather necessary information for cases where initial claims are unsuccessful, and establishing No-Fault and Bodily Injury claims as required.
* Ability to open claims with insurance companies
* Knowledge of No-Fault applications, filing of claims/procedures, deadlines
* Knowledge of the processing of lost wage claims
* Knowledge of retrieving police reports
* Knowledge of personal injury threshold – Verbal, Zero, etc.
* Knowledge of Motor Vehicle Indemnification Corp procedures
* Ability to set up property damage claims
* Ability to obtain Property Deeds
* Conduct Corporate Business search about premises liability claims
* Knowledge of OPRA & FOIL requests
* Knowledge of Personal Injury Statutes of Limitations – NJ, NY, PA
* Ability to accurately enter information in the Litify insurance tabs, & provider tabs about medical facilities and insurance info.
* Obtaining/documenting outstanding liens: medical liens, worker's compensation liens, etc.
* Update and maintain client information in the Litify database
* Strong attention to detail and excellent organizational skills.
* Prioritize tasks effectively and consistently meet deadlines


**Qualifications:**


* Strong attention to detail and excellent organizational skills.
* Ability to prioritize tasks effectively and consistently meet deadlines.
* Certification not required; **past work experience** is what we want
* Bilingual proficiency is a plus.

**Benefits:**


* We offer a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.


* Health Insurance


* Dental Insurance


* Vision Insurance


* Paid Time off


* Sick time


**Equal Opportunity Statement**  

  

Brandon J Broderick provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.  

  

**E-Verify**  

  

This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, this employer is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the employer can take any action against you, including terminating your employment. Employers can only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the I-9 Form.


**No 3rd party recruitment firms.**

title: Direct Care Staff
description:
Exciting opportunity to join Alay Home Care as a Direct Support Professional! Be part of a team dedicated to providing companionship and support to individuals in need. With a pay range of **$20.50/hr - $28.00/hr**, this position offers competitive compensation for your valuable time and skills. Bring your passion for making a difference in someone's life to our onsite role.


You can get great benefits such as Medical, Dental, Vision, and Paid Time Off. If you are a compassionate individual looking for a rewarding role, apply now to start your journey with us!

### **WHO ARE WE? AN INTRODUCTION**


Alay Home Care is a DDD Provider established in 2018. Since opening, we have serviced over 300 consumers throughout New Jersey. We're devoted to supporting individuals with Developmental Disabilities by providing Direct Care Staff in the Home and Community Settings. Our team has been in the home care industry for over 22 years, consisting of a group of highly experienced and knowledgeable team members.

### **MAKE A DIFFERENCE AS A DIRECT SUPPORT PROFESSIONAL**


As a Direct Support Professional at Alay Home Care, you will play a vital role in providing personalized care to individuals by assisting with activities of daily living, offering companionship, and serving as a mentor in various aspects of life. From running errands to providing emotional support and mentorship in academic and career development, your impact will help enhance the quality of life for those under your care. You will also contribute to community support efforts, ensuring individuals remain connected and engaged within their communities. With a focus on behavioral support and medication administration, your role will be essential in fostering a positive and nurturing environment for those in need. Join us in making a difference in the lives of others today!

### **DOES THIS SOUND LIKE YOU?**


Successful candidates for the role of Direct Support Professional at Alay Home Care must possess exceptional interpersonal skills to build meaningful connections with individuals in need. Strong organization and time management skills are essential to effectively assist with daily living activities and provide companionship. The ability to handle challenging behaviors with patience and empathy is crucial, along with a compassionate and understanding demeanor.


Candidates should also demonstrate proficiency in medication administration and be adept at providing emotional and social support. Prior experience in caregiving or a related field is preferred but not required, as we provide comprehensive training to support your success in this rewarding role.

### **CONNECT WITH OUR TEAM TODAY!**


If you feel that this job is what you're looking for, applying is a piece of cake - **You can send your resume to** **recruitment@alayhc.com** **and one of our recruiters will get back to you!**
