title: Marketing and Business Development Strategist
Patient Care Technician
description:
629 Cranbury Rd, East Brunswick, New Jersey, 08816, United States of America
DaVita is seeking a Patient Care Technician who is looking to give life in an outpatient dialysis center. You can make an exceptional difference in the lives of our patients and their families dealing with end-stage renal failure or chronic kidney disease. Do you desire to deliver care in an empathetic, compassionate way - the way you'd want your own care to be?


If you haven't considered Nephrology before, read on as we think that you should.


Joining DaVita as Patient Care Technician (PCT) is an exciting opportunity to jump start your career in the health care industry! With paid, extensive training, you will gain the skills needed to care for our patients and build a network of other health care professionals across the geography where you live. Once you have successfully completed training, you will join a holistic team of care professionals – including nurses, dietitian, social workers, and other experienced PCTs – to care for our patients. It's not a job, it's giving life and a career based on passion and purpose.


DaVita – which is Italian for "giving life" – is working to provide quality service to patients, partners, and teammates. Our mission is to be the Provider, Partner, and Employer of Choice.


Our PCTs also find DaVita professionally fulfilling. To help advance your career, we offer clear paths to higher levels of responsibility and compensation through our Clinical Ladders program. Through DaVita's Bridge to your Dreams program, teammates who have been in their role for six consecutive months and in good standing, are eligible to receive tuition assistance up front to pursue their dream of becoming a DaVita RN and getting their Associates Degree in Nursing. We also have dedicated training to become a Facility Administrator, and training to become a Regional Operations Director. Your success is driven by your performance and desire.


Some details about this position:

* No Dialysis experience is required.
* Training may take place in a facility or a training clinic other than your assigned home clinic
* Potential to float to various clinics during and after your training
* You must have a flexible schedule and be able to work mornings, evenings, weekends, and holidays


What you can expect:

* Direct Patient Care. Spend the majority of your day in direct one-on-one patient care to provide safe, comfortable and hygienic dialysis treatment.
* Our PCTs care for multiple patients.
* Technician Duties. To monitor patients before, during and after dialysis treatment including measuring and recording stats, patient observations, and hemodialysis machine setup. Please note you will have exposure to blood and needles.
* Building long-term relationships with your patients who are suffering from end stage renal disease and are receiving treatment on average 3 times/week. You will also be responsible for educating patients on Kidney Dialysis related topics.
* Team. Cross functional team of clinicians including technicians, nurses, dietitians, social workers and leadership. PCTs work under the supervision of a RN.


What we'll provide:


DaVita Rewards package connects teammates to what matters most including:

* Comprehensive benefits: Medical, dental, vision, 401(k) match, paid time off, PTO cash out
* Support for you and your family: family resources, EAP counseling sessions, access Headspace®, backup child and elder care, maternity/paternity leave, pet insurance, and more
* Paid training


Requirements:

* Desire to enter the health care field to care for other people in need
* High school diploma or equivalent
* Must be comfortable working around blood and needles
* Must be comfortable mixing acid or bicarb
* Physical and mental ability to work long hours (some shifts are 12+ hours) on your feet so wear comfortable shoes! Our work ends when it's safe for our patients.
* Willingness to train and work across multiple clinics within the territory as needed.
* Health care experience a plus including: BONENT Certified, Certified Hemodialysis Technician (CHT), Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA), Certified Medical Assistant (CMA), or Phlebotomy certification.


DaVita is a clinical leader! We have the highest percentage of facilities meeting or exceeding CMS's standards in the government's two key performance programs. We expect our teammates to commit to improving patient health through clinical goal setting and quality improvement initiatives.


Ready to make a difference in the lives of patients? Take the first step and apply now.


#LI-LB1


At DaVita, we strive to be a community first and a company second. We want all teammates to experience DaVita as "a place where I belong." Our goal is to embed Diversity & Belonging into everything we do in our Village, so that it becomes part of who we are. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. As such, individuals are recruited, hired, assigned and promoted without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.


Applications are accepted on an ongoing basis.

**Salary/ Wage Range**


Compensation for the role will depend on a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience and may fall outside of the range shown. DaVita offers a competitive total rewards package, which includes a 401k match, healthcare coverage and a broad range of other benefits. Learn more at https://careers.davita.com/benefits
company_description: DaVita strives to improve patients' quality of life by innovating clinical care, offering treatment plans, and personalized care teams.

title: Project Manager, Client Services (January 2025)
description:
**About Capvision:**



Capvision is a global primary research platform connecting financial institutions, consulting firms, global enterprises, and high-net-worth individuals with subject matter experts across all industries and regions. Our goal is to provide clients with the necessary tools to gain the right insights for their research objectives. To achieve this, we conduct expert interviews, industry research, business consulting, marketing surveys, and in-person/remote conferences.

***Start Date January 2025***

  


**Why Join Us?**



A career in our Research practice will provide you the opportunity to help institutional investors and management consultants discover new insights and make cutting edge business decisions by connecting them with industry subject matter experts for 1-1 discussions. As part of our team, you will develop a deep understanding of a client's underlying research interest and build a knowledge base of multiple industries.



No two days are the same at Capvision. At one moment you will be assisting a hedge fund's research into the European airlines market by recruiting an industry expert in the space. At the next you will be working alongside a global management consulting firm and speaking to a former c-suite executive from a Fortune 10 company who can provide insights into the United States eCommerce and Grocery Delivery space.



Does this sound interesting to you?


**Project Manager, Client Services - Job Responsibilities**


* PMs are key project managers, responsible for end to end project management, delegating tasks to team members, and directing client communications
* PMs are key decision-makers in expert selection, driving success through understanding client pain points, conducting cursory industry research, formulating and executing on sourcing strategies, and delivery of qualified experts, advisors, and consultants to influence client research
* Ensure team members are contributing to projects and achieving key measurable project-based goals
* Directly contribute to strategy and company growth through building and managing client relationships and training junior team members
* Collaborate with Account Management, Sales, Compliance, and International teams to ensure client engagement growth
* You will lead the charge in developing screening criteria and questions, as well as sourcing strategies to deliver qualified consultants, experts, and advisors to clients, based on client briefs and instructions
* Capvision PMs exercise discretion and independent judgment with respect to matters of significance and have direct impact on business operations of Capvision, Capvision Experts, and Capvision Clients
* PMs will work directly with Capvision Experts and have autonomy to negotiate and settle expert consultation rates


**Qualifications**


* Strong academic background gained in any undergraduate degree
* 8+ months of working experience in business development, sales, account management, agency recruiting, or consulting
* Fluent in English. Fluency in additional languages is a strong plus
* Direct experience in stakeholder management with junior team members
* Ability to flourish in a KPI driven environment
* Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills
* Strong time management skills and ability to set own schedule without falling behind on tasks
* Detail-oriented, strong organizational skills and ability to multitask projects in a fast-paced & changing environment both independently & collaboratively
* Ability to thrive in a collaborative, team environment
* An energetic self-starter with an entrepreneurial mindset who can learn quickly and actively seeks out new business opportunities
* Openness to being mentored and given constructive feedback
* Mature, professional, self-assured, presentable, humble, confident are just a few of the words to describe successful PM
* Eligible to work in the US, including F-1 visa holders with Optional Practical Training (OPT) status of at least 2 years


**Benefits + Compensation**


* Competitive compensation and bonus program, commensurate with your experience level. Base salary of $70,000 and an annual bonus target of $13,000 (paid monthly and uncapped!) - All in first year target compensation of $86,000 with an uncapped bonus potential
* Paid vacation, sick days, and company holidays
* Healthcare, vision, and dental plans
* 401k – Company match
* Tax-free commuter benefits program
* Very fast paced and motivated culture - 3.9 Glassdoor Rating for NYC Office
* Casual work environment
* Monday breakfast, weekly happy hours and events, free snacks and coffee/tea
* Mobile phone reimbursement (Annual $600)
* Monthly commuting stipend (Annual $1,200)
* Company sponsored meal plan - FREE lunch ($1,200 value)
company_description: We partner with prominent financial institutions, consulting firms, and global enterprises by providing high-quality expert consultations, survey solutions, and customized research.

title: Registered Nurse
description:

DaVita is seeking a Nurse who is looking to give life in an outpatient dialysis center. title: Growth Marketing Manager - Freelance
description:
At Sorare, we bet on passionate and innovative people! Are you looking for an empowering environment to grow professionally and personally? Join us in this tremendous adventure!

**Our Mission**
---------------


Sorare is a fantasy sports gaming experience and marketplace featuring officially licensed digital player cards. With Sorare you build legacy teams – buying, selling, collecting and trading player cards - and compete with them in free-to-play fantasy games to win rewards week over week and season over season, just like a professional sports owner.


Sorare is revolutionizing digital sports fandom, and now has over 3,5 million users across 180 countries. More than 300 iconic teams, clubs, and organizations including the Premier League, La Liga, Bundesliga, Serie A, MLS, NBA, NBPA, MLB, MLBPA, and many others have partnered with Sorare to build the next sports entertainment giant.

**Our Journey**
---------------


Sorare was founded by Nicolas Julia and Adrien Montfort in 2018 in Paris to bring sports fans across the globe closer to the players, teams, and leagues they love.


With 130-plus employees across France and US, Sorare is one of Europe’s fastest-growing startups and recently raised a $680 million Series B funding round from world-class investors including SoftBank, Accel, and Benchmark. Sorare also has athletes Serena Williams, Zinedine Zidane, Rio Ferdinand, Antoine Griezmann, Gerard Piqué, Blake Griffin, and Rudy Gobert among its investors, ambassadors, and advisors.

**Our Values**
--------------

* **Own your game:** Think and act like an owner, and expect your teammates to do the same. You are an “entrepreneur” empowered to make decisions and own the outcomes.
* **Build with the fans, and for the fans:** Have an obsession for high-quality user experiences. Engage our community with transparency to build trust and learn from the fans to deliver effective changes.
* **Run fast:** Take bold risks and outpace the competition in an ever changing environment. Have a bias for action (connected to team goals) and strive to ship and iterate.
* **Have fun and bring joy:** Sports have the power to unite people around the world, and as fans ourselves, we believe it is a privilege to work in this industry.
* **Win as a team:** We are all in this together as one team, win or lose. Inspire your teammates to always be better.

**Description**
---------------


We are seeking a passionate and dynamic Growth Marketing Manager to join our team on a 4-month contract, with the opportunity to convert to a full-time role based on performance and business needs.


This role is crucial in driving our growth through strategic CRM and User Acquisition (UA) campaigns, with a primary focus driving monetization. The ideal candidate will have a deep passion for sports, familiarity with web3 technology, and an entrepreneurial mindset to thrive in our fast-paced environment.

**Key Responsibilities**
------------------------

* CRM Management: Develop and execute strategies to engage existing users, enhancing their experience and driving spend on Sorare.
* User Acquisition Campaigns: Design and implement UA campaigns aimed at attracting new users, with a focus on the U.S. market.
* Cross-Platform Proficiency: Manage UA campaigns across various platforms, including PMAX, Meta, TikTok.
* GTM Strategy Support: Collaborate with the marketing and product teams to support go-to-market strategies targeting existing users.
* Marketing Analytics: Utilize marketing analytics to measure the effectiveness of campaigns and make data-driven decisions to improve performance.
* Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment and effective execution of marketing strategies.

**Qualifications**
------------------

* 2-4 years of experience in marketing, preferably in the sports, gaming, or web3 industries.
* A deep passion for sports and gaming, plus familiarity with web3 technology.
* Entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
* Proven track record of creative problem-solving and initiative.
* Proficiency in UA & CRM platforms (e.g., PMAX, Meta, TikTok, Braze).
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

**Our Hiring Process**
----------------------

* Step 1: Recruiter Screen (30 min)
* Step 2: Hiring Manager Screen
* Step 3: Case Study + Panel interviews
* Step 4: Reference Check & Offer


Sorare is an equal opportunity employer committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to: race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, or any other basis prohibited by law.


As we are an international company, please note we speak English in the workplace. Please apply for the role with an English CV so we can process your application.

title: Recruiter
description:
**ARROW** is one of the largest privately held security guard companies in the United States with a 97% customer retention rate and an average client relationship of over 15 years. Our dedication to customer service runs deep throughout the entire organization and is what sets us apart from the competition. With our continued growth and mission focus we are looking to add a **Recruiter** to our team in the Manhattan Office.


Serving as a welcome introduction for candidates and new hires to our Arrow Security-NYC community, the **Recruiter** manages full cycle recruiting to new hire onboarding stages for our dynamic Manhattan-based NYC regional office, The Recruiter's daily functions include digital and grassroots recruiting efforts, candidate interviewing, hiring and onboarding processes for new security staff, examining documentation for validity and accuracy and providing general staffing/HR support to recruitment and HR departments.


The Recruiter fosters best practices to ensure compliance with Federal and DOS regulations and is committed to the respect and integrity of our Arrow mission to provide an exceptional candidate and new hire experience.

**Essential Job Duties**

* Works with Recruitment Manager to research and implement grassroots recruiting strategies
* Manages candidate responses to job postings using applicant tracking software
* Performs candidate interviews and initiates hiring and onboarding processes
* NYS DOS/DLS verification of security officer credentials on state websites
* Reviews hiring package to ensure accuracy and completeness
* Performs E-Verify processes for I-9 forms and reviews documents for validity
* Attends regular recruitment team meetings to track progress and devise new strategies for success
* Other admin work as needed

**Position Requirements**

* At least 3 year of recruitment experience in high volume, high turnover industries
* At least 2 years of admin experience, HR experience a plus!
* Proficient in Microsoft Office, working knowledge of HRIS and ATS systems

title: Intern
description:
No Relocation Assistance Offered  

# 162071 - New York, New York, United States  

  

**Who We Are**  

Colgate-Palmolive Company is a caring, innovative growth company that is reimagining a healthier future for all people, their pets and our planet. Focused on Oral Care, Personal Care, Home Care and Pet Nutrition, we sell our products in more than 200 countries and territories under brands such as Colgate, Palmolive, elmex, hello, meridol, Sorriso, Tom’s of Maine, EltaMD, Filorga, Irish Spring, PCA SKIN, Protex, Sanex, Softsoap, Speed Stick, Ajax, Axion, Fabuloso, Soupline and Suavitel, as well as Hill’s Pet Nutrition.  

  

We are recognized for our leadership and innovation in promoting sustainability and community wellbeing, including our achievements in decreasing plastic waste and promoting recyclability, saving water, conserving natural resources and improving children’s oral health.  

  

If you want to work for a company that lives by their values, then give your career a reason to smile and join our global team!

 **About the Job**

 **The Product Commercialization and Innovation general role is designed to be the Marketing liaison at the Network Operations regional level, supporting NA OC, PC & HC Brands and Global Expansion.**

 **PC&I leads the end to end process for NA Brands/Sourcing and the associated strategic identification and direction of capital investment. This role also facilitates portfolio management, including simplification and harmonization. Ensure the implementation of the New Product Pipeline, key interfaces are North America Marketing and Finance, Regional Category Technical and Packaging Managers, regional manufacturing facilities, and Global Category Supply Chain.**

 **We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Intern to join our team and collaborate with the Oral Care group . This internship will provide hands-on experience in managing projects and working across various departments to ensure successful project delivery and tracking. This person will be joining Oral Care Team**

 **Location: Park Ave, NY**

 **Duration: 1 year based on year of school and/or performance**

 **Responsibilities:**

* **Development of a Single Source Tracker: Assist in creating and maintaining a comprehensive tracker to consolidate project information and streamline data access.**
* **Cross-Functional Communication and Follow-Ups: Facilitate communication between different teams to ensure alignment on project goals, deadlines, and deliverables. Follow up on action items and deliverables as needed.**
* **Understanding of Processes: Learn and understand internal processes to effectively contribute to project planning, execution, and reporting. Identify areas for process improvement and efficiency.**

**Qualifications:**

* **Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities.**
* **Confidence in communicating with cross-functional Teams.**
* **Experience using Google Suite (Sheets) and familiarity with project management tools is a plus.**
* **Eagerness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.**

**What We Offer:**

* **Mentorship and guidance from OC Team.**
* **Opportunity to contribute to real projects and make a meaningful impact.**

 **Compensation and Benefits**  

Salary Range $22.50 - $34.00 USD  

  

Pay is based on multiple non-discriminatory, individualized factors including but not limited to experience, job-related knowledge and education, skills and office/market location. In addition to base salary, salaried employees are eligible for annual discretionary bonuses, profit-sharing and, for Executive-level (salary grade 16 and above) roles only, long-term incentives in the form of Restricted Stock Units and/or Stock Options.  

  

Subject to the terms and conditions of the applicable benefits plans then in effect, all salaried employees are also eligible for a competitive benefits package which includes:

* Insurance: Employees (and their eligible dependents) are eligible to participate in Company-sponsored Medical, Dental, Vision, Basic Life Insurance, Accidental Death & Dismemberment and Disability insurance plans.
* Retirement Plans: Employees are eligible to enroll in Colgate's 401(k) plan, which provides for company matching contributions subject to eligibility requirements
* Vacation/PTO: Employees receive a minimum of 15 days of vacation/PTO leave annually
* Paid Holidays: Employees receive a minimum of 13 paid/floating holidays annually
* Paid Sick Leave: Based on location and consistent with applicable state and local law, employees receive a minimum of 40 hours of paid sick leave on January 1st of each year
* Paid Parental Leave: Eligible employees may take up to eight weeks of paid parental leave and 12 weeks of unpaid leave (varies for employees with fewer than 12 months of service and is subject to hours worked requirements)

 **Our Commitment to Sustainability**  

With the Colgate brand in more homes than any other, we are presented with great opportunities and new challenges as we work to integrate sustainability into all aspects of our business and create positive social impact. We are determined to position ourselves for further growth as we act on our 2025 Sustainability & Social Impact Strategy.  

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**  

Achieving our purpose starts with our people — ensuring our workforce represents the people and communities we serve —and creating an environment where our people feel they belong; where we can be our authentic selves, feel treated with respect and have the support of leadership to impact the business in a meaningful way.  

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**  

Colgate is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, marital status, veteran status (United States positions), or any other characteristic protected by law.  

  

Reasonable accommodation during the application process is available for persons with disabilities. Please contact Application\\_Accommodation@colpal.com with the subject "Accommodation Request" should you require accommodation.  

  

For additional Colgate terms and conditions, please click here.  

  

#LI-Hybrid

**Caring People of New Jersey is in search of LPNS for an at home client in RANDOLPH, NJ.** 

**We are looking to staff OVERNIGHTS 4xWEEK 11PM-7AM (Monitoring in-home dialysis, willing to train)**

Pay rates: $40 per hour for hourly shifts & $75 per visits

If these shifts do not fit your current schedule, please feel free to apply and be added to our roster for any future available shifts or visits!

**This is a great opportunity for LPNS who are looking for additional income! We are looking to add LPNS to our roster for private clients who may need LPN care or visits in the home. Apply and be added to our roster, So you can receive available shifts or visits! NO commitment at all! Work when you are available!**

Join our growing team of healthcare specialists today!

**WE PROUDLY OFFER:**

* **OFFERING A $1750 SIGN ON BONUS !!\\***
* Highly Competitive Pay Rates and Flexible Scheduling
* Unlimited Referral Bonus Program - Refer a friend and earn $$$!

*\\*PAID AFTER WORKING 200 HOURS IN THE FIRST 90 DAYS OF EMPLOYMENT*

\\*\\**PAID AFTER WORKING FIRST CASE*

**ABOUT CARING PEOPLE:**

Working for Caring People is more than just a job, it is a passion. We promote diversity, teamwork, and a culture of excellence and have fun all the while! Caring People is a national home health care agency that has been in business for more than 20 years. We provide respite care and 24-hour home health care in six (6) states including Florida, New York, Connecticut, New Jersey, Massachusetts and Texas. title: RN-Clinical Assessor/MDS Nurse
company: Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care and Rehabilitation
description:
**RN-Clinical Assessor-Full Time**


Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care and Rehabilitation, located in New Hyde Park, NY, is seeking an experienced, reliable and highly motivated Clinical Assessor knowledgeable in MDS to join our dedicated team of professionals in Nursing-Clinical Operations.


In this key clinical role working alongside nursing leadership and the interdisciplinary care team, the Clinical Assessor is responsible for the implementation of Resident Assessments, using the MDS 3.0 and PRI, and PDPM. The Clinical Assessor will also conduct periodic reassessments of Medicare-eligible residents, participate in interdisciplinary team meetings, and serve as a resource for the staff regarding appropriate medical record documentation for MDS.

**What Makes this a Great Opportunity?**


This key clinical role in a renowned health care facility among innovative and committed leaders in the industry. Excellent professional environment providing an opportunity to learn, grow and have an impact on the overall results.


Very competitive compensation range supported by a comprehensive benefits program, with generous time off as well as 401k with company match, Medical, Dental, Vision and more!

**Position Qualifications:**


This position requires a current New York State RN license and three years of experience in a long-term care facility as an MDS Coordinator, along with knowledge of Medicare criteria and assessment regulations. The ideal candidate must possess excellent listening and communication skills, the ability to complete documentation in a timely manner, as well as attention to detail and accuracy when performing assessments. Must be vaccinated against COVID-19

title: Recreation Aide
description:
**Position Summary:** Provides recreation programs to residents/patients appropriate to their levels of functioning and helps to ensure their social and mental well-being.
  
  

**Duties & responsibilities:**  

Includes, but not limited to -
  
  

1. Plans, organizes, implements and evaluates recreation programs through individual and group programs developed to meet the needs and interests of the residents/patients.
  
  

2. Keeps documentation on all residents who receive Recreation activities to include assessments, progress notes, care plans, discharge notes, attendance records.
  
  

3. Must read, write and speak English well to document and communicate all aspects of care.
  
  

4. Attend all staff meetings and departmental educational in-service programs.
  
  

5. Attend other related in-house in-service education programs.
  
  

6. Bring to the Director or Assistant Director's attention the progress of residents/patients receiving treatments or any problem that may be encountered in executing your duties.
  
  

7. Attend unit comprehensive care plan and 48-hour meetings (as needed) and work with the interdisciplinary team to develop appropriate goals for residents.
  
  

8. Assure that established safety regulations are followed at all times.
  
  

9. Report all unsafe/hazardous conditions/equipment immediately.
  
  

10. Collaborate with team members in planning special events, fund raisers and other programs.
  
  

10. Other related duties as assigned by the Director of Assistant Director of the Department.
  
  

**Education, Training and Experience:**  

High School Diploma or equivalent
  
  

Good writing skills to perform documentation responsibilities such as progress notes, assessments, and care plans.
  
  

Working experience with Microsoft office suite
  
  

One year experience in Long Term Care Setting or Geriatric Care.
  
  

**Physical Demands & Working Conditions:**  

Light work which may involve considerable moving about or may involve light lifting or carrying, usually not sustained

title: Maintenance Technician-Full Time
description:
**Maintenance**


Cobble Hill Health Center is a not-for-profit long-and short-term care facility providing services to the disabled and elderly for over 40 years. The Maintenance Worker plays an integral role in helping us to achieve our vision: to consistently exceed expectations and set the standard for excellence in residential and community care. We are looking for the best, brightest, most creative, and collaborative people to join our team. If you want to make a difference in your life and the lives of your colleagues and patients, we'd love to hear from you.

**Position Overview**


Maintenance of buildings, grounds, various utilities systems and servicing and repair of mechanical equipment, responsible for all major plumbing and electrical work, maintenance of all air conditioners, maintain building in compliance with building and safety codes, reports to Maintenance Director and Supervisor about all work that is being done through the facility.


**Responsibilities Include:**

* Assists in the application, installation, alteration, repair and maintenance of all structural, mechanical, electrical devices and other equipment as may be required
* Perform duties such as carpentry, painting, electrical repairs, and general repair work
* Perform necessary repairs of air conditioning and refrigeration
* Install all equipment, machinery, furniture, fixtures and other such devices as may be required.
* Maintain equipment and machinery in operating order
* Perform all necessary maintenance and repair duties as may be required
* Inspect any malfunctioning of equipment and any fire and other safety hazards
* Check maintenance logbooks on each unit on a daily basis, document status of job, report needed repairs or difficulties to Supervisors
* Must have sufficient knowledge of small tools - their handling and use
* Must install lamps in lighting fixtures, as required
* Must assist in the application, installation, alteration, repair and maintenance of all structural, mechanical, electrical devices, and such other equipment as may be required
* Must assist the carpenter in framing, furring, scaffold building, cutting wall board installation and such other work and installations as may be required
* Must assist the painter in protection of work, scaffolding erection, bridging such other work as may be required by the painter
* Must be able to identify standard electric wiring devices, boxes, wires, conduits, fittings, and such other components as may be regularly used for electrical installations
* Must be able to perform electrical repairs, maintenance and installations while working alone with limited- supervision

 **Position Requirements:**

* High School Diploma or Equivalent
* Must be able to read, write and communicate clearly in English
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* 3 years of experience in maintenance industry
* Basic knowlede of HVAC, plumbing and electrical systems
* Heavy Lifting or sustained physical effort - frequent moving of items up to 50 lbs
* Must be able to complete all physical requirements of the job with or without reasonable accomodation.

description:
**Member Service Representative**


VillageCareMAX


112 Charles Street, New York, NY 10014


COME WORK FOR THE LEADING, LOCAL MANAGED CARE COMPANY - VILLAGE CARE!

  

VillageCare is looking for a self-motivated Member Services Representative responsible for handling all calls that come through our call center. The MSR serves as the main point of communication for assisting members in accessing services, solving problems and communicating with other members of the Interdisciplinary Care Team. Some of your daily activities will include:

* Arrange appointments with physicians and other health care provider services.

We would like to speak to those who have 3+ years of experience in a related healthcare call center or service environment. **High school diploma required - Associates degree strongly preferred. Bilingual - Cantonese/Mandarin required.**

  

There are many benefits to working for VillageCare. If you are someone who likes being part of a team, enjoys a highly competitive benefits package from work leading carries and competitive compensation than we would love to speak with you!


* PTO package, 10 Paid Holidays, Personal and Sick time, Medical/Dental/Vision, HRA/FSA, Education Reimbursement, Retirement Savings 403(b), Life & Disability, Commuter Benefits, Paid Family Leave, Additional Employee Discounts


VillageCare offers a wide range of at-home and community-based services, as well as managed long-term care options that seek to match each individual's needs to help them attain and maintain the greatest level of independent living possible. We are committed to superior outcomes in quality health care.

title: Building Maintenance
description:
**The Hilton Garden Inn Stony Brook** is searching for a proactive and detail-oriented Building Maintenance Professional to keep our hotel running smoothly and flawlessly! If you enjoy a hands-on role and have a keen eye for detail, we want to hear from you!

**About Us:**

The Hilton Garden Inn Stony Brook is more than just a place to stay- it's a home away from home for our guests. Located on the beautiful campus of Stony Brook University, our hotel has 135 guest rooms, over 3,800 sq. ft. of event space, and is home to our very own restaurant Northern Coast Kitchen & Cocktails.

Managed by **Crescent Hotels & Resorts** we offer a dynamic work environment with a competitive salary and outstanding benefits.

**What will i be doing?**

As our Building Maintenance, you will be the cornerstone of our hotels upkeep. Your daily tasks will include conducting routine inspections, perform repairs on HVAC, plumbing, and mechanical systems. You will also ensure everything from guest rooms to common areas remain in pristine condition. Your role is crucial in maintaining a safe, comfortable, and seamless environment for our guests and staff.

**What are we looking for?**

* The ideal candidate must have experience in building maintenance, preferably in a hotel or hospitality setting. You must have a strong knowledge of HVAC, plumbing, and mechanical systems.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Flexibility to work varying shifts, including weekends and holidays, as needed.
* Certification in maintenance related fields is a plus.

**What will it be like to work for Crescent?**

At Crescent Hotels & Resorts, we are a team of hospitality professionals that are deeply connected to & proud of the exceptional experiences we provide for our guests. More than that, we know our Associates are the shining stars of what we do!

We understand what it takes to be a part of something great. We will encourage you to bring your true self to work every day, we will celebrate you and we will cheer you on as you shine bright in your career journey. Whether it be our health & wellness programs, best in class learning and development or our travel discounts that ‘feed your inner explorer’, we work hard to create and deliver on what YOU need. We are ready for you to start your journey with us where You Belong. We Care. Shine Bright.

**The Benefits**:

We are committed to providing you with:

* An exceptional medical, dental and vision benefit plans for you and your family
* RSP/401K matching program
* Life Insurance
* Short/long term disability
* Go Hilton travel discount program
* Discounts with our Crescent managed properties in North America for you & your family members

**Our Diversity Statement:**

At Crescent Hotels & Resorts we strive to create a great place to work where associates at all levels of our organization are respected for their differences, just like the guests and owners we serve. That’s why we are dedicated to creating an environment that facilitates open and honest conversations about race, equity, diversity, and inclusion. By examining our own beliefs and behaviors, we can create change through training, recruiting, and promoting diverse talent to strengthen our culture.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Sales Associate
description:
**High-Energy Sales Representative** 

**Pay:** Base: $40,000 Plus Uncapped Commission. Potential to make well over 6 figures

**Hours & Location:** Employee will be between Mount Sinai & Stony Brook. Employee will work 6 days a week around 6.5 hours per day.

**About Redefine Fitness:** At Redefine Fitness, we believe Fitness is Medicine. Our core values revolve around valuing others and demonstrating how fitness can transform lives. We're more than just a fitness studio; we're a community committed to making a difference.

**Job Description:** We are seeking a dynamic, high-energy, and money-driven Sales Representative to join our energetic team. The ideal candidate is someone who loves working out, embodies an outgoing and eccentric personality, and is exceptionally personable. While a background in the fitness industry is preferable, it's not a must. What we value most is your drive and ability to connect with people.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Actively engage with potential clients through our boots-on-the-ground approach.
* Book, conduct, and follow-up on fitness assessments.
* Convert leads into memberships and training packages.
* Track and report on key metrics, including assessment bookings, show rates, and sales closures.
* Participate in extensive sales training and development programs.
* Build, develop and embody a relationship with clients
* Make decisions freely without having to ask management
* Work with lead nurture company, marketing VA and help establish a seamless approach from lead to client

**Qualifications:**

* High-energy, outgoing, and eccentric personality.
* Strongly motivated by monetary rewards.
* Passion for fitness and wellness.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proactive and driven to succeed in a heavily commission-based position.
* Willingness to embrace our core values and community-focused approach.

**Benefits:**

* Uncapped commission structure with unlimited earning potential.
* 401(k) plan.
* AFLAC insurance.
* Free gym membership and personal training.
* Employee discounts.
* Comprehensive sales training and professional development.

**Join Us:** This is not just a job; it's a career that rewards you for making a real difference in people's lives. If you're ready to show the world that Fitness is Medicine, apply today and bring your passion to our team.

Book your round 1 virtual interview here: https://calendly.com/redefinefitnessli/sales

title: Human Resources Specialist
description:
**Job Title:** Human Resources Specialist

**Grade:** 16

**Salary:** $59,228 - $70,547


The Research Foundation for Mental Hygiene is seeking a qualified applicant to fill a full-time Human Resources Specialist position within the Human Resources Department at the New York State Psychiatric Institute (NYSPI). The HR Specialist will serve as the health benefits administrator and facilitate recruitment/operations activities.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Submit NYBEAS transactions for enrollment in or changes to employee medical, dental, and/or vision insurance, including addition and deletion of dependents.
* Answer inquiries from enrollees and others seeking guidance about their health, prescription drug, dental, vision, workers compensation, life insurance, or income protection benefits.
* Respond to facility inquiries regarding the proper application of, suspension, or waiver of various rules, eligibility questions about benefits, etc.
* File C-2 forms to initiate Workers' Compensation claims on behalf of employees who report a workplace incident and are seeking medical treatment and/or are absent from work as a result.
* File C-11 and C-256 forms, as needed, to report periods of absence related to workplace incidents, as well as wages paid during these absences.
* Assess and manage Workers' Compensation claims to track employee benefit use, ensure sufficient medical documentation is submitted, and provide guidance on employer rights and responsibilities.
* Confer with NY State Insurance Fund regarding employee Workers' Compensation claims to ensure employees are compliant with state laws and policies, and to obtain more information on adjudication of claims to determine appropriate employer response.
* Track and manage personal sick leaves and ensure sufficient medical documentation is submitted.
* Assess FMLA requests and advise employees on the parameters of FMLA leave.
* Assess periods of military leave and advise employees on the documentation requirements and parameters of military leave.
* Assess periods of maternity and/or childcare leave and advise employees on the documentation requirements and parameters of maternity and/or childcare leave.
* Advises employees and their organizational representatives and managers from State agencies concerning application of the benefit articles contained in union agreements covering State employees.
* Review certificates of insurance and other informational materials to resolve misunderstandings of the provisions in benefit plans.
* Serve as expert on leave benefits for NYSPI.
* Advise employees on retirement process and post-employment benefits.
* Manage outside employment applications.
* Conduct hiring activities including but not limited to on-boarding of new and promoted employees, processing, orientation, requesting Civil Service Eligible Lists, and requesting job postings.
* Ensures all preemployment requirements are completed for all employees being on-boarded such as screening through Staff Exclusion List, conducting criminal background checks, references check, credentialing and licensing reviews, verifying medical clearance through Infection Control, screening through the Statewide Central Register of Child Abuse and Maltreatment (SCR), conducting degree verifications, and when applicable, scheduling physical/medical screening through Employee Health Service
* Assist with interview scheduling by contacting eligible lists candidates as well as job posting candidates, drafts, and issues interview letters, provides hiring manager with interview schedule, ensures all necessary applications are completed and submitted from the candidates and ensures all post-interview documentation is received from interviewers in a timely manner.
* Provide a high level of assistance to employees and supervisors.
* Supervision of clerical staff

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree
* Three years of experience in Human Resources administration

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Prior experience with Benefits Administration, Attendance and Leave Administration, FMLA and employee recruitment, on-boarding, and off-boarding preferred.

**Work Location:** 1051 Riverside Drive, New York, NY 10032

**To Apply:** Submit an application through our website at https://nyspi.applicantpro.com/jobs/. Please note only applications submitted through our website will be considered.


The Mission of the Research Foundation for Mental Hygiene, Inc. (RFMH) is to promote the mental health of all New Yorkers, with a focus on providing hope and supporting recovery for adults with serious mental illness and children with serious emotional disturbances. Applicants with lived mental health experience are encouraged to apply. RFMH is deeply committed to supporting underserved individuals, organizations, and communities. To this end, RFMH is focused on implementing activities and initiatives to reduce disparities in access, quality, and treatment outcomes for underserved populations. A critical component of these efforts is ensuring that RFMH is a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees' unique attributes and skills are valued and utilized to support the mission of the Agency. RFMH is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.


The Research Foundation is a private not-for-profit corporation and is not an agency or instrumentality of the State of New York. Employees of the Research Foundation are not state employees, do not participate in any state retirement system, and do not receive state fringe benefits. Excellent Benefits Package. Employer/Minority/Women/Disabled/Veteran Employer. VEVRAA 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) compliant.

title: Research Assistant
description:
**Job Title:** Research Assistant

**Grade:** 11

**Salary:** $45,119 - $53,897


The Research Foundation for Mental Hygiene is seeking a qualified applicant to fill a full-time Research Assistant position in the Developmental Neuroscience lab at the New York State Psychiatric Institute. The lab's research focuses on in vivo recordings in mice to identify the molecular, cellular and circuit basis of behaviors that are relevant to healthy behaviors and also symptoms of psychiatric disorders. In this role, the ideal candidate will support research projects that involve advance neuroscience techniques to determine the neurobiological basis of cognition and motivation. The chosen candidate must possess strong organizational, communication, and record-keeping skills.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Managing a colony of four different lines of transgenic mice.
* Ordering and maintaining supplies, reagents, and tracking expenses.
* Oversee the lab's training and compliance requirements for safety and animal welfare
* Alongside these administrative tasks, the assistant will help with histology, immunohistochemistry, fluorescence microscopy, Behavioral testing and surgical procedures

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* A bachelor's degree from a four-year institution and a minimum of 1 year of experience in a research setting
* At least 4 years of experience with general computer programs (such as Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint)

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience working with mice.
* Training will be provided for the specialized software required for mouse colony management (Transnetyx) and lab ordering and inventories (Quartzy), but some similar previous experience is preferred.

**Work Location:** 1051 Riverside Drive, New York, NY 10032

**To Apply:** Submit an application through our website at https://nyspi.applicantpro.com/jobs/. Please note only applications submitted through our website will be considered.

title: Arbitration Specialist
description:
**Seeking a hard-working person with previous medical collection or medical collection management experience.**  Must have relevant experience to directly assist the Chief Operating Officer and in-house legal counsel with managing medical arbitration cases. This is a large multistate neurosurgical monitoring practice and it’s a faced paced environment. Duties will include preparing federal NSA arbitration cases, PIP arbitration cases, and Worker's Compensation arbitration cases, from onset through negotiations and all the way to the posting of judgment award.

**Responsibilities:**

* Help manage and follow-up on Federal NSA (No Surprises Act) arbitrations, PIP/No Fault arbitrations, and Workers Compensation arbitrations, during all stages of the negotiation and arbitration process.
* Organize and prepare cases for submission to arbitration by reviewing, finalizing, and compiling documents.
* Coordinate and maintain all arbitration schedules, deadlines, and arbitration calendars.
* Draft, proofread, and format routine correspondence and arbitration documents conforming to applicable rules.
* Submit arbitration documents via online portals.
* Proactively assume other duties as necessary.

**The successful candidate will possess a combination of relevant employment, educational, and life experience that demonstrates the ability to do the job. They will be comfortable balancing tasks of varying levels of urgency and complexity and work well under pressure with tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.**

**Benefits:**

* PTO / SICK accruals
* 401(k) offered
* Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance offered

title: Subsurface Utility Engineering (SUE) Field Technician ll - Req 1298
description:
Interested in the opportunity for a great career as a utility locator. Join T2 Utility Engineers (T2ue) in Oceanside, NY as part of our Subsurface Utility Engineering (SUE) field tech team. Our SUE field techs gain on-the-job training in utility locating and utility designating, along with knowledge and experience in Subsurface Utility Engineering and surveying methods and technology. When you join our field tech team, you’re not confined to an office. T2ue provides you with outstanding benefits and an opportunity for a great career with room for advancement.

Are you self-motivated and interested in learning? We’re looking for people interested in advancing and building a career with the leader in the utility locating industry. You don’t need experience in our industry to join our team. We’ll provide training, you provide the initiative to build a career with us.

Since 1993, T2 Utility Engineers has provided professional Subsurface Utility Engineering and surveying services in support of infrastructure projects of all sizes and types. Using advanced technologies, our team of field technicians, engineers, and surveyors, provide quality data and professional insight to help our clients visualize, plan, and design their projects. Our mission is to provide project stakeholders with quality information, professional insight and deliverables that streamline construction, improve project safety and set the standard for the engineering industry.

SUE Technician II responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

* Be skilled in the operation of SUE utility locating and designating equipment, including pipe and cable locators, Ground Penetrating Radar (GPR), and non-destructive vacuum excavation
* Complete detailed accurate daily reports, forms and field sketches, both electronically as well as draft by hand

title: Client Service Coordinator
description:
**OVERVIEW:**

**At Guidepoint, we're the experts in finding expertise.**



Guidepoint is a leading research enablement platform designed to advance understanding and empower our clients' decision-making process. Powered by innovative technology, real-time data, and hard-to-source expertise, we help our clients to turn answers into action.  

  

Backed by a network of nearly 1.5 million experts, and Guidepoint's 1,300 employees worldwide we inform leading organizations' research by delivering on-demand intelligence and research on request. With Guidepoint, companies and investors can better navigate the abundance of information available today, making it both more useful and more powerful. For more information, visit www.guidepoint.com.


**Play a vital role in Guidepoint's success.**



As a Coordinator on the Client Service team, you will be overseeing all administration withing your client service team. You will be booking client consultations, tracking projects for the team, and qualifying the experts.


**This position can be remote within the United States and will be working east coast hours.**


**Who We Are:**

* Team-oriented and collaborative
* Hard-working professionals who strive for excellence
* Hands-on leadership to help you develop your career and provide opportunities for upward mobility within Guidepoint


**What YOU will own:**


* Responsible for scheduling bulk telephone consultations for client service teams
* Manage multiple client organization requests and respond within a timely manner
* Coordinate with advisors and clients to confirm telephone consultations
* Leave messages and follow up with Advisors to expedite scheduling projects
* Maintain an updated status of client telephone consultations
* Qualify Advisors via questionnaire to confirm if they are appropriate for consultations
* Follow multiple work streams to help Project Managers organize client requests and track progress on projects
* Assist with ad-hoc requests


**Experience YOU will bring:**


* 1-3 years of previous work experience dealing in a high call volume environment
* Work authorization required


**Skills YOU will bring:**


* Attention to detail and excellent follow-up skills required
* Strong aptitude for developing systems of organization
* Excellent time management skills and able to multi-task
* Ability to work as part of a team and independently
* Excellent sense of urgency and responsiveness


**What We Offer:**



The annual base salary for this position is $50,000 annually

  


**You will also be eligible for the following benefits:**


* 15 PTO Days, 10 legal holidays, and 5 sick days
* Comprehensive Medical, dental, and vision plans
* 10% 401(k) match, life insurance, paid time-off and parental leave plans
* Commuter benefits and a corporate gym rate
* Development opportunities through the LinkedIn Learning platform
* Friday happy hour, "Summer Fridays", and free snacks
* Casual work environment, team building, and other social events
* Option to be full-time remote


**ABOUT GUIDEPOINT**



Become part of a rapidly growing, global organization, with nearly 1,300 employees spread across 15 strategic offices in 12 countries. Guidepoint's broad range of expert services empowers our clients to access new industries, get up to speed on trending topics, enable in-depth exploration of critical subjects, and offer validation of qualitative insights. For more information, visit www.guidepoint.com.



At Guidepoint, our success relies on the diversity of our employees, advisors, and client base, which allows us to create connections that offer a wealth of perspectives. We are committed to upholding policies that contribute to an equitable and welcoming environment for our community, regardless of background, identity, or experience.



#LI-BR1

title: Supervisor, Nursing Services
description:
**Position Title**:

Supervisor, Nursing Services

**Position Type**:

Full-Time, Salary, Exempt

**Schedule:**

Day

**Department/Program**:

Care Coordination/Behavioral Health Services

**Direct Supervisor**:

Director, Care Coordination

**Direct Reports (if any):**

Nursing Care Coordinators

**About Graham Windham**:

In full partnership with families and communities, Graham Windham strives to make a life-altering difference with children, youth, and families who are overcoming some of life’s most difficult challenges and obstacles, by helping to build a strong foundation for life: a safe, loving, permanent family and the opportunity and preparation to thrive in school and in the world. With over 500 full-time employees serving children and families in multiple programs throughout the Bronx, Brooklyn and Harlem, Graham Windham provides an exciting and enriching work experience.

**Principal Objective/Role Overview:**

The Nurse Care Coordinator Supervisor works with Graham’s multidisciplinary teams, Graham parents, foster parents, and external providers to ensure that all children in Graham’s care receive the physical health assessments, services, and follow-up to ensure that they are healthy while at Graham and post-discharge. The Care Coordination Supervisor is responsible for overseeing all aspects of the Nurse Care Coordinator’s role.

**Job Responsibilities**:

* Provides quality supervision to direct reports inclusive of:
* Regular and continuous observation and evaluation of staff’s client face-to-face interactions, documentation, and everyday practice to ensure that staff is consistently attending to their responsibilities of Care Coordination.
* Ensures that there is ongoing assessment of staff skill development and schedules/monitors staff training. Provides consistent feedback on performance and supports staff in areas of need.
* Provides guidance and training to staff on assessment/tools (i.e. following required 29i medical assessments, HIV risk assessment, etc.).
* Reviews tracking reports on new admissions, medical consents, well child visits, HIV risk assessments, medical treatment planning, documentation of activities and medical record maintenance.
* Ensures that there is continuous assessment of functioning and that care plans are reflective of current needs.
* Facilitates changes to care plans and reviews direct report care plans to ensure that they are thorough and ensure quality care.
* Reviews and signs off medical forms (i.e. school/camp forms, work forms, sports participation, WIC forms, adoption medicals, Special/Exceptional rate requests, Social Security letters etc.)
* Ensures completion of documents is timely and responsive to youth/family’s needs.
* Partners meaningfully with service providers/foster parents/discharge resources:
* Includes foster parents and parents as needed in collateral sessions to obtain pertinent information related to child/youth functioning as it relates to medical symptoms and service needs.
* Discusses child medical issues with caregivers and effectively coaches caregivers on how to manage child/youth’s medical conditions.
* Provides caregivers training aimed at educating and supporting caregivers in managing the clinical needs of children/youth in their care. Conducts caregiver’s training on medication monitoring and collaborates with CP to monitor medication tracking logs.
* Participates in permanency FTCs and provides input related to medical/behavioral health needs, service planning for youth and families.
* Ensures that appropriate medical/behavioral health referrals/services are in place prior to transition from child welfare system.
* Performs continuous quality reviews of performance/regulatory requirements:
* Competent and effective coordination of audits and other regulatory tasks.
* Ensures that there is consistent review of medical documentation (i.e. Connections Netsmart, Office Practicum and other medical records).
* Ensures that physical plant requirements as they pertain to safe, secure, confidential provision of treatment are maintained.
* Insures sufficient nursing staff coverage hours.

**Other Position Requirements**:

* Willingness and ability to travel when needed throughout several Graham sites located in Brooklyn, The Bronx and Harlem
* Position is hybrid
* Comfortable with remote work and supervising remote staff

**Salary & Compensation**:

* **Base Salary or Hourly Rate**: $80,000.00/year
* **FLSA** **Status**: Exempt
* **Benefits Eligibility**: This position is benefits eligible; sample benefits include:
* Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance
* Retirement Plans (403B Thrift with match, Pension)
* Potential to participate in our Performance Based Merit Award program at the end of each fiscal year.

**Position Qualifications**:

* Registered Professional Nurse NYS License required.
* A minimum of 2 years postgraduate experience and at least 2 years of supervisory experience.
* Familiarity with NYS/NYC Foster Care systems and requirements.
* Experience in Pediatric/Adolescent Health Care preferred.
* Strong collaborative and organizational skills are needed.
* Comfortable with electronic health record documentation

**EEO Statement**

The Equal Employment Opportunity Policy of Graham Windham (GW) is to provide a fair and equal employment opportunity for all associates and job applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability. GW hires and promotes individuals solely based on their qualifications for the job to be filled.

Graham Windham believes that associates should be provided with a working environment which enables each associate to be productive and to work to the best of his or her ability. We do not condone or tolerate an atmosphere of intimidation or harassment based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability.

We expect and require the cooperation of all associates in maintaining a discrimination and harassment-free atmosphere.

* 403(b) matching

* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

* Day shift

* RN License (Required)

* Brooklyn, NY 11201 (Required)

* Brooklyn, NY 11201: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Business Development Manager
description:
Parsippany, NJ

**Highlight Motor Freight** is one of the largest and fastest growing transportation companies in North America. As a result of our driven marketing approach and second-to-none work ethic, we are experiencing tremendous growth. In order to keep up with our growth we will be seeking experienced, professional, energetic, goal-oriented individuals to complement our organization.

**Highlight Motor Freight** offers an exciting, fast-paced environment that has ideal positions for someone who is looking for a **REAL** career move. To work for **Highlight Motor Freight** you must have great people skills, communicate well, have a team oriented personality, and have the desire to set and achieve goals. As our company is constantly expanding, we are looking for those candidates who are highly motivated and driven by the opportunity for financial reward and career advancement in the family like working environment.

**Job Description:**

We are looking for a highly motivated and energetic **Business Development Manager** who will establish potential client’s base by contacting prospective clients and expanding business with current clients. **Business Development Manager** will be developing strategic plans and marketing programs to increase company’s revenues and profitability.

**What We Offer:**

* **UNLIMITED POTENTIAL INCOME**
* **ABOVE INDUSTRY AVERAGE SALARY AND BONUS STRUCTURE**
* **CAR AND CELL PHONE ALLOWANCE**
* **COMPANY PAID BENEFITS PACKAGE**
* **GREAT WORKING CONDITIONS**
* **MORE THAN 500 TRUCKS ON THE ROAD TO SUPPORT YOUR CLIENTS 24/7**

**Responsibilities:**

* Responsible for effectively securing new customers and account acquisitions as well as maintaining and developing existing accounts.
* Promote the services and products of all entities and coordinate sales efforts with other department sales.
* Analyze and conduct research on potential clients that have a need for our services and educate customers about our shipping solutions.
* Generate leads through cold calling, networking and referrals.
* Ensure a high level of customer satisfaction- maintain close contact with all customers– including follow up on concerns or other issues.
* Execute and monitor strategic and tactical goals to maximize sales, profit and to ensure sales targets are met or exceeded.
* Consults and develops strategies with potential customers through phone, virtual, and in-person meetings on transportation.
* Develop, facilitate and negotiate the proposal pricing process and rate agreements to customers.
* Meet and exceed target set in terms of contributing and generating revenue for the department.
* Provide documented activity reports of your sales efforts on a daily, weekly and monthly basis.

**Requirements:**

* At least 2+ years of sales experience in logistics/supply chain and transportation industry is an asset but not required.
* Strong work ethic and competitive nature with energetic and outgoing personality
* Goal-driven and self-starter personality motivated for sales with strong leadership and training skills.
* Outstanding entrepreneurial and negotiating skills at closing deals and cold-calls.
* Superior customer relation skills, excellent oral, written and interpersonal communications skills.
* Sound organizational, records management and time management skills, plus excellent attention to detail.
* The ability to effectively prioritize responsibilities, meet assigned deadlines, and manage related stress.
* Computer knowledge- working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications.

title: Subsurface Utility Engineering (SUE) Locator I - Req. 1297
description:
Interested in the opportunity for a great career as a utility locator, with no experience or advanced degree required? Join T2 Utility Engineers (T2ue) in Oceanside ,NY as part of our Subsurface Utility Engineering (SUE) field tech team. Our entry-level SUE field techs gain on-the-job training in utility locating and utility designating, along with knowledge and experience in Subsurface Utility Engineering and surveying methods and technology. When you join our field tech team, you’re not confined to an office. T2ue provides you with outstanding benefits and an opportunity for a great career with room for advancement.

Are you self-motivated and interested in learning? We’re looking for people interested in advancing and building a career with the leader in the utility locating industry. You don’t need experience in our industry to join our team. We’ll provide training, you provide the initiative to build a career with us.

Since 1993, T2 Utility Engineers has provided professional Subsurface Utility Engineering, UC, and surveying services in support of infrastructure projects of all sizes and types. Using advanced technologies, our team of field technicians, engineers, and surveyors, provide quality data and professional insight to help our clients visualize, plan, and design their projects. Our mission is to provide project stakeholders with quality information, professional insight and deliverables that streamline construction, improve project safety and set the standard for the engineering industry.

**SUE Locator I** **responsibilities include, but are not limited to:** 

* Learn the operation of SUE utility locating and designating equipment, including pipe and cable locators and non-destructive vacuum excavation
* Use of tools and equipment to conduct utility investigations, including jackhammer, pogo-tamper, concrete saw, compressor blower, vacuum hose, air lance, and hand tools
* Drive commercial motor vehicles, however a CDL license is not required
* Complete daily logs of work performed, which includes simple mathematics
* Perform daily basic vehicle maintenance
* Perform safety set-up and maintenance of traffic operations under direct supervision of senior field staff
* Assist with survey and data collection tasks, supporting overall crew activities
* Perform daily routine maintenance of equipment

**SUE Locator I** **Qualifications:** 

* High School Diploma/GED
* Valid driver's license with good driving record
* Ability to pass a pre-employment physical (U.S. only)
* Ability to obtain a DOT medical card for CMV operation (U.S. only)
* Ability to lift 50 lbs. and perform physical movements necessary to operate heavy tools and equipment (Heavy Equipment including but not limited to Jack Hammers, Pneumatic Tamper / Air lance, Vacuum Excavation).
* Ability to work outdoors in all climates
* Willingness to travel up to 50% of the time, by company vehicle or commercial airline, up to 2 week continuous stay.
* Must have a good oral communication skills and attention to detail
* OSHA Safety certifications are a plus
* Prior utility related experience is a plus
* Basic understanding of Highway/Utility plans is a plus, but not required

**We Offer a Complete Benefits Package!** 

In addition to the opportunity to grow and advance, we offer competitive salaries, paid training, and comprehensive benefits with options to meet your needs, including;

* Paid time off
* Paid overtime
* Paid holidays
* Company provided cell phone or cell phone allowance
* Boot and clothing allowance
* Generous daily food and incidentals allowance when overnight travel is required
* Medical and prescription drug coverage – multiple plan options
* Flexible Spending (FSA), Dependent Care (DCA), or Health Savings (HSA) accounts
* Dental
* Vision
* Wellness and Employee Assistance Programs
* Parental, Family and Medical leave
* 401-K retirement plan w/company match
* Life insurance
* Short / long term disability
* Tuition reimbursement
* Spot and annual bonus incentives
* Employee discounts and perks

\\* Please Note that selected candidates will be required to pass a drug, background and reference screening.

T2 Utility Engineers is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status or disability. If you require an accommodation at any time during the recruitment or application process, please contact Human Resources.

T2 Utility Engineers does not accept unsolicited resumes from any 3rd party agencies. No fee will be paid to 3rd parties who submit unsolicited resumes to any T2 Utility Engineer employee. title: National Account Manager
description:
Parsippany, NJ

**Highlight Motor Freight** is one of the largest and fastest growing transportation companies in North America. As a result of our driven marketing approach and second-to-none work ethic, we are experiencing tremendous growth. In order to keep up with our growth we will be seeking experienced, professional, energetic, goal-oriented individuals to complement our organization.

**Highlight Motor Freight** offers an exciting, fast-paced environment that has ideal positions for someone who is looking for a **REAL** career move. To work for **Highlight Motor Freight** you must have great people skills, communicate well, have a team oriented personality, and have the desire to set and achieve goals. As our company is constantly expanding, we are looking for those candidates who are highly motivated and driven by the opportunity for financial reward and career advancement in the family like working environment.

**Job Description:**

We are looking for a high-performing **National Account Manager** who will be responsible for achieving sales and gross margin objectives and help us meet acquisition and revenue growth targets by keeping our company competitive and innovative.

**Responsibilities:**

* Determine annual unit and gross-profit plans by implementing marketing strategies.
* Achieve Sales and Gross Profit objectives, as well as other defined KPI’s, for the Year.
* Design and implement a strategic business plan that expands the company’s customer base and ensures its strong presence.
* Develop a database of qualified leads through referrals, telephone canvassing, face to face cold calling on business owners, by email, and networking.
* Build and promote strong, long-lasting customer relationships by partnering with them, understanding their needs and ensuring a continued high level of service is provided.
* Working with all the appropriate members to ensure each existing or potential client receives timely accurate quotes and all the support information that enables the client to make their decisions in a timely and cost-effective manner.
* Present sales, revenue and expenses reports and realistic forecasts to the management team.
* Identify emerging markets and market shifts while being fully aware of new products and competition status.
* Manage daily functioning of all new client relationships.
* Develop and promote strategic, bespoke solutions to generate new business opportunities.
* Train, coach and set objectives, monitor performance of sales team to ensure that assigned tasks and responsibilities are fulfilled.

**Requirements:**

* Minimum 3 years of sales manager experience in transportation industry
* Outstanding closing deals skills
* Strong organizational and tactical skills to prioritize and manage and achieve Sales Targets
* Good interpersonal skills with the ability to work in a team-based approach and develop excellent relationships with customers.
* Demonstrate high personal integrity and be willing to take responsibility for achieving annual sales and gross margin objectives.
* Extensive knowledge of Transportation/Logistics industry and the key target markets
* Superior customer relation skills, excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication skills with the ability to contribute support and enhance the team.
* Strong understanding of customer and market dynamics and requirements
* Computer knowledge – working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications
* Proven track record of sales.

**We offer market competitive wages with great benefits package.**

Job Type: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

*Please note that only the candidates selected for the interview will be contacted.*

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

* Commission pay

title: QA Sampler/Inspector
description:
The Quality Assurance Raw Material Sampler's primary responsibilities are as follows:

* To review, inspect, and sample all incoming raw materials and components.
* To review, inspect, and sample all expired raw materials.
* To review all raw materials slated for destruction.
* To review and sign off on material slated for delivery to Contract Venders.


Secondary Responsibilities, as QA Inspector:

* To review, check and ensure the quality of the all product produced at NOLI from raw material, in-process to finished product
* Ensure all quality aspects of the facility and that the facility remains a high-quality manufacturing environment.
* Check the accuracy of all production records, including batch records, run sheets, destruction forms, and material reconciliations.
* Verifying the accuracy, integrity, and quantity of raw materials used in production batches.
* Inspect and release all production work areas and equipment prior to start-up of batches and after cleaning of equipment.
* Perform quality checks on in-process and finished product during production runs.
* Perform all additional tasks relating to the Quality Assurance department as assigned.

**Physical Requirements:**

* This position requires walking/standing throughout the day
* Must be able to lift up to 30lbs.

**Qualifications**:


* Education/Work Experience:


High School diploma or equivalent, AS degree in related sciences preferred. Prior experience in pharmaceutical, biotech, or nutritional supplement industry along with cGMP training a plus.

* Technical Skills/Other Requirements:


Good verbal, written, and communication skills necessary.

title: Document Control Associate
description:
**Leading Long Island manufacturer of nutraceuticals and nutritional supplements seeks a hands-on entry to senior level Document Control Associate in Quality Assurance - Technical Affairs & Document Control.**

 **The QA Technical Affairs/Document Control Associate is responsible for supporting the Technical Affairs/Document group in the creation, review, revision, oversight, and maintenance of all master and controlled cGMP documents generated at the site and maintaining both their physical and electronic records (e.g. in ETQ, Formulator, and SAP systems) as per company procedures and policies. These documents include but are not limited to standard operating procedures, protocols, tasks/instructions, master manufacturing records, batch records, specifications, white papers, change controls, audit reports, calibration and maintenance records and other related documentation.**

 **Strong verbal and written communication skills required. Good organizational and typing skills a plus. Computer literacy a must - proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Teams, Access, Power Point).**

 **AS or BS degree in related sciences and/or 2 to 5 years of experience in a GMP environment preferred. Knowledge of GMPs, SOPs, batch record review, and product release also preferred.**

title: Foreclosure Paralegal - Garden City
description:
**The Company**


Friedman Vartolo LLP is a rapidly growing New York based real estate and default services law firm with 200+ employees across six states. The firm prides itself not solely on its superior legal product, but also on its innovative approach to business and problem solving. We offer a fresh, fast-paced energy, with a startup vibe.

 **The Position**


Friedman Vartolo LLP is seeking experienced Foreclosure Paralegal to join our rapidly growing team. We're looking for bright, enthusiastic individuals, who will bring a strong work ethic and eagerness to grow alongside the firm.


The ideal candidate will have a broad range of foreclosure experience including, but not limited to managing foreclosure from referral through conclusion, ordering title, obtaining payoffs, deed, assignment and letter preparation, meeting time sensitive deadlines, providing updates and timely responses to clients, etc.  



  

**Qualifications**

* Minimum of 2-year related foreclosure experience
* Broad knowledge of real estate default services
* Experience in LPS, Caseaware, Tempo, etc. is a plus.
* Superior organizational skills, research, and writing skills
* Detail oriented
* Independent worker; Deadline driven
* Able to manage a heavy workload
* Confident and comfortable on the phone
* Works well under pressure

 **Compensation/Benefits**


We offer a compensation package that will be commensurate with experience and a competitive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, flex spending, 401k and gym/fitness membership reimbursement.

 **ADA Compliance**


Consistent with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), it is the policy of Friedman Vartolo to provide reasonable accommodations when requested by a qualified applicant or candidate with a disability, unless such accommodation would cause an undue hardship for Friedman Vartolo. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete a job application, pre-employment testing, a job interview or to otherwise participate in the hiring process, please contact Recruitment at recruitment@friedmanvartolo.com to request an accommodations.

 **Location**


This position is located in our Garden City office.
