title: Inside Sales Representative (Electrical Products)
description:
Power-Flo Technologies Moonachie has served the needs of the OEM, Industrial, Commercial, and MRO markets in New Jersey since 1934. We are looking for you to join our collaborative team as an **inside sales representative for electrical products.** **Our Core Values**

* Our People
* Relationships
* Innovation
* Sustainability
* Growth
* Determination

 **Inside Sales Representative Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following :**

* Preparing sales proposals.
* Supporting outside sales staff.
* Providing best in class customer service to our customers at all times.
* Providing product information and regular vendor contact for various reasons i.e., expediting open orders.
* Using industrial & electrical product knowledge to better communicate with customers.
* Reaching out to customers on an as needed basis to inquire about potential future needs.
* Supporting customers by suggesting additional products that could compliment their needs for the specific job that they are working on.
* Working with credit department to inquire and help provide resolution to account financial status for customers.

 **Inside Sales Representative Requirements for the position include :**

* Minimum 2 years of electrical distribution sales experience required.
* Electrical supplies product knowledge required.
* Prior relationships with the vendors relevant to our industry/business (electrical) preferred.
* Excellent written and oral communication skills.
* Excellent customer service skills.
* Must be committed to learning our business and keeping up to date on all product lines.
* Willingness to learn about all aspects of electrical and industrial distribution.
* Must be a self-motivated and sales driven individual.
* Experienced being responsible for maintaining and exceeding quota’s/sales goals.
* Must be able to learn our Windows based and our text command-based ERP System.
* Valid and clean driver's license to travel (as needed).
* Experience with our ERP System that is called Eclipse is a plus.


Please note, we will only consider applicants that have electrical distribution sales experience.

 **Physical Requirements**

* Ability to sit for prolonged periods of time.
* Ability to utilize a computer keyboard, computer monitor, computer mouse, adding machine, and telephone for prolonged periods of time.

 **Salary Commensurate with Experience**

**Competitive Benefits Package**

* Health insurance (medical, dental, vision)
* PTO program and paid holidays
* 401K with employer match
* Company provided life insurance (after 1 year of employment)

  

Learn more about us here: https://www.powerflotechnologies.com/


Follow us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/power-flo-technologies

 *We are an equal opportunity employer. Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the US. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of employment Visa.*

*Power-Flo Technologies and its subsidiaries participate in the USCIS E-Verify Program to verify that all new hires are authorized to work in the United States.*

*Power-Flo Technologies is a unique Family of Companies consisting of distributors, fabricators, manufacturers and motor and pump repair firms serving the New York metropolitan and New England areas. We are a Master Distributor and Manufacturers Representative with REAL SYSTEMS SOLUTIONS.*

title: Program Assistant
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Program Assistant
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Healthcare - Administrative Services
  

**Department** NJMS-Cancer Center Initiative
  

**Overview**
New Jersey’s academic health center, Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences (RBHS) takes an integrated approach to educating students, providing clinical care, and conducting research, all with the goal of improving human health. Aligned with Rutgers University–New Brunswick and collaborating university wide, RBHS includes eight schools, a behavioral health network, and five centers and institutes that focus on cancer treatment and research, neuroscience, advanced biotechnology and medicine, environmental and occupational health, and health care policy and aging research.  

  

Our faculty are teachers, clinicians, and scientists with unparalleled experience who advance medical innovation and provide patient care informed by the latest research findings. We offer an outstanding education in medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, public health, nursing, biomedical research, and the full spectrum of allied health careers.  

  

Our clinical and academic facilities are located throughout the state—at Rutgers University–New Brunswick, including Piscataway; and at locations in Newark, Scotch Plains, Somerset, Stratford, and other locations. Clinical partners include Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital in New Brunswick, Newark’s University Hospital in Newark, and other affiliates.  

  

Through this community of healers, scientists, and scholars, Rutgers is equipped as never before to transform lives.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is seeking a Program Assistant – (Community Doula Services) for the Clinical Research Unit and the Department of Obstetrics, Gynecology, and Reproductive Health within the New Jersey Medical School. Under direction, the Program Assistant – (Community Doula Services) will support the program activities of the Well-Mama Program, a multi-site research project conducted by Northwestern University, Rutgers New Jersey Medical School, John H. Stroger Cook County Hospital, and Women’s Hospital, Baton Rouge. Community Doula Services (CDSs) will serve the combined roles of doulas, community health workers, and patient care navigators to address the top drivers of maternal mortality and severe material morbidity for pregnant and postpartum Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPOC) women.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* Bridge communication between patients and healthcare providers.
* Collaborate and communicate with research project team members (e.g., supervisor, project manager, researchers, other CDSs, etc.)
* Participate in shadowing sessions and orientation meetings with clinical team members.
* Lead Monthly 1-hour virtual pregnancy and postpartum support groups.

title: Mental Health Specialist IV (part time)
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Mental Health Specialist IV (part time)
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Healthcare - Medical and Patient Services
  

**Department** UBHC-Controller-PISC
  

**Overview**
Rutgers University Behavioral Health Care (UBHC), established in 1971, offers a full continuum of evidence based behavioral health and addiction services for children, adolescents, adults, and seniors throughout New Jersey. UBHC’s 1,060 experienced behavioral health professionals and support staff are dedicated to treatment, prevention, and education. UBHC, one of the largest providers of behavioral health care in the country, has a budget of $260 million and has 15 sites throughout New Jersey. Services are readily accessible and include: inpatient, outpatient, partial hospitalization, screening, crisis stabilization, family/caregiver support, community outreach and case management, supportive housing, supported employment, prevention and consultation, employee assistance programs, and a licensed therapeutic school from preschool through high school. Specialty services include the New Jersey suicide prevention helpline and peer help lines for police, veterans, active military, teachers, mothers of special needs children and child protective service workers. In FY2016, UBHC treated 16,199 consumers, had 24,502 admissions, and touched the lives of 19,441 individual callers through peer support. In addition, UBHC is the primary mental health training resource for the New Jersey departments of Human Services, Children and Families, and Corrections, delivering 16,000 trainings each year.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey is seeking a part-time Mental Health Specialist IV for the Child & Adolescent Services – Children’s Transitional Residence Department within Rutgers University Behavioral Health Care.  

  

The primary purpose of the Mental Health Specialist IV is to provide daily care and supervision to children residing in the Children’s Transitional Residence.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:  

* Supervises daily activities, such as personal care routines, meals and transportation to and from school or medical appointments.
* Implements recreational and therapeutic activities and trips appropriate to the children’s age, abilities, and therapeutic needs.
* Monitors children for a 24 hours a day program, including overnight visual checks.
* Assists in implementing on-going treatment plans.
* Prepares and serves resident meals.
* Performs daily tasks such as routine cleanup, laundry, and sanitary procedures.
* Completes on-going sanitary and safety inspection of the residence.

title: Women's Soccer Assistant Coach
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Women's Soccer Assistant Coach
  

**Posting Number** 24TM0333
  

**Department** Athletics Events - Operations
  

**Overview**
The Rutgers Division of Intercollegiate Athletics sponsors 24 intercollegiate sports, comprised of 14 women’s and 10 men’s programs, that compete at the Division I level. The Scarlet Knights are members of the prestigious Big Ten Conference, the nation’s premier academic and athletic conference, after officially joining the league on July 1, 2014. Known as “The Birthplace of College Football, Rutgers hosted Princeton on Nov. 6, 1869 in the first intercollegiate football game, with RU earning a 6-4 victory.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey is seeking a Women’s Soccer Assistant Coach for the Athletics Events – Operations department.  

  

Among the key duties of the position are the following:* Assists the Head Coach in the coordination of the women’s soccer program.
* Assists the Head Coach in developing annual goals for the program.
* Assists the Head Coach in developing and implementing strategic and tactical plans to achieve a high level of success in practices and competitions.
* Consult with the Head Coach on resolving situations when team discipline and/or academic issues arise.
* Analyzes individual and team women’s soccer statistics, techniques etc. during recruiting trips, practices and competitions and reports results to other members of the coaching staff and the team as necessary.

  

**Position Status** Part Time
  

**Hours Per Week** 40.00
  

**Daily Work Shift**
  

**Work Arrangement**
  

**FLSA** Nonexempt
  

**Position Salary** 19.00-21.00

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
* Bachelor’s degree in a related field, or an equivalent combination of education and/or experience.


  

**Certifications/Licenses**
* A valid driver’s license would be required for this position; Use of personal vehicle in order to travel for business demands.


  

**Preferred Qualifications**

title: Utilization Management Coordinator
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Utilization Management Coordinator
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Other
  

**Department** UBHC-P-VICE PRES & CEO-PISC
  

**Overview**
Rutgers University Behavioral Health Care (UBHC), established in 1971, offers a full continuum of evidence based behavioral health and addiction services for children, adolescents, adults, and seniors throughout New Jersey. UBHC’s 1,060 experienced behavioral health professionals and support staff are dedicated to treatment, prevention, and education. UBHC, one of the largest providers of behavioral health care in the country, has a budget of $260 million and has 15 sites throughout New Jersey. Services are readily accessible and include: inpatient, outpatient, partial hospitalization, screening, crisis stabilization, family/caregiver support, community outreach and case management, supportive housing, supported employment, prevention and consultation, employee assistance programs, and a licensed therapeutic school from preschool through high school. Specialty services include the New Jersey suicide prevention helpline and peer help lines for police, veterans, active military, teachers, mothers of special needs children and child protective service workers. In FY2016, UBHC treated 16,199 consumers, had 24,502 admissions, and touched the lives of 19,441 individual callers through peer support. In addition, UBHC is the primary mental health training resource for the New Jersey departments of Human Services, Children and Families, and Corrections, delivering 16,000 trainings each year.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey is seeking a Utilization Management Coordinator for the Utilization Management Department within Rutgers University Behavioral Health Care.  

  

The primary purpose of the Utilization Management Coordinator is to coordinator conduct utilization reviews to ensure that clinical services meet medical necessity and all applicable standardsfor regulatory funding and accrediting agencies.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:  

* Reviews admissions, continued stays and discharges to determine if they are consistent with established criteria. Refers to the UR Supervisor, those that require additional expertise. If criteria are not met, notifies the UR Supervisor.
* Conducts certification, pre-certification and continuing certification requirements for Medicaid, Medicare and insurance clients.
* Effectively communicates outcomes of precertification and concurrent reviews to appropriate members of the treatment team, leadership and UR Supervisor.
* Communicates routinely with UR Supervisor regarding specific reimbursement issues.
* Serves as resource for treatment team related to medical necessity interventions and documentation.
* Assists treatment team members in discharge planning in obtaining authorization for the next level of care as needed.
* Participates in data collection related to patient status and needs.
* Identifies and reports quality-of-care issues/concerns to supervisor.
* Ensures that insurance information is current with background investigation if no insurance card available.

title: Research Program Manager (Newark)
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Research Program Manager (Newark)
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Research (Laboratory/Non-Laboratory)
  

**Department** Cancer Institute of New Jersey
  

**Overview**
Through our science, our evidence-based actions, our openness, and our respect for those we serve, we will advance cancer-focused research worldwide and reduce the burden of cancer in our catchment area. By engaging with and empowering our exceptionally diverse populations, and addressing their questions and fears, we will engender hope for cancer patients and their families and play a critical role in strengthening the fabric of our communities by gaining and protecting their trust and providing access to the outstanding oncology care each person deserves.
Our mission is to accelerate scientific discovery focused on understanding cancer, innovating cancer treatment, and improving cancer prevention; to provide outstanding, novel, and compassionate patient care; to provide evidence-based and culturally informed education to physicians, nurses, researchers, staff, and the community; and to achieve cancer health equity in our state through outreach to and engagement of our extraordinarily diverse communities.
Curiosity and Discovery, Integrity, Collaboration, Cultivating Diversity, Respect and Caring, Perseverance.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey is seeking a Research Program Manager within the Rutgers Cancer Institute of New Jersey.  

The primary purpose of the Research Program Manager is to establish workflows and processes to support high-quality clinical research activities in Newark’s Office of Human Research Services. This individual is responsible for planning, supervising and monitoring the daily work of all research staff supporting these activities. Assures that all clinical research conducted within the Rutgers Cancer Institute of New Jersey is according to Good Clinical Practice(GCP) guidelines as well as applicable Institutional, State and Federal regulations and guidelines. In addition, this position is responsible for meeting the goals and objectives established by the leadership team. This position will workout of University Hospital-Newark.  

  

Among the key duties for this position are the following:* Responsible for the supervision of day-to-day clinical research coordination operations.
* Supervision and assignment of assigned team.
* Clinical research processes are patient centered.
* Training and development of staff.
* Conducts Quality Assurance audits.
* Participates in department meetings, the settings of goals and objectives consistent with budgetary, equipment, manpower and policy framework.
* Serves productively on CINJ/Department Committees:
* Works collaboratively with physician colleagues, nurses, nurse coordinators, pharmacy, reception staff, and all members of the Office of Human Research Services, Advanced Practice Nurses, appropriate hospital and laboratory staff to ensure that services are coordinated and delivered to patients in a timely manner.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.

title: Student Assistant -PD (Financial Aid Coordinator) - RBHS Piscataway
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Student Assistant -PD (Financial Aid Coordinator) - RBHS Piscataway
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Financial Aid
  

**Department** EVPAA-Financial Aid PISC
  

**Overview**
New Jersey’s academic health center, Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences (RBHS) takes an integrated approach to educating students, providing clinical care, and conducting research, all with the goal of improving human health. Aligned with Rutgers University–New Brunswick and collaborating universitywide, RBHS includes eight schools, a behavioral health network, and five centers and institutes that focus on cancer treatment and research, neuroscience, advanced biotechnology and medicine, environmental and occupational health, and health care policy and aging research.  

Our faculty are teachers, clinicians, and scientists with unparalleled experience who advance medical innovation and provide patient care informed by the latest research findings. We offer an outstanding education in medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, public health, nursing, biomedical research, and the full spectrum of allied health careers.  

Our clinical and academic facilities are located throughout the state—at Rutgers University–New Brunswick, including Piscataway; and at locations in Newark, Scotch Plains, Somerset, Stratford, and other locations. Clinical partners include Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital in New Brunswick, Newark’s University Hospital in Newark, and other affiliates.  

Through this community of healers, scientists, and scholars, Rutgers is equipped as never before to transform lives.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey is seeking a Student Assistant – Financial Aid Coordinator for the RBHS Piscataway Financial Aid Office.  

  

The duties of the Financial Aid Coordinator are to provide administrative support to the Financial Aid office, including but not limited to greeting students, and assisting the staff with time-sensitive projects. The Financial Aid Coordinator will disseminate financial aid information to students via emails and telephone calls. In addition, the candidate will assist counselors with follow-up requests and correspondences. This candidate must be able to teach and provide guidance on technical information (website, portal) to students, co-workers and work-study staff; work well with other offices and departments and be a team player. This candidate is the main point of contact for the flow of communication with students, both in-person and over the phone, to answer financial aid questions whenever possible, while referring more complex inquiries to the appropriate counselors.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:  

* Provide administrative support to the Financial Aid office, including but not limited to greeting students, and assisting the staff with time-sensitive projects.
* Disseminate financial aid information to students through emails and telephone calls, ensuring that they are informed about available financial aid options and procedures.
* Teach and provide guidance on technical information related to the university’s website and portal to students, co-workers, and work-study staff.
* Collaborate effectively with other offices and departments, working as a team player to ensure smooth operations and communication across different areas of the university.
* Act as the primary point of contact for students, both in-person and over the phone, answering their financial aid questions to the best of your ability, while referring more complex inquiries to the appropriate counselors.
* Assist financial aid counselors with follow-up requests and correspondences, ensuring that students’ needs are met in a timely and efficient manner.
* Ability to solve issues with minimum supervision.
* The ability to multi-task in a busy environment.
* Assisting Full-time staff with students’ issues.
* Technical guidance about the website and portal.

title: Administrative Coordinator Confidential
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Administrative Coordinator Confidential
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Administrative & Support
  

**Department** Office of University Labor Relations
  

**Overview**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is a leading national research university and the State of New Jersey’s preeminent, comprehensive public institution of higher education. As one of the largest employers in the State of New Jersey, Rutgers University is committed not only to the students and the State that we serve, but also to the faculty and staff who work on our campuses.  

  

  

For two consecutive years, Rutgers is ranked on Forbes’ list of America’s Best Large Employers. Rutgers holds #64 of 500 employers and is the #1 New Jersey employer on the publication’s 2023 list. Rutgers’ commitment to its employees includes maintaining and fostering a safe, diverse, and respectful workplace environment, creating employment opportunities for our nation’s military veterans, and ensuring accessibility and accommodation for individuals with disabilities.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey is seeking an Administrative Coordinator Confidential for the Office of University Labor Relations (OULR). Reporting to the Department Administrator, this position provides administrative support as well as a full range of complex and sensitive administrative functions for the entire staff of the OULR.  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* Coordinates general operations for OULR, including creating and executing schedules and maintaining organized OULR records.
* Serves as a point of contact for departments, academic units, external offices and groups, and the unions.
* Interfaces with the Office of General Counsel (OGC), University Human Resources (UHR) and other University offices and departments.
* Ensures all OULR cases, reports and other matters are on schedule to meet or exceed deadlines.

title: Delivery Driver
description:
Easy Ice continues to grow and seeks a bright, highly motivated **Delivery Driver** to join their team in the **New York City** market**.** In this role, the Driver will be responsible for ensuring timely delivery of ice to predetermined customers on specific routes, reviewing orders prior to delivery, loading and unloading trucks and providing exceptional customer service to our client base.


Enjoy great pay in fun atmospheres – restaurants, hotels, offices, warehouses – wherever ice machines are needed. If you are mechanically skilled, enthusiastic and able to forge lasting relationships among internal and external customers, we want to hear from you.

**Schedule and Location:**

* Tuesday - Saturday 10:00 am to 7:00 pm
* Wednesday - Sunday 10:00 am - 7:00 pm
* This position will report to our office at 500 Fenimore Rd, Mamaroneck, NY 10543

**Responsibilities:**

* Pack and load ice onto truck according to company’s specifications
* Deliver orders to customers in a professional manner
* Break up ice, place ice in the bin and discard the bags in trash
* Maintain ongoing communication with Dispatcher
* Obtain delivery confirmation from each customer
* Ensure that all ice in dispensing units is bagged and palletized
* Maintain the cleanliness, organization, and safety of the shop
* Clean and wrap equipment for installs
* Cross train with service technicians to assist with quick fixes
* Maintain cleanliness of vehicle ensuring all ice and trash is removed at the end of your shift
* Check vehicle fluids, wipers and tires to help maintain a long service-life
* Project a positive Automatic Icemakers brand image
* Contribute to team effort by performing other duties as assigned

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent required.
* Experienced driver
* Demonstrated track record of delivering highest level of customer satisfaction
* Must have a valid driver’s license
* Strong command of company’s policies and procedures
* Continuously evaluate and identify opportunities to drive process improvements that positively impact the customer’s experience
* A desire to continually increase your knowledge of the industries we serve; and, products, services and processes our company can produce
* Exhibit good decision making, analytical problem solving and excellent organizational abilities
* Communicate clearly and professionally, both verbally and in writing, and possess excellent interpersonal skills
* Maintain a positive, “can do” attitude
* The employee is often required to stand; walk; sit; use ladders; use hands to manipulate, handle, or feel surfaces, parts and tools; reach with hands and arms and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl
* Occasionally lift and/or move up to 75 pounds
* Stands for extended periods of time (6+ hours per day)
* While the noise level in the work environment is usually somewhat quiet, the worker may be subject to elevated noise levels
* Drive a vehicle for up to 60 percent of the hours worked
* Ability to work flexible shifts and adapt to changing work schedules

**Benefits:**

* Company Vehicle & Cell Phone
* Excellent Medical/Dental/Vision/Group Life
* 401k Company Match
* PTO and Holiday Pay
* Tuition Assistance
* Fitness Membership Reimbursement

**Pay:**

* $24-35, depending on experience

title: Bookkeeper
description:
Description:

Acker Wines is looking for a skilled Bookkeeper to join our accounting team to manage daily accounting duties. The primary function of a Bookkeeper is to keep accurate records of financial transactions, monitor accounts, and prepare monthly statements and financial reports.

**This is not a remote position.** The office is located on W. 72nd Street, New York, NY.

 **Duties & Responsibilities**

* Review all invoices for appropriate documentation and approval prior to payment.
* Responsible for reporting daily cash position.
* Posts client and consigner payments by recording cash, checks, and credit card transactions.
* Maintains all accounts payable (AP) reports, spreadsheets, and corporate accounts payable files.
* Provides support to senior accountant for any data entry necessary.
* Assist team during month-end closing.
* Responsible for filing all accounting related documents.
* Prepares analysis of accounts, as required.
* Researches and resolves invoice discrepancies and issues.
* Follows and maintains the accounts payable cycle.
* Answers all vendor inquiries.
* Resolves client and consigner questions and disputes.
* Resolves collections by knowing client and consigner payment plans, credit line etc.
* Monitors vendor’s account details.
* Assists accounting department with any ad hoc projects as necessary.


Requirements:
* Bachelor’s degree required.
* Great Plains experience highly preferred.
* Intermediate level – minimum 5 years’ experience required.
* Strong Microsoft office skills.
* Demonstrated knowledge of general bookkeeping practices.

**Core Competencies**

* Strong work ethics are required.
* Strive to do the right thing by displaying trust and integrity.
* Demonstrated ability to work independently and as a team member.
* Establish and maintain effective working relationships with the accounting department.
* Ability to self-manage, show initiative, be proactive, and drive results.
* Communicate professionally, both verbally and in writing to coworkers and customers.

**About Acker**


Established in 1820, Acker is the oldest wine shop in America and the world’s largest fine and rare wine auction house. Since third generation wine merchant John Kapon, Chairman of Acker, started the auction business in 1998, the house has gained worldwide recognition. Acker offers a vast array of services, including cellar consultations, a deep retail inventory of fine and rare wine for immediate sale, first class wine education amenities and fine and rare wine auctions.

 **Benefits**


At Acker, we are committed to supporting our employees and their families by offering a comprehensive benefits package that includes:

* Health Insurance: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage.
* Retirement Plans: 401(k) program with discretionary employer contribution.
* Paid Time Off: Vacation, sick leave, and holidays.
* Flexible Working Arrangements: Options for remote work for some positions.
* Financial Benefits: Company Sponsored Life, AD&D, and LTD benefits.
* Additional Perks: Employee discounts, commuter benefits & more.


Acker Merrall & Condit Co and its subsidiaries are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. Reasonable accommodations for disability are provided to applicants and employees in accordance with applicable law.


This job description provides an overview of the primary responsibilities and qualifications for the Bookkeeper. It is not exhaustive and may be subject to change based on the needs of the business.


Salary Range: $62,000 - $65,000 DOE

title: Logistics Coordinator
description:
The Logistics Coordinator will be responsible for creating a schedule with delivery routes, dates, and times for client's drivers to our 100+ jobsites. The Logistics Coordinator will field 200+ emails daily and calls from jobsite personnel to make this schedule. The candidate must be comfortable working in an extremely fast paced environment. The Logistics Coordinator should possess strong organizational skills, have the ability to read emails and effectively communicate with coworkers, process material requests via email, accurately count material, pull material from shelving, and load trucks. The individual we hire will have the ability to come in early, stay late, and work weekends as needed.

**Other daily tasks include, but are not limited to:**

* Coordinating with the receiving department to determine which "received” items are shipping the following day.
* Coordinating with the tooling and manufacturing departments to determine which items are shipping the following day.
* Organizing the material and tooling on the dock prior to loading trucks.
* Carefully loading trucks using pallet jacks, dollies, and carts
* Unloading trucks using pallet jacks, dollies, and carts

**Personal Skills**

* Good Attitude
* Good Communication Skills
* Ability to Adapt to sudden changes in schedule

**Applicants applying for this entry level position must meet the following criteria:**

* 18+ years old
* High School Diploma / GED
* Reliable Transportation
* Ability to use a computer and learn our company's databases to track inventory
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel
* Ability to email and correspond with jobsite management

**Physical Abilities**

* Able to climb ladders
* Able to Bend, Twist, & Pull without restrictions
* Work with hands: basic grasping/manipulation
* Work with hands over head

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $20.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

This individual will have a robust understanding of Magento or similar platforms, ERP systems, and template management for uploading product data. title: Front Desk Specialist
description:
Description:  

We are the largest multi-specialty urology focused practice in the country. Our doctors and staff are committed to providing the highest level of quality medical services available. Join our team for a rewarding career with a growing health care organization who values our staff as much as we do our patients.

**\\*\\*Monday-Friday. No weekends, no holidays\\*\\***


1. Welcomes and greets all patients and visitors, in person or over the phone


2. Answers the phone while maintaining a polite, consistent phone manner using the following proper telephone etiquette:


3. Registers new patient and updates existing patient demographics by collecting detailed patient information including personal and financial information (ex. co-payments and insurance cards)


4. Collecting patient past due balances


5. Scanning incoming faxes


6. Generate batch transmittal reports for each day


7. Facilitates the patient flow by notifying the provider or other medical staff of the patients’ arrival, being aware of delays, and communicating with patients and clinical staff


8. Responds to inquiries by patients, prospective patients, and visitors in a courteous manner


9. Keeps medical office supplies adequately stocked by anticipating inventory needs, placing orders, and monitoring office equipment


10. Protects patient confidentiality, making sure protected health information (PHI) is secured by not leaving PHI in plain sight and logging off the computer before leaving it unattended.


11. Ensures proper hand-off of responsibilities once their task is completed


12. Ensuring that all medical records are accurate and complete within the SBU for all patients


13. Ensuring compliance of healthcare regulations, medical laws and high ethical standards


14. Performs other position related duties as assigned

* Comprehensive medical
* Dental
* Vision
* 401K
* Paid time off

Minimum of 1-3 years experience in a physician office setting preferably within the urology specialty.

Demonstrate excellent organizational skills, multi-tasked abilities and the ability to perform well in stressful situations.·

Knowledge of Medical Terminology·


Typing speed at least of 55 wpm

High School Diploma

title: RF Construction Manager
description:
Description:

Job Description:


The RF Construction Manager will be responsible for overseeing the planning, design, and implementation of radio frequency (RF) network construction projects in the telecommunications industry. They will work closely with the engineering team to ensure all construction activities are aligned with the network design and meet quality, budget, and schedule requirements. The RF Construction Manager will also manage a team of construction personnel and subcontractors to ensure project objectives are met.


Responsibilities:

* Plan, design, and oversee construction activities for RF network projects
* Ensure construction activities are aligned with network design and meet quality, budget, and schedule requirements
* Manage a team of construction personnel and subcontractors to ensure project objectives are met
* Develop and maintain project schedules, budgets, and resource plans
* Identify and manage project risks and issues
* Collaborate with the engineering team to ensure successful project delivery
* Communicate project status to stakeholders and senior management
* Ensure compliance with all safety regulations and standards


Requirements:

Requirements:

* Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in RF network construction and management
* In-depth knowledge of RF network design and construction practices
* Strong project management skills, including the ability to manage project schedules, budgets, and resources
* Experience managing construction teams and subcontractors
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work effectively in a team environment
* Knowledge of safety regulations and standards in the construction industry
* Proficiency in MS Office applications and project management software

title: Retail Store Associate
description:
Category: Cashier  
Address: 253 Gordon’s Corner Rd.  
Location: Manalapan, New Jersey

**Job Description**  
Retail Store Associates play a meaningful role within the CVS Health family. At CVS Health, we’re shaping the future of health care for people, businesses, and communities. With your talents and expertise, you can help us play a more active and supportive role in each person’s unique healthcare needs. Join our team of thousands as we positively impact millions…one customer at a time.

The Retail Store Associate position provides an opportunity, in a leading retail setting, to excel in a growing, high impact, customer focused role, working both independently and as a member of a team, to positively impact the lives of others.

Essential Functions:

* Providing differentiated customer service by anticipating customer needs, demonstrating compassion and care in all interactions, and actively identifying and resolving potential service issues
* Focusing on the customer by giving a warm and friendly greeting, maintaining eye contact and offering help locating additional items, when needed
* Accurately perform cashier duties – handling cash, checks and credit card transactions with precision while following company policies and procedures
* Maintaining the sales floor by restocking shelves, checking in vendors, updating pricing information and completing inventory management tasks as directed by store manager
* Supporting opening and closing store activities, when needed
* Providing customer support to all departments, including photo and beauty, ensuring departments are fully stocked and operational while remaining current with all updated services and tools
* Assisting pharmacy personnel when needed, including working regular shifts in the pharmacy as part of opportunities for growth and career development
* **Embracing and advocating for new CVS services and loyalty programs that support our purpose of helping people on their path to better health**

**Pay Range**  
The typical pay range for this role is:  
Minimum: 15  
Maximum: 19

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.

**Required Qualifications**

* At least 16 years of age

Physical Requirements:

* Remaining upright on the feet, particularly for sustained periods of time
* Lifting and exerting up to 35 lbs of force occasionally, up to 10 lbs of force frequently, and a negligible amount of force regularly to move objects to and from, including overhead lifting
* Visual Acuity – Having close visual acuity to perform activities such as: viewing a computer terminal, reading, visual inspection involving small parts/details

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Previous experience in a retail or customer service setting

**Education**

* High School diploma or equivalent

**Business Overview**  
At CVS Health, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.

We strive to promote and sustain a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging every day. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability or protected veteran status or on any other basis or characteristic prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

title: Area Manager (Rochester, NY) - Abiomed, Inc.
description:
Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for Area Manager for Abiomed, Inc. located in Rochester, NY.

  

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

  

For more than 130 years, diversity, equity & inclusion (DEI) has been a part of our cultural fabric at Johnson & Johnson and woven into how we do business every day. Rooted in Our Credo, the values of DEI fuel our pursuit to create a healthier, more equitable world. Our diverse workforce and culture of belonging accelerate innovation to solve the world’s most pressing healthcare challenges.

  

We know that the success of our business – and our ability to deliver meaningful solutions – depends on how well we understand and meet the diverse needs of the communities we serve. Which is why we foster a culture of inclusion and belonging where all perspectives, abilities and experiences are valued and our people can reach their potential.

  

At Johnson & Johnson, we all belong.

  

In this role as an Area Manager, you and your clinical partner will be responsible for driving growth in this expansion territory. You will attend cases and provide comprehensive guidance to physicians and staff on the use of our Impella® product portfolio to drive positive outcomes. Your goal is to develop the market in a given territory to help recover hearts and save patients’ lives.

  

To be successful in your role you will need advanced knowledge in interventional cardiology, strong sales skills, and business savvy partnered with leadership and training skills that promote trust, respect and are backed by honor and integrity.

  

Responsibilities

  

* Promote & sell Impella® product line to established customers (physicians and Heart Teams including Interventional Cardiologists, Cardiac Surgeons, and Administrators).
* Identify new customers (physicians and hospitals) and lead the efforts in activating new centers.
* Create account/territory business plans and build programs.
* Exceed sales for assigned territory.
* Initiate Impella® development activities focused on increasing awareness in the market.
* Lead clinical teams whose expertise help drive Impella® adoption in assigned territory.

  

Pay Transparency:

  

The anticipated base pay range for this position is $75,000 to $100,000. The Company maintains a highly competitive sales incentive compensation program. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for participation in this program in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. This position is eligible for a company car through the Company’s FLEET program.

  

Additional information can be found through the link below.



For additional general information on Company benefits, please go to: - https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits

  

**Qualifications**
------------------



Requirements

  

* A minimum of 5+ years’ experience in cardiovascular medical device sales.
* Proven track record of selling into a Cath Lab or surgical suite.
* A proven track record in leading and motivating teams to successfully achieve quotas.
* Strong knowledge of interventional cardiology.
* Direct patient support experience.
* Availability for emergent patient care.
* Ability to drive patient outcomes.
* Ability to travel up to 50% overnight
* Conduct duties and responsibilities in accordance with all state and federal laws and regulations governing the medical device industry.

  

Preferred

  

* Bachelors degree preferred or 10 years of cardiology industry experience.
* Experience selling within assigned geography.
* Established relationships/network of Interventional Cardiologists and Cath Lab staff in the [Location] territory.
* Proven track record of technology adoption and market development.

  

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

title: Building Support Staff
description:
Description:
**POSITION SUMMARY**


The Building Support Staff will work at the Main Clubhouse. This highly visible position will maintain a safe and secure environment for all Fountain House “members” (individuals we support with serious mental health issues) and staff. Treat everyone with the dignity and courtesy consistent with the organization’s mission. This individual will work to ensure all space maintenance and safety efforts are probably coordinated and communicated.


This position demands a strong work ethic, with an ability to balance a workload with shifting priorities and deadlines amidst interruptions and time demands. Collaborative and positive attitude and tremendous flexibility are essential.


Fountain House practices the International Standards for Clubhouse Programs – a Clubhouse is a place that offers respect and an opportunity to its members – as the definition for the Clubhouse Model of Rehabilitation and agreed upon by the worldwide Clubhouse community. The principles expressed in these Standards are at the heart of the Clubhouse community’s success in helping people with mental illness stay out of hospitals while achieving social, financial, educational, and vocational goals. The Standards also serve as a “bill of rights” for members and a code of ethics for staff, board, and administrators.

**Shift:** This is a per-diem role which will be an on-call schedule as needed.

**Salary:** $20.99 per hour.


Requirements:
**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Responsible for maintaining a safe environment by ensuring proper infrastructure in terms of lighting, signage, accessibility access and ensuring codes, and safety compliance including security, fire prevention, and other safety systems are in place
* Ensure building is safe and secure by conducting timely rounds, making sure doors and windows are locked and alarm systems are functional
* Engage and work alongside staff and members, as it pertains to the functions of building safety
* Conduct daily visitor sign-in and health checks for staff and members
* Active participation in the maintenance and cleanliness of the building, including cleaning of stairs, buffing of floors, etc. when agency programs are closed
* Ensure daily cleaning of the front of the building before the building is opened, including, but not limited to shoveling snow in the winter
* Respond to emergency situations including fire, flood loss of electrical power and accidents
* Ability to work on a rotational basis, including covering shifts when necessary
* Answer phones during closed program hours, take messages properly and transfer calls accordingly
* Ability to communicate clearly and professionally, de-escalate tense and potentially hostile situations
* Create and maintain a congenial atmosphere, defuse tension and be a resourceful presence of building safety

**REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES**

* Familiarity of Fountain House and its mission
* Positive, energetic, dynamic, and engaging personality
* Team approach, and ability to accommodate flexible hours
* Basic computer proficiency (Microsoft Office) required
* Ability to lift, move or push up to 50Lbs.

**REQUIRED EDUCATION, CERTIFICATION, AND CREDENTIALS**

* High school diploma or GED required
* 1-2+ years building maintenance experience or equivalent training required
* Customer-service oriented, detail oriented and strong organizational skills
* Ability to prioritize and manage tasks in an efficient and timely manner
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Ability to work cooperatively as part of a team and independently, minimal supervision

**Physical Requirements**

* To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty and meet all physical requirements satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

title: Education Director - Early Intervention
description:
Description:
**Find your passion!**


ACP Early Intervention is looking for friendly faces, positive attitudes, and playful personalities to bring our services to life. We offer opportunities for individuals at all stages of their careers the opportunity to join a team of like-minded individuals who are passionate about changing the lives of the children and families we serve. Come grow with us!

**Who are we?**


At ACP Early Intervention, our mission is to empower families to reach their potential through early diagnosis and exceptional, innovative, interdisciplinary care. Our collaborative teams provide comprehensive care throughout all stages of a child’s development by offering these services: Applied Behavior Analysis, Speech Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Social Work, and Diagnostic Evaluations (service availability varies by location).

**What you’ll be doing at ACP Early Intervention:**

* Train and provide orientation to new center-based staff
* Conduct staff and parent workshops pertaining to topics surrounding clinical best practices; and generalization of children’s skills from center to homes
* Supervise all related service providers; teachers; and aids in the center
* Conduct weekly staff supervision, professional development plans; annual performance
* Collaborate with teachers and ensure that all children programs are appropriate and individualized
* Ensure proper data collection for all children; collecting service-delivery data and reporting performance progress both internally, and to families;
* Implement and monitor all activities directly related to the New York State Early Intervention Program and effectively manage educational and therapeutic compliance issues by reviewing all related service providers schedules to ensure all children are receiving all services approved on IFSP; ensure services are being rendered according to IFSP
* Ensure enrollment is at full capacity by being a liaison between the center and NYC EI; notifying EI on center enrollment capacity.
* Review utilization
* Attending community meetings, professional conferences, workshops to keep abreast of current trends in child development, treatment and early intervention programs
* Ensures facility complies with NYSEIP; DOH; Daycare requirements and regulations
* Oversee and collaborate with DOT vendor to ensure all DOT approved children receive expedited route coverage; problem solve and manage issues that may come up with vendor
* Substitute for classes in which the head teacher is absent or on temporary leave
* Maintain supervision files for all TA’s (i.e. performance evaluations, disciplinary action, etc.)
* For NYC Center-based program, completion of the 15- hour professional development training ( daycare) is required within 2 years of employment.

**Physical Demands**:

* Must be able to lift up to 30 lbs.
* Must be able to frequently assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) while attending to the needs of active children.
* Must be willing and able to utilize quick body movements as indicted in the Behavior Intervention Plan while working with challenging behavior.

**OUR MISSION**


Empowering families to reach their potential through early diagnosis and exceptional, innovative, interdisciplinary care.

**OUR VISION**


Transforming lives as a leader in innovative, integrated, and person-centered care.

**OUR VALUES**


Clinical excellence: Our services are evidence based, outcome driven, effective, and high quality. Collaborative: Our interdisciplinary teams work together to provide the best care. We create a relationship-driven, inclusive community where everyone’s ideas are welcome.

**Optimism and hope**:


We maintain a positive attitude and bring our clients hope. Inclusive: We value diversity and seek equity. We serve all communities, including many that are often underserved and under resourced.

**Ethical:**


We act with integrity and transparency.

**Disclaimer**


The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work necessary to adequately execute the job responsibilities. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. All information is subject to change without notice.


ACP123


Requirements:
**Education and Experience**:

* Bachelors degree in Special education or equivalent related experience.
* Certified in birth to grade 2 early childhood/special ed.
* A minimum 2 years teaching a class with 2+ years’ experience as a Supervisor in an Early Childhood setting

title: Accounts Receivable Specialist
description:
Accounts Receivable addresses the denied claims and follows up with insurance companies regarding unpaid claims. Once insurance has paid, patient responsibility is addressed with the patient. The goal of AR is to collect money payable for services provided and lowering the aging AR report.

**Essential Functions**

* Regular and reliable attendance is an essential function of this position.
* Prepare and analyze AR reports, including aging reports, collection forecasts, and revenue flow projections.
* Review reports to identify revenue opportunities and unpaid claims.
* Contact insurance carriers regarding open, pending and rejected or partially adjudicated claims and invoices, as well as preparing accounts for appeals processes.
* Follow up on open receivables, working across payers from the highest dollar value to the lowest.
* Identify coding and denial issues and communicate back to supervisor.
* Research root issue of denial and pursue proper course of appeal, as well as to follow up and obtain payment.
* Address incoming correspondence and prepare correspondence to insurance companies, patient and/or guarantor.
* Contact insurance companies/patient/guarantor to obtain status of outstanding claims and submitted appeals.
* Document the claim issue and course of action taken on every account worked.
* Escalate issues and problems to Supervisor as appropriate.
* Perform charge corrections.
* May assist with special projects as directed by Supervisor/Manager.
* Perform other related duties as assigned.

**Competencies**

* Strong attention to detail
* High degree of confidentiality
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Professional and courteous customer service
* Excellent time management and organizational skills
* High level of critical thinking and problem-solving capabilities

**Meeting Expectations**


Team/Staff meetings as scheduled.

**Supervisory Responsibilities**


None

**Work Environment**


This position operates in a typical office environment.

**Physical Demands**


Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

**Education and Experience**

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Previous experience in clerical/office support work and/or medical billing preferred.
* Candidate must demonstrate the ability to understand and navigate the payer adjudication process.
* Patient financial and practice management system experience and other electronic billing systems is preferred.
* Knowledge of medical terminology in an academic healthcare setting is preferred.

**Additional Requirements**

* Employees in this role are considered essential workers as part of the critical infrastructure.
* No prior criminal history.
* Ability to utilize technology.
* Proficient computer skills- Microsoft Office, Microsoft Outlook, Windows, specifically Excel
* Ability to operate basic office equipment.

**Disclaimer:**

*Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain an exhaustive list of all expectations, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job; employees may be required to perform additional functions. The company reserves the right to revise the job description at any time. The employee must be able to perform the essential functions of the position satisfactorily. If requested, reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of their job, absent an undue hardship.*

title: Retail Reporting Analyst
description:
Description:  

We have an opportunity for you to join the C.A. Ferolie team Montvale, NJ! We are looking for an enthusiastic Retail Reporting Analyst to work collaboratively on top-tier CPG brands with top grocery customers to deliver exceptional results.

**Overview of the Role**


The Retail Reporting Analyst will develop and maintain the go-to-market retail reporting designed to support, track, and measure key KPI’s for our clients. They will provide the analytics and insights needed to optimize pricing, promotion, distribution, displays and shelf placement to grow sales.

**What You Will Do:**

* Create and maintain analytical tools, reporting and resources driven by GSC (GoSpotCheck) Data and summarizing work being done by Retail Reps.
* Use reporting to analyze, identify distribution voids and quantify opportunity gaps.
* Track, monitor and provide actionable feedback on ACV/distribution, sales trends, shelf management.
* Utilize syndicated and consumer research to develop fact-based analysis and presentations.
* Plan, organize, and prioritize tasks to meet all deadlines; report regularly on status of projects; meet or exceed on-time and quality expectations; work closely with managers regarding all project aspects.
* Establishes professional and frequent lines of communications with clients, supervisors, associates and customers and elevates issues and opportunities in a timely manner.
* Participates in training and development programs to improve communication, organization, analytical, presentation, and negotiation skills.
* Is a "team player"; is honest and forthright with all parties; works well with peers; trains and develops subordinates; adheres in all respects to Code of Business Conduct.

**Perks**

* Paid holidays
* Medical/Dental/Vision/VTL
* Flexible Spending Account
* Company-paid Life/AD&D Insurance
* 401K Match
* Generous PTO

**Who We Are**


At C.A. Ferolie, we pride ourselves on maintaining strong traditions of excellence, providing our valued clients with tailored sales and marketing solutions since 1947. Our teams are enthusiastic, experienced, and knowledgeable people who consistently exceed expectations. We are family-owned and operated, giving us unparalleled flexibility to invest locally in talent and development that delivers industry-leading results.


Requirements:
* Associate or Bachelor’s Degree, preferably with a major or minor concentration in Food Marketing, Marketing, or Communications or 1-2 years of experience.
* Must know basic arithmetic operations such as addition, subtraction, division, and multiplication to accurately calculate budgets, net sales, margins, promotional percentages, discounts, and commissions.
* Ability to calculate figures and apply concepts to sales velocity ratios, days of supply, pallet configurations, and sales forecasting. and proportions to practical situations.
* Must possess critical thinking skills like analysis, evaluation, and synthesis, as well as abstract thinking, creative thinking, information processing, and problem-solving. Ability to prioritize workload and set goals.
* Have a working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, including but not limited to Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Working knowledge of Trade Promotion Software Programs will be required.

title: Warehouse Associate
description:
**Are you ready to join one of the biggest names in Healthcare Technology Management?**

**Are you ready to be part of something special...**

**This is your opportunity to get in the door as we EXPLODE in growth!**


If you are energetic and passionate -> YOU NEED TO APPLY

 **Who We Are:**


Founded by Philip Revien and Michael Fischer in 2014, 626 provides maintenance expertise on all medical technology equipment manufacturers and modalities. Philip and Michael first met in the maternity ward of a South Florida hospital on June 26, 2012, the day each of their sons were born. The vision for 626 (a tribute to their sons’ birth dates) was also born that day.


The pair began talking and soon realized they shared a common goal— improving patient care. Two years later, 626 was established. What began as two men in a garage, 626 now employs more than 100 employees nationwide and has emerged as one of the fastest-growing third-party company in the healthcare technology management market

**Summary/Objectives**

  

Looking for a dedicated individual with considerable warehouse experience to join our team as a Warehouse Inventory Specialist. We are seeking a detailed-orientated candidate for this flexible opportunity. We are seeking a full-time candidate who is reliable, safe, and self-motivated.


Ideal candidate will have additional experience in inventory control, inventory audits, maintaining ISO standards for continuous process improvement, operational efficiency, shipping software, and warehouse operations.

 **Essential Responsibilities**

* Maintaining serialized inventory log
* Maintaining log of equipment shipped as loaners to customers
* Maintaining log of equipment and parts shipped as exchangeable items to customers
* Perform general duties such as inventory cycle counts, and requesting procurement team to order as needed to follow stock-out quantities
* Examine shipment contents and compare with records, such as manifests, invoices, or orders, to verify accuracy.
* Requisition and store shipping materials and supplies to maintain inventory of stock
* Working knowledge of inventory locations and on hand stock
* Prepare documents, such as purchase orders, work orders, bills of lading, or shipping orders, to route materials.
* Pack, seal, label, or affix postage to prepare materials for shipping, using hand tools, power tools, or postage meter.
* Record shipment data, such as weight, charges, space availability, damages, or discrepancies, for reporting, accounting, or record keeping purposes.
* Confer or correspond with establishment representatives to rectify problems, such as damages, shortages, or non-conformance to specifications.
* Deliver or route materials to departments using forklift or pallet jack.
* Frequently lift and/or move 25 and 50 pounds.

**Work Environment**


This job operates in a warehouse setting.

**Physical Demands**


The physical requirements that are essential to perform this job are.

**Education and Experience**

* High School Diploma or GED Required
* Reviewing and processing warehouse stock products
* Inventory logs and cycle counts
* Packing and shipping
* Operating forklift or other heavy machinery
* Some College or Degree Preferred

 **Benefits:**

* Medical
* Dental
* Vision
* Health Savings Account
* 401(k) with Employer Matching
* Life Insurance
* Paid Time Off

title: Physical Therapy Aide
description:
Job Title: Physical Therapy Aide **Job Type: Part-time**  

Location: Woodbridge, NJ  

Company: SportsCare Physical Therapy  

About Us:
SportsCare Physical Therapy is a leading provider of physical therapy and rehabilitation services, committed to helping individuals achieve their health and fitness goals. We are looking for a motivated and compassionate Physical Therapy Aide to join our team and support our mission of providing exceptional patient care.
Job Description:
As a Physical Therapy Aide at SportsCare Physical Therapy, you will play a crucial role in supporting our clinical team and ensuring that our patients receive the highest quality of care. You will work directly with physical therapists, physical therapist assistants, and patients, assisting in the delivery of treatment and promoting a positive and supportive clinic environment.
Responsibilities:* Assist with Patient Care: Provide direct support to patients during their therapy sessions, following the guidance of the physical therapist or physical therapist assistant. This may involve assisting with exercises, equipment setup, and ensuring patient safety.
* Prepare Treatment Areas: Set up treatment areas and equipment, ensuring they are clean, organized, and ready for patient use.
* Patient Education: Assist in patient education by explaining exercises, proper form, and treatment goals as directed by the clinical team.
* Maintain Cleanliness: Keep treatment areas, exercise equipment, and therapy rooms clean and sanitized to maintain a safe and hygienic environment.
* Laundry and Supplies: Assist with laundry duties, such as washing and folding linens, towels, and other materials. Monitor and restock supplies as needed.
* Patient Records: Maintain accurate and confidential patient records, including tracking and documenting patient progress and adherence to exercise programs.
* Equipment Maintenance: Ensure that therapy equipment is properly maintained and report any equipment issues to the appropriate staff.
* Communication: Effectively communicate with patients, physical therapists, and other team members to facilitate a smooth patient experience.
  

Qualifications:* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with a compassionate and patient-focused attitude.
* Ability to follow instructions and work as part of a team.
* Basic knowledge of anatomy, physiology, and medical terminology is beneficial.
* Physical stamina and the ability to lift and move equipment and assist patients as required.
* Commitment to patient privacy and confidentiality.

Benefits:* Competitive compensation.
* Opportunities for professional growth and advancement in the healthcare field.
* Collaborative and supportive team environment.
* The chance to make a meaningful impact on patients' rehabilitation journeys.
  

If you are a compassionate and motivated individual interested in healthcare and physical therapy, we encourage you to apply for the position of Physical Therapy Aide at SportsCare Physical Therapy. Join our team and help us create a positive and supportive environment for our patients as they work towards their health and fitness goals. *Note: We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

title: Paralegal
description:
**The Position**


Phillips & Associates seeks a Paralegal to join our team in the Princeton, New Jersey office. This position supports the firm’s efforts prosecuting civil claims alleging sexual harassment, discrimination, and wage theft.

**The Firm**


Phillips & Associates has established itself as the go-to law firm in New York for victims of sexual harassment and discrimination. Most recently, Phillips & Associates was selected as one of the “10 Best Employment & Labor Law Firms” in New York” by the American Institute of Legal Counsel. Additionally, many of our attorneys have achieved “best of” status in employment law. We only represent plaintiffs, not employers or management.

**Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**

* Prepare state and federal pleadings and civil cover sheets
* File court documents electronically
* Prepare and monitor the service of the complaints
* Draft and filing EEOC Charges and responses
* Draft various correspondence and legal documents
* Draft interrogatories and document requests
* Work with clients and assist in responding to discovery requests
* Work with clients to obtain information requests via email, fax, or standard mail and maintain organization of information
* Coordinate and conduct meetings with clients
* Compile, organize and bate stamp discovery responses
* Draft and respond to subpoenas
* Conduct legal research on various employment issues
* Prepare trial materials and binders if necessary
* Calendar court appearances, depositions, mediations, and client appointments
* Handle incoming mail for supervising attorneys and prepare and send all outgoing mail
* Prepare equipment for remote mediations or depositions taking place at the Phillips & Associates office

**Job Qualifications**

* Education: Bachelor's degree
* Experience: 1-2 years of related experience

**Skills**

* Excellent verbal and written communication
* Active listening
* Critical thinking
* Time management
* Coordination
* Judgment and decision making
* Monitoring


Phillips & Associates is an equal opportunity employer. We value a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture. Phillips & Associates encourages applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, marital status, citizenship, disability, and veteran status.

title: Press Brake Operator — AMADA HG 1303
description:
**Job Summary:**  
We are seeking a skilled Press Brake Operator to join our team. The ideal candidate will have experience operating press brake machines and a strong mechanical aptitude. This is a great opportunity for someone looking to grow their career in metal fabrication.

The press brake operator will use an **Amada HG1303** to bend, shape, cut, and manipulate sheet and metal plates.

**Duties/Responsibilities:**

* Operates a press brake to manufacture tools, equipment, and other components from sheet metal or metal plates
* Set up and operate press brake to form/bend metal to blueprint/drawing specifications for varied runs and sizes for all types of parts
* Selects proper tooling based on the material being formed
* Prepares, sets up, and adjusts press brake as required by product plans and production schedules
* Ensures that there is sufficient raw material available
* Measure and align the material to be used
* Inspect products, evaluating finished pieces for compliance with quality standards and specifications
* Performs routine maintenance on the press brake
* Read and interpret blueprints to determine the specifications of the parts
* Perform quality checks on completed parts to ensure accuracy
* Work with CNC equipment for precision bending

**What the position requires:**

* Prior experience operating press brake machines in a manufacturing environment
* Ability to read blueprints
* Must be able to read and understand job orders, drawings/blueprints and other data and perform all the necessary calculations
* Excellent organizational and time management skills
* Strong communication skills
* Able to follow written and verbal instructions

We currently run approximately 200+ projects on a daily basis and our projects range from small residential buildings to large commercial high rise. We have three UL 90 Min Fire Rated Label Certifications; one being the only company to acquire a 10-foot label.

What sets us apart from all other companies is our in-house engineering staff, with direct access to creativity, our hands-on Project Managers, and our in-depth experience with all facets of fabrication & Installation. We are self-sufficient without exposure to outsourcing any process in our manufacturing. Our facility is fully equipped to handle any project of any size.

The post holder will be joining a growing organization that specializes in the design, production, and installation of high-end elevator cab interiors and entrances. We work with a variety of materials and utilize cutting-edge technology to achieve sophisticated aesthetics with special attention to detail that our customers require.

A & D Entrances recruitment processes are handled by our in-house recruitment team. If you are an agency enquiring about partnering with us on recruitment, please direct your correspondence solely to the recruitment team and please do not submit speculative applications under any circumstances.

title: Housekeeping Manager
description:
The Housekeeping Manager is responsible for overseeing the day-to-day operational needs of the Sanctuary Property, including but not limited to the housekeeping department, this position requires an individual to join the leadership team in overseeing the operations of the building while ensuring the completion of all objectives, adherence to the property’s rules and regulations, and the safety and cleanliness of the property at all times.

The Housekeeping Manager is responsible for ensuring an efficient operation of the Housekeeping Department in providing assignments to team members in accordance with union agreements to accomplish a clean and safe environment while efficiently managing expenses and focusing on adhering to building standards.

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS**

· Maintain complete knowledge of and comply with all departmental policies/service procedures/standards.

· Motivate, coach, counsel and discipline all Housekeeping personal according to Hotel’s SOP’s

· Maintain complete knowledge of correct maintenance and use of equipment.

· Anticipate internal/external guests’ needs, respond promptly and acknowledge all guests, however busy and whatever time of day.

· Supervise, train and inspect the performance of assigned Housekeeping department ensuring that all procedures are completed to the hotel's standards

· Co-ordinate efficiently with other department heads and DHS provider onsite as needed

· Cover MOD shifts and responsibilities as required

· Monitor and maintain cleanliness, sanitation and organization of assigned work areas.

· Ensure that assigned staff have reported to work and clocked in properly; document any late or absent employees, monitoring time and attendance.

· Coordinate staff duties on a daily, and weekly basis

· Prepare and distribute assignment sheets to assigned staff and review priorities.

· Assign designated hotel equipment to staff and secure and accurate record of such.

· Inspect areas on a housekeeping perspective

· Ensure monthly inventories are completed and invoices, PO’s are submitted in a timely manner

QUALIFICATIONS

· Housekeeping management level experience in hotel industry.

· Union, local 6 experience a plus.

· Knowledge of IWA.

· Knowledge of payroll practices.

· Knowledge of proper cleaning techniques and chemical handling, requirements and use of equipment.

· Ensure compliance with all Risk Management Standards (MSDS, HazComm, Life/Safety)

· Fluency in English both verbal and non-verbal. Provide legible communication.

· Compute mathematical calculations.

· Ability to:

o perform job functions with attention to detail, speed and accuracy.

o prioritize and organize.

o Be a clear thinker, remaining calm and resolving problems using good judgement.

o follow directions thoroughly.

o work cohesively with co-workers as part of a team.

o work with minimal supervision.

o maintain confidentiality of hotel information and pertinent hotel data.

o ascertain departmental training needs and provide such training.

o direct performance of staff and follow up with corrections when needed.

**Knowledge/Skills/Abilities Required:**

* Must be able to work a flexible schedule, including all shifts, weekends and holidays.
* Must understand the operations of a Sanctuary building
* Must be able to follow detailed procedures
* Communication skills are required along with the ability to report and document.
* Must be dependable and responsible as building manager on duty
* Must project a professional image and maintain company standards
* Strong integrity, ethics, and emotional control
* Knowledge of systems - ADP, Unifocus, Birchstreet, Infor PMS, and Microsoft teams, word and excel preferred.

**Job Requirements:** 

· High school graduate or equivalent vocational training certificate, some college

· A minimum of 3 years in a leadership role

· Fluency in English both verbal and non-verbal

**Ability To:**

· Successful problem-solving skills and personal judgment, while prioritizing, organizing, and follow directions thoroughly

· Must possess clear, concise written and verbal communication skills

· Work cohesively with co-workers as part of a team

· Work with minimal supervision

· Maintain the confidentiality of guest information and pertinent hotel data

· Maintain the confidentiality of company information and pertinent data

· Willing and able to work shift duties that may include evenings, nights, weekends and holidays

· Must possess ability to plan, execute and run projects while possess a drive for sustainability

· Ability to stand, walk and move around during entire shift

· Stand, sit, or walk for an extended period of time

· Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 15 pounds without assistance

**Incentives:**

* A competitive compensation package.
* The rate for this role is between $70-$85 DOE
* PTO, holiday, and sick time off
